loans.name: Enagnon Group

texts.fr:
ENAGNON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies qui vendent toutes dans le même marché de Missèbo à Cotonou (Capitale économique du Bénin). Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité et de faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe s'est rapproché de ALIDé, en vue de l'obtention d'un deuxième prêt.
La présidente du groupe, Gérardine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est née le 22 Avril 1960 à Adjohoun dans le département de l'Ouémé. Gérardine est mariée à Albert et est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont un reste à sa charge. Gérardine s'est installée depuis trente ans à Kpankpan à Cotonou, où elle vit avec son mari et son enfant encore à sa charge. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Gérardine a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire et a appris ensuite la couture, activité qu'elle exerce depuis une douzaine d'année et qui lui procure des revenus l'aidant à subvenir à ses besoins. Parallèlement à cette activité, Gérardine vend des fiperies au marché de Missèbo à Cotonou. Dans le but de rehausser son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de plus en plus forte de la clientèle, Gérardine sollicite pour une deuxième fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé. Son ambition est d'avoir plus tard sa propre boutique.
texts.en:
ENAGNON is a group composed of three people, whose members are friends who all sell in the same market in Missèbo in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. In order to bolster their businesses and meet customer demand, this group has come to Kiva's partner, ALIDé, to seek a second loan.

The leader of the group, Géraldine (raising her hand in the photograph) was born on April 22, 1960 in Adjohoun, in Ouémé Department. She's married to Albert and is the mother of four children, who all attended school. She still has one child to support. 30 years ago, she moved in to Kpankpan in Cotonou, where she lives with her husband and the child she still supports. The couple takes care of the various household expenses together.

Géraldine dropped out of middle school and learned sewing, an activity she's been doing for about twelve years and from which she draws an income helping her provide for herself. In parallel, she sells used clothing at the Missèbo market in Cotonou. With the goal of bolstering her business and better meeting an ever-increasing customer demand, Géraldine is seeking a second loan from ALIDé. Her ambition is to have her own shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy used clothing

loans.name: Bikira

texts.en: Bikira is a 42-year-old married man with six children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. Bikira has been dealing in produce for ten years and with the income generated he has been able to pay his children's school fees. His hardship is price fluctuation. His vision is a big coffee store and construction of a commercial building in town. Bikira needs the loan to buy coffee to sell.

loans.use: To buy coffee.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis Fernando A.  es un hombre luchador quien hace ya varios años vende relojes y accesorios para sacar a su familia adelante, comenzó como vendedor ambulante, pero por su emprendimiento y disciplina fue guardando las utilidades que sus ventas le dejaban hasta que pudo comprar una chazita, la cual le permitía tener sus productos en un espacio organizado. Luis Fernando es soñador, y con la ilusión de ver crecer su negocio poco a poco fue consiguiendo un puesto fijo y estable donde atender a sus clientes.
Actualmente, arregla relojes, y vende todo tipo de accesorios como correas, gorras, manillas, entre otros. Luis Fernando no cuenta con el capital suficiente para comprar mercancía y así ofrecerles a sus clientes mayor variedad de productos, su mayor anhelo es algún día poder tener un gran almacén y que sea reconocido por tener productos de calidad, con estilo y mucha variedad.
texts.en:
Luis Fernando A. is a determined man who has been selling watches and accessories for several years now in order to get his family ahead in life.  He started out as an itinerant street vendor but, with his entrepreneurship and discipline, he saved his profits from his sales until he was able to buy a small location where he could keep his products in an organized space.

Luis Fernando is a dreamer and, with the hope of watching his business grow, he gradually obtained a fixed and stable sales location from which he could serve his customers.  He currently mends watches and sells all kinds of accessories such as belts, caps, wristbands, etc.  Luis Fernando doesn't have enough capital to buy merchandise and thereby offer his customers a wider variety of products.  His biggest wish is to some day own a large store and be well known for offering good-quality, stylish products and a lot of variety.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (watches) so that he can offer his customers more variety

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Ángela A. L.  y su familia son grandes emprendedores, que a partir de sus trabajos independientes en negocios,  han logrado sacar adelante su hogar del cual tienen dos hijos en las edades de 20 y 23 años,  a quienes sueñan verlos muy exitosos y cada día progresando. Mientras el esposo de Ángela tiene una tienda desde hace 20 años, ella hace dos, creó nuevas oportunidades de generar ingresos para su familia, pues emprendió el negocio de vender   prendas de plata, mediante el sistema de crédito a clientes muy bien seleccionados y  muchos de ellos en la actualidad le han solicitado joyas de oro, pero Angela es una mujer pensante y por ahora está construyendo el capital para poder invertir en este nuevo producto que  requiere más dinero.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará pulseras, cadenas, aretes, tobilleras anillos y dijes de plata, que tiene encargado a propósito del día de las madres, pues muchos clientes quieren agasajar a todas las mujeres de sus familias mediante un regalo que comprarán a Ángela. Su sueño y gran desafío es la apertura de un local dedicado a la venta de joyas, donde la exhibición de sus prendas, despierten la atención, el interés y la acción de compra, por parte de muchas personas que muy seguramente se convertirán en clientes de Ángela. Mientras esto ocurre ella continuará esmerándose por aumentar su capital de trabajo y manejando un margen de utilidad no menor de un 29%.
texts.en:
Ángela A. L. and her family are great entrepreneurs.  Through their work in their own businesses, Ángela and her husband have managed to get the members of their household ahead in life.  They have two children, aged 20 and 23, and they dream of seeing them become very successful and making progress each day.

Ángela's husband has owned a store for 20 years.  Two years ago, Ángela created new opportunities for making income for her family.  She started a business selling silver jewelry.  She started selling on credit to very carefully selected customers, many of whom are currently requesting gold jewelry from her as well.  However, Ángela is a thinking woman and right now she is gathering together the capital she needs to invest in this new product which requires more money.

Ángela is currently applying for her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy silver bracelets, chains, earrings, anklets, rings and charms which she has orders for, for Mother's Day.  Many customers would like to celebrate all the women in their family with a gift that they will buy from Ángela.

Ángela's dream is also her big challenge.  She would like to open a sales location where she can sell her jewelry and display her products.  This will awaken people's attention and interest and lead them to buy from her.  Very probably, many people will become Ángela's customers.  While she works towards this, she will continue putting a lot of effort into increasing her working capital and maintaining a profit margin of no less than 29%.

loans.use: to buy silver bracelets, chains, earrings, anklets, rings and charms

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es: Herminia es integrante D. la Alcancia Comunal “Nuevo Amanecer” hace 30 anos se dedica a la agricultura  posee una chacra en donD.  siembra y cosecha Paltas y chirimoya, a sus 77 anos, es viuda. Herminia nos manifiesta que junto a su hermano tomo la decision D. adquirir una pequena chacra que actualmente le ayuda en su economia familiar. Ademas en su vivienda alquila habitaciones. Hermina ha logrado con su esfuerzo construir su casa y educar a sus hijos, actualmente cubre sus gastos D. alimentacion y D. servicios basicos. Tiene como meta en el futuro ayudar asus hijos en la formacion y educacion D. sus nietos. Herminia es una socia puntual y responsable que invertirá el crédito en la compra D. abono y fertilizantes basicos para su chacra demas D. otros y junto a los demas integrantes D. “Nuevo Amanecer” estan agradecidos por el prestamo recibido y estan comprometidos en el programa Properidad.
texts.en:
Herminia is a member of the "Nuevo Amanecer" (New Dawn) community bank.  She has been farming for 30 years and owns a farm where she grows and harvests avocados and 'chirimoyas' (custard apples).  Herminia is 77 years old and a widow.  She tells us that, together with her brother, she took the decision to buy a small farm which currently helps her financially.  Herminia also rents out rooms in her home.  She has managed, through her efforts, to build her own home and educate her children.  She currently covers her food expenses and basic service expenses.

Herminia's goal for the future is to help her children with the upbringing and education of her grandchildren.  Herminia is a punctual and responsible member of her bank and she will invest her loan in buying manure and basic fertilizers for her farm.  Both Herminia and the other members of "Nuevo Amanecer" are grateful for the loan they have received and are committed to EDAPROSPO's Prosperidad (Prosperity) program.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure for her farm

loans.name: Elva Gloria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “OLLANTAY D. WAYRACPUNCU”; Este banco está ubicado en la Provincia D. Urubamba y  departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elva; es casada; la socia tiene 71 años D. edad; la socia tiene 5 hijos, sus hijos ya son independientes y todos casados viven fuera D. su casa; la socia se dedica a la ganadería, ella tiene vacas lecheras, la socia venD. a las escuelas D. preferencia; ella es esposa del socio Augusto; la socia tiene este negocio desD. hace años pero vendiendo la leche a los colegios y al prona desD. hace 3 años, la socia desea comprar caballos, ella requiere el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra D. caballos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. caballos.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. dicho préstamo D. forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "Ollantay D. Wayracpuncu". This bank is located in the Urumbamba province and the department of Cusco.
The member is Elva. She is married and 71 years old. She has 5 children, and her children are already independent and all are married and live in their own homes. The member works in the livestock traD.. She has dairy cows and she sells her produce to the schools. She is married to Augusto, who is also a member of the bank. She has had this business for many years, but has been selling milk to the schools and to PRONA (a government program that provides milk to school children) for three years. The member wants to buy horses and she needs the money to be able to invest in buying them. She is requesting the money to buy horses.
The member is very grateful for the loan and promises to complete the repayments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de caballos.

loans.name: Wilmore Antonio

texts.es: Wilmore Antonio tiene 50 años, se dedica a la venta de accesorios, lubricantes para vehículos y repuestos para teléfonos. Hace más de 22 años que tiene este negocio, es asistido por él personalmente ya que siempre está buscando como brindarles a sus clientes el mejor servicio. A pesar que Wilmore es hombre de avanzada edad, está plenamente lleno de sueños y metas que dice él aún no culmina. Desea poder mejorar su calidad de vida y para ello trabaja día con día con la esperanza y fe puesta en Dios que algún día lo logrará. El crédito lo invertirá en insumos como  compra de llantas, espejos, tapizado, radios, lubricantes entre otros.
texts.en:
Wilmore Antonio is 50 years old.  He sells vehicle accessories and lubricants and spare parts for telephones.  He has been in this business for more than 22 years.  He serves in his business himself since he is always looking for ways to provide his customers with the best service possible.

In spite of the fact that Wilmore is a man who is getting on in years, he is full of dreams and goals that he says he still hasn't fulfilled.  He would like to be able to improve his quality of life and, for that reason, he works every day with hope and faith in God that some day he will achieve this.  WIlmore will invest his loan in buying supplies such as tires, mirrors, upholstery, radios, lubricants, etc.

loans.use: to buy tires, mirrors, upholstery, radios, lubricants, etc.

loans.name: Isabel Maria

texts.es:
Isabel de 56 años, una mujer inspiradora en sacar adelante a su familia por eso decidió abrir su local de comida para así ayudar a su esposo que no tenia empleo.

Ella labora diariamente con la ayuda de su esposo. Ella hace la preparación de las comidas y el las vende en el pequeño local que tiene. Le afecta en su negocio la delincuencia por que su sector cada vez esta peligroso. Con el préstamo quiere comprar cocinas industrial y la comprar de alimentos para la preparación de la comida y así aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Isabel, age 56, is an inspirational woman when it comes to getting her family ahead.  She decided to open a food business to help her husband, who was not employed.

She works every day with her husband’s help.  She does the food preparation, and he sells it at the small place that she has.

Delinquency affects her business because it is dangerous in her area.

She wants to use the loan to buy industrial kitchenware and ingredients for food preparation.  That way she will increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy industrial Kitchenware and food.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María, tiene 37 años de edad, es originaria del departamento de Estelí, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos de 18,12 y 8 años  de edad respectivamente todos están estudiando, para ella representa su tesoro mas preciado ya que es por ellos que ella se levanta cada día para trabajar y ganarse honradamente el sustento familiar. Ella es dueña de un taxi el cual adquirió atraves de unos ahorros que ella fue adquiriendo por medio de unas remesas que le envían una familiar que vive en Estados Unidos con ese dinero que ella ha ahorrado fue que compro el taxi que es el negocio con el que ha mantenido económicamente a  su familia, también anteriormente ella vendía cosméticos. Hoy en día ella tiene a un trabajador que le hace el  turno desde la 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, el es conductor de taxi.
Solicito el préstamo para realizarle arreglos al carro, comprarle un juego de llantas, realizarle un cheque  mecánico general al taxi. Ella espera que con os nuevos cambios que le realice al taxi podrá ofrecer un mejor servicios a sus pasajeros, estabilidad económica.
Desea en un futuro poder renovar su carro, comprar otro un poco mas moderno, ya que el que tiene esta un  poco  viejo. Su meta principal y la mas importante es sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que es por ellos que hace cualquier sacrificio quiere verlos con sus respectivas carreras profesionales.
texts.en:
María, age 37, is from the Estelí department.  She is a single mother, and she has three children; ages 18, 12, and 8.  All of them go to school.  To her they represent her most valuable treasure.  It is for them that she gets up every day to work and honorably earn the family's support.

She owns a taxi. She got it with the savings she was getting through remittances that a relative who lives in the United States was sending her.  With the money she had saved she bought the taxi.  It is the business that has supported her family.  Also, she previously sold cosmetics.

She now has a worker who takes a shift from six in the morning until nine at night.  He is a taxi driver.

She is requesting the loan to fix up the car.  She will buy a set of tires, and she will have a general mechanical check performed.  She hopes that with the new changes to the taxi she will be able to offer her passengers better service.  She also hopes for financial stability.

In the future she wishes to be able to renovate her car.  She wants to be able to buy another one that is a little more modern because the one she has is a little old.

Her primary and most important goal is to get her children ahead.  It is for them that she makes any and all sacrifices.  She wants to see her children have professional careers.

loans.use: to fix up the car, to buy a set of tires, and to have a general mechanical check performed.

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es:
Carlos de 58 años, es un hombre trabajador que inicio su actividad en el taller de calzado de su padre cuando el falleció y  también alquilas departamentos.

El labora diariamente en el taller de calzados y cobrándole en cada quincena a  sus inquilinos. Le dificultad realizar los calzados cuando la gente se le va a quejar porque no le entregan a tiempo lo que ellos piden. Sus hijos están casados y viven fueran del país. 

Con el préstamo desea comprar materiales de confección de calzados para incrementar sus ingresos como pegamento, cuero, parches. En un futuro seguir en el negocio y terminar de arreglar sus departamentos de alquiler para un mejor acabado.
texts.en:
Carlos, age 58, is a hard-working man.  He started his business activity, a shoe shop, when his father died.  He also rents apartments.

He works every day in his shoe shop, and he collects from his renters every two weeks.  It is difficult for him to work on the shoes when people are going to complain to him because he does not deliver what they want on time.

His children are married and live outside of the country.

He wishes to use the loan to buy materials to make shoes in order to increase his earnings.  He will buy things like glue, leather, and patches.  

In the future he will continue with the business.  He will also finish fixing up the apartment rentals with better finishing touches.

loans.use: to buy glue, leather, and patches.

loans.name: Akouegnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "AKOUEGNON" est formé de trois  personnes qui habitent  la même localité. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Marcelline, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Marcelline, est mariée à un certain william. Le couple a deux  enfants à charge, qui ne sont pas scolarisés.  Marcelline, habite au quartier Sènadé  à Cotonou (Capitale économique du Bénin) avec ses enfants et son mari depuis deux ans. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Il y a près de deux ans que Marcelline, mène comme activité, la vente de friperies à Cotonou. Parallèlement à cela elle vend des produits cosmétiquies . Marcelline, s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Marcelline, désire obtenir un crédit avec les autres membres de son groupe.
texts.en:
AKOUEGNON group is composed of three people who live in the same community. The leader of the group, named Marcelline, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. The group is seeking its second loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses.

Marcelline is married to one William. The couple has two children to support, who do not attend school. Marcelline has been living in the Sènadé neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, with her children and her husband, for two years. The couple takes care of the various family expenses together.

For about two years ago, Marcelline has been selling used clothing in Cotonou. In parallel, she sells cosmetics. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, an international marketplace in Benin. With the goal of bolstering her stock and better meeting customer demand, she would like to get a loan with the other members of her group.

loans.use: to buy used clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Angel Vicente

texts.es:
Ángel de 63 años, es un hombre inspirador que hace 27 años abrió su propio taller de tapicería. Poco a poco a incrementado su cliente con diferentes estrategias. 

En la actualidad el trabaja en su taller todos los días de 7H00 am a 18H00 pm solo cuando tiene mucho trabajo contrata a una persona que lo ayuda. Le dificultad en su trabajo la delincuencia  ya que un día le quisieron robar cuando tenía materiales del negocio.

Con el préstamo quiere renovar sus maquinas que trabajos poder aumentar su ingresos. En un futuro quiere terminar la parte de arriba de su casa y que su negocio siga adelante.
texts.en:
Angel, who is 63 years old, is an inspiring man. Some 27 years ago, he opened his own upholstery shop. Little by little, he has built his customer base, using differing strategies.

At present, Angel works in his shop every day from 7:00 am until 6:00 pm. When he has a lot of work, he contracts another person to help him. The main difficulty in his business is delinquency. One day there was an attempted robbery when he had a lot of materials in his business.

With this loan, he wishes to buy new machinery so he can take on added work and increase his income. In the future, he wants to finish the upper story of his house, and see his business advancing.

loans.use: to buy machinery and materials for his upholstery business.

loans.name: Las Palomitas Group

texts.es: Maria Luz es madre de 4 hijos, de los cuales tres son jovenes, residen en un centro poblado de Huarochiri junto a su conviviente. Maria Luz se dedica a  la venta de  de cosmeticos de dos reconocidas companias de productos de belleza desde hace 12 meses.ademas en temporada de verano comercializa sandalias de todo tipo. María Luz empezó como ayudante en la venta de estos productos para luego convertirse en una buena vendedora, junto a su conyuge han logrado darle estudio  a sus hijos ademas de lograr su independencia en lo comercial. Maria luz apoya en su hogar con los gastos de estudios de sus jovenes hijos. Ella suena con la compra de un terreno y construirlo y aperturar una bodega para ofercer variedad de productos. El reciente credito sera invertido en la compra de productos de belleza como : colonias y champús a precios rebajados con lo cual lograra tener mayores ganancias y de esta forma ampliara su stock en esta temporada. Maria Luz y sus companeras son 7 en total y el nombre de la joven Alcancia Comunal “Las Palomitas” se debe a la calle por donde residen todos los socios.  La Alcom “Las Palomitas tienen 4 meses de participacion en el programa prosperidad y estan siendo responsables con su compromiso de pago cada mes.
texts.en: María Luz is the mother of four children, three are young children. They live in a population center in Huarochiri with her partner. She has sold cosmetics from two well-known beauty product companies for the past 12 months. In addition, during the summer, she sells many types of sandals. María Luz started out as a sales assistant for these products. Then later, she became a good salesperson. Together with her partner, they have been able to give an education to their children. In addition, they have achieved business independence. María Luz helps her household by providing the funds for the children’s studies. She wants to purchase a plot of land. Then she wants to build and open a store in order to offer a variety of products. The loan will be invested in the purchase of beauty products like: colognes and shampoos at reduced prices. She will have larger profits and she will be able to expand her inventory at this time. María Luz and her partners make up a group of seven. The name of the communal bank is “Las Palomitas”. The name “Las Palomitas” comes from the name of the street where all the members live. The communal bank has had four months of participation in this prosperity program and they are responsible with their commitment to pay each month.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics like colognes and shampoo to increase inventory

loans.name: Juan Celestino

texts.es: Don Juan Celestino T. C., es casado, tiene 49 años de edad, cursó sus estudios primarios, tiene 2 hijos los cuales estan estudiando, se dedica al comercio, a la venta de chumpas de cuero, lleva 9 años de experincia en este trabajo, inició vendiendo suéteres; cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica a la costura o confección de tejidos. Decide solicitar a ASDIR un préstamo que servirá para ampliar su capital de trabajo, ya que va a comprar chumpas de cuero para la reventa. Quiere tener un negocio mas grande y en el futuro contar con locales propios.
texts.en:
Juan is married, 49 years old, and completed his primary school studies. He has 2 children, both of whom are in school. Juan is a merchant and sells leather jackets. For 9 years he has been in this business, having begun by selling sweaters. He is aided by his wife who is a seamstress and weaves fabrics.

Juan has decided to solicit a loan through ASDIR so that he can buy leather jackets to resell. He wants to have a bigger business and in the future, to have his own stores.

loans.use: to buy leather jackets for resale.

loans.name: Lorena Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lorena de 36 años, es una mujer inspirada en su familia decidió encontrar una actividad economica. Comenzo con la preparación de condimentos y también en la venta de víveres para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.

En la actualidad trabaja sola de 7:30am a 9h30pm  en la preparación de condimentos y la mercaderia de la tienda. Su esposo trabaja de taxi amigo y tienen 2 hijo que estudian en escuela. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, colas y asi incrementar la productividad del negocio. En el futuro desea seguir prosperando y mas ventas en su negocio.
texts.en:
Lorena, 36 years old, is a woman inspired by her family who decided to find an economic activity. She began by preparing condiments and also, selling provisions, in order to help her husband with household expenses.

At present, she works alone from 7:30 am until 9:30 pm in preparing condiments and merchandise for the store. Her husband drives a taxi and they have 2 children, both in school. 

Lorena has many aspirations concerning her business. For this reason, she desires a loan to buy rice, sugar, and colas, in hopes of increasing the productivity of the business. In the future, she wishes to continue prospering by increasing sales.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and colas to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase extra fresh fish to smoke and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional foodstuffs to cook for sale.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa L. has been selling fresh fish in Abbina, near Elmina in Cape Coast, for 10 years. She buys the fish from the market, cleans them and prepares them for smoking. Her loan will be used to buy additional fresh fish to increase her business. She hopes to reinvest the new profit. In the photo are some of the smoked fish in a tray on a basket.

loans.use: to buy additional fresh fish to increase her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is married to a mason. She operates a provisions shop at Abbina near Elmina. Ama has been selling provisions for eight years. She supports her husband in taking care of the home. Her loan will increase her capital to buy more milk, canned tomatoes, biscuits, and others to meet the demands of her customers. Ama anticipates establishing a new shop in a different locality.

loans.use: to buy more milk, canned tomatoes, biscuits, and others to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish to increase her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods for sale.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa N. is married and has eight dependents. She sells provisions in Abbina, near Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast. Adjoa uses her income to assist her husband to provide for her household. Adjoa will use this loan to purchase more provisions to fill her shop. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to save to build a bigger and better shop.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions to fill her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy extra bags of corn to store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more maize to expand her kenkey business.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua A. has four children. Her husband is a prison officer. Ekua uses her income to see to the well-being of her home.
Ekua sells smoked and fried fish at Abbina near Elmina in Cape Coast. She will use her loan to purchase more fresh fish to increase her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to invest in the sale of foodstuffs.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cassava to process into gari for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes and underwear

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba M. has three children. She sells bowls, secondhand clothes, frozen meat and fish in Abbina, near Elmina. Her husband is a security man and Araba uses her income to assist him in providing for the household's basic needs. Araba will use the loan to purchase more fish and meat to freeze for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Araba plans to save to build a cold store.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and meat to freeze for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food items to cook

loans.name: Elizabeth Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth Beatriz V. F. tiene   31 años de edad y vive en una casa en alquiler vivienda que esta ubicada en el barrio Narciso Campero de la ciudad de Tarija. Elizabeth es madre de dos hijos, por circunstancias de la vida y la necesidad económica su esposo  se fue a trabajar en una empresa constructora en la cual tiene que estar fuera de la ciudad. Ambos tienen que trabajar para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos. Elizabeth se dedica desde hace mas de 8 años a trabajar como costurera siendo muy conocida por sus clientes que solicitan sus servicios, Elizabeth quiere tener mejores ingresos para salir adelante junto con su esposo e hijos, pero ella nos cuenta que tiene la necesidad de comprar material de trabajo como ser telas, forros, entretelas, sierres , botones, etc. Ya que tiene un pedido de varias prendas de vestir de esa forma poder  realizar los trabajos que tiene por hacer, como ella ya tiene experiencia en el rubro el crédito será destinado para la compra de dicho material que es necesario para realizar su actividad para de ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos.  
                                                                                                                                                                                                      
Elizabeth nos cuenta que quiere mejorar las condiciones de vida que tiene, por eso nos dice que el próximo crédito que solicite será para la compra de una máquina de costura.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elizabeth Beatriz V. F. is 31 years old and lives in a rented home located in the Narciso Campero neighborhood in the city of Tarija. She is the mother of two children. Because of economic need and other events her husband went to work for a construction company outside of the city. They are both working to help their children get ahead.

Elizabeth has worked as a seamstress for more than 8 years. She is very well-known and has customers who seek out her service. Elizabeth wants to have more income to get ahead along with her husband and children, but she shared with us that she needs to buy more supplies like fabric, liner, zippers, buttons, etc. She already has many outfits ordered and in this way she can finish the work. She already has loan experience and plans to buy the supplies that she needs for her business so that she can earn more money. She wants to improve her life conditions, and shared that the next loan she requests will be for buying a sewing machine.

loans.use: buy more supplies for sewing

loans.name: Mujeres Del Exito Group

texts.es:
Doña Maria Ines C. G., es casada, tiene 31 años de edad, cursó el tercer año de educación secundaria, tiene 4 hijos los cuales estudian primaria y secundaria, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a vender artículos de consumo diario en una tienda, lleva ya 8 años con el negocio de tienda, inició gracias al apoyo de su esposo, quien se dedica a la herrería y el comercio.

Quiere ampliar su negocio, por esa razón acude a ASDIR para solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para comprar mas mercaderia y tener más productos en la tienda que tiene, tales como: flijoles en lata, gaseosas en lata y botella, golosinas, jugos, azucar, etc. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedica a la venta de tortillas, venta de refacciones, helados, cosméticos, venta de calzado y a la confección de faldas y blusas. Desean ver su negocio grande y con  capital amplio.
texts.en:
Maria Ines C. G. is married and is 31 years old.  She has a middle school education, and has 4 children who are in elementary and middle school.  Maria takes care of the household chores and also has a store where she sells everyday consumer goods.  She has had this business for 8 years; she started it with the help of her husband, who works as a blacksmith and a merchant.

She wants to expand her business, and for this reason she came to ASDIR to request a loan that she will use to buy more merchandise and have more products in her store, such as: canned beans, soft drinks in cans and bottles, candy, juice, sugar, etc.  The other members of the group have businesses selling tortillas, vehicle parts, ice cream, cosmetics, and shoes, and some members work making skirts and blouses.  They want to see their businesses grow and have more capital.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for her dressmaking business

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es: Ana María G. D. R. D. 29 años D. edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres pequeños hijos que se encuentran estudiando. Ana tiene un pequeño negocio en el cual venD. tortillas, ubicado en el Municipio D. San Salvador del Departamento D. mismo nombre. Ella es una mujer emprendedora y desD. mucho tiempo trabaja duramente para colaborar un poco con los gastos del hogar y sacar junto a su esposo adelante a sus hijos que son todo para ella. Cuenta con buena clientela y cada día la demanda D. sus ricas e higiénicas tortillas aumenta. Esto ha motivado a Ana a solicitar a INTEGRAL este crédito que le permita invertir en las principales materias primas como: Maíz, agua, gas propano, harina etc. Con esta inversión espera y confía que obtendrá mayores ingresos que le permitirán seguir ayudando a su familia  y podrá brindarles una mejor calidad D. vida sobre  todo a sus hijos que cada día necesitan más para sus estudios.
texts.en: Ana Maria Gonzalez D. R. is 29 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and three small children, who are in school.  Ana has a small business where she sells tortillas, which is located in the municipality of San Salvador in the department of the same name.  She is an enterprising woman who has worked hard for a long time to contribute toward the household expenses and help her husband and children, who are everything to her, get ahead.  She has a good customer base, and every day the demand for her delicious and hygienically maD. tortillas grows.  This has motivated Ana to request this loan from INTEGRAL, which will allow her to invest in raw materials for her business such as: corn, water, propane gas, flour, etc.  With this investment, Ana hopes and expects that she will get better earnings which will allow her to continue to help her family and proviD. them with a better quality of life, especially her children, who each day need more support for their education.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as: corn, water, propane gas, flour, etc.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María forma parte del banco comunal “Visión al Futuro” perteneciente a la ciudad de Coronel. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano, en la feria los días viernes, durante toda la jornada. Sus ventas varían según la mercadería que tenga para ofrecer.
María se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 8 años y comenzó con éste, debido a la enfermedad de su hija, quien padece de fibrosis quística al páncreas, por lo que su comienzo en el rubro del comercio fue bastante difícil y sacrificado, ya que debió comenzar de cero, para costear los medicamentos y controles médicos de su hija. En sus inicios vendía rifas, pero esto no lograba costear en su magnitud los gastos médicos que se le demandaban, por lo que comenzó a vender ropas en desuso de su propia casa y posteriormente empezó a juntar dinero para comprar fardos de ropa. En la actualidad su mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Santiago, específicamente fardos de ropa de segunda mano.
Con el préstamo comprará 15 fardos de ropa; específicamente pantalones, ropa interior, ropa de niños y ropa de casa.
Sus metas son tener un local establecido para ofrecer y vender su mercadería (ropa), además de contar con un vehículo que le permita trasladar su mercadería a los sectores rurales y periféricos de la ciudad, para vender su mercadería a las personas que no tienen la facilidad de trasladarse a la ciudad.
María vive junto a su esposo, sus tres hijos de 20, 17 y 15 años de edad y además tiene el cuidado personal de uno de sus sobrinos quien tiene 8 años de edad. Sus hijos son quienes le ayudan en su negocio, ya sea en el traslado de mercadería, instalar su puesto en la feria  y planchar la ropa que proviene de los fardos comprados. 
Sus motivaciones de continuar y superarse en su negocio es debido a la ayuda que le otorga a su familia, específicamente a sus hijos. 
María está muy contenta y agradecida de Fondo Esperanza, ya que afirma que sin su apoyo no podría continuar con su negocio, debido al apoyo y crédito. Además participa activamente de las reuniones del banco comunal y ha podido generar lazos de amistad en el grupo. Respecto a los cursos que se imparten en las reuniones ha podido incorporar estos aprendizajes en su propio negocio. 
Coronel es una comuna ubicada al sur de Chile, cerca de la ciudad de Concepción, región del Bíobío. Posee una economía basada en servicios, explotación forestal, agricultura. Cuenta también con una importante tradición minera en carbón, actividad que ya no se realiza, pero de la cual quedó la mina de carbón “Chiflón Puchoco”, convertida ahora en museo minero.
texts.en:
Maria is part of the “Visión al Futuro” communal bank in the city of Coronel.  She sells second hand clothing at the fair all day on Fridays.  Her sales vary depending on the merchandise she has to offer on a given day.

María has been doing this for eight years and began because her daughter had gotten sick with pancreatic cystic fibrosis.  Starting from scratch was difficult and involved many sacrifices because she also had to pay for her daughter’s medicines.  She started out selling raffle tickets, but it didn’t bring in enough money, so she began selling second-hand clothing out of her home and began saving up to buy packs of clothing.  Now she buys her merchandise, packs of clothing, in Santiago.

She will use the money from this loan to buy 15 packs, specifically pants, undergarments, children’s and house clothes. 
Her goals are to have a local establishment to be able to offer and sell her merchandise (clothing), and to also have a vehicle that will allow her to transport the clothing to different parts of the city, and be able to sell to those who do not have their own transportation.
María lives with her husband and three children, ages 20, 17, and 15, and also cares for one of her nephews who is eight years old.  Her children help her to transport the clothing to the fair, set up the stall and iron the clothes from the packs.

Her motivations to continue and to succeed in her business are the help she gets from her family, especially her children.
María is very happy and grateful to Fondo Ezperanza and affirms that without their support she would not have been able to continue with her business.  She also actively participates in the communal bank meetings, has been able to make ties off friendship with the group, and has been able to put her new knowledge to work in her business.

Coronel is a community located in southern Chile, near Concepción, in the Bíobío region.  Its economy is based on forestry product extraction and agriculture.  It also has an important coal mining tradition, but the “Chiflón Puchoco mine is no longer active and has been converted into a museum.

loans.use: to buy packs of clothing for resale

loans.name: Yeggo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe YEGGO est créé depuis  06 mois. Il est composé de 14 femmes qui habitent toutes le même village et pratiquant comme activité principale le maraichage. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de BATAMAR.

Madame Roky T. (debout à l'extrême droite de la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 11 enfants. 

Elle fait du maraichage comme activité principale. Et comme activité secondaire elle vend des cacahouètes. 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra d'acheter des semences et des intrants agricoles pour bien mener son activité de maraichage. Elle va également acheter des arachides quelle transformera en cacahouètes qu'elle vendra dans le village;

Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
The YEGGO group was founded six months ago. It has 14 women members who are all from the same village and whose main business is vegetable farming.The group is a part of the Banc Villageois, BATAMAR.

Mrs. Roky T. (woman standing on far right of photo) is the leader of the group. She is 43 years old. She is married and has 11 children. 

Her main business is vegetable farming. As a side business, she also sells peanuts. 

The new loan will enable her to purchase seeds and other farm inputs, and better manage her business of vegetable farming. She will also buy whole peanuts and prepare them for sale in the village.

Her goal is to help pay the family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and farm inputs

loans.name: Belkis

texts.en:
Belkis is one of our associates from the Hato Mayor branch, a rural town whose economy depends on agriculture. She is a merchant, selling shoes, jeans and blouses. She sells her products by walking around her community. She lives with her long-term partner and their three children. Belkis tells us that, for her, the most difficult thing is to build a house.
Belkis is very excited to be receiving her eighth loan from Kiva partner, Esperanza International. She has been working at her business for about four years, and it started thanks to her first loan with Esperanza. Belkis is very thankful to have received this loan from Esperanza because she will improve her business. She plans to save the profit to build her house and to reinvest in her business after God blesses her savings. Thank you for supporting this loan!

loans.use: to buy shoes, jeans and blouses.

loans.name: Ana Bienvenida

texts.es:
Ana de 33 años, es una mujer trabajadora que quiere sacar adelante a su familia ya que desde muy joven trabaja como empleada domestica.

En la actualidad trabaja en una casa como empleada y esa familia la acepta como una persona más. Ella se encarga de los quehaceres domésticos y en la noche cuida a sus hijo tiene 2 de 16 y 8 años. 

Tiene muchas aspiracion para seguir trabajando y darle una nueva oportunidad a sus hijos. Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento y arena para adecuar su vivienda y mejorar el nivel de su familia y tener una vida sana y prospera.
texts.en:
Ana is 33 years old and is a hardworking woman who wants to get her family ahead.  She’s been working as a maid since she was a young woman, and currently works as an employee in a home.  That family accepts her as one of their own.  She takes care of the housework and cares for the children, 2x 16 year olds and one 8 year old.

She has many aspirations to continue working and give a better life to her children.  She will use the money from this loan to buy cement and sand in order to make improvements to her home and improve the life of her family, so that they can have a prosperous and successful life.

loans.use: to make home improvements

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: José Luis R., reside en casa propia con su esposa y dos hijos que son todo para él. Don José es un hombre luchador, lleno de vida y entregado en su trabajo. Él Posee una pequeña tienda en su casa de habitación en la cual ofrece diferentes artículos como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar golosinas, etc. Además de su pequeña tienda también se dedica a la venta de huevos y pollos de forma ambulante en el Municipio de Santa Ana del Departamento del mismo nombre. El sabe que solo trabajando logrará sacar adelante a su querida familia y es por esto que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito ya que sueña con ver su negocio crecido el cual cuente con los productos necesarios para atraer a más clientes y así poder convertirse en el mas preferido de la zona. Con el crédito pretende comprar variedad de productos de tienda como: Azúcar, leche, arroz, frijoles, bebidas, pan dulce, golosinas, macarrones, condimentos, huevos y pollos. Así tendría variedad de productos y los clientes lo preferirían más ya que está lleno de  carisma y amabilidad. De esta forma confía que sus ganancias se verán aumentadas lo que significa que él podría ofrecer mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
José Luis R. lives in a home of his own along with his wife and two children who are everything to him.  José is a man who puts forth great effort, is full of life, and is dedicated to his work.  He has a small store in his home where he sells different items, such as rice, beans, sugar, snacks, etc.  He also sells eggs and chickens on foot in the town and department of Santa Ana.

He knows that he will only get ahead with his family by working and so he decided to request this loan because he wants to see his business grow, have enough products to serve a greater number of customers, and become the best in the zone.

He will use the money from this loan to buy a variety of products for his store, such as sugar, milk, rice, beans, drinks, bread, snacks, macaroni, condiments, eggs, and chickens.  In this way he will have a variety of products on hand and his customers will prefer the store more as it already has a special charm.  He is confident that he will increase his earnings and that he will be able to offer better living conditions to his family.

loans.use: to buy inventory items

loans.name: Eyddy Geraldina

texts.es: Eyddy Geraldina B. A. de 33 años de edad, reside en casa propia en el Municipio de Cojutepeque del Departamento de Cuscatlán. Doña Eyddy posee un pequeño negocio el cual consiste en una sala de belleza en la cual ha trabajado duramente para poder tener lo necesario y a la vez se ha especializado para brindar el mejor servicio posible a sus clientes. Últimamente ha notado un fuerte aumento en la demanda de sus productos y de sus servicios esto la ha puesto en que pensar ya que sabe que entre más clientes solicites sus productos necesita tener más equipada su sala de belleza para no decepcionarlos. Esto  la ha  hecho tomar una decisión bien importante. Solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL que le permita ampliar su negocio y comprar más artículos de belleza como: shampoos, cremas para el cabello, cremas para el cuerpo, maquillaje, tintes para el cabello, esmaltes, y demás materiales atractivos para los clientes. Con la confianza que de esta forma logrará aumentar sus ventas y por ende sus ganancias que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Eyddy Geraldina B. A. is 33 years old. She lives in her own house in the municipality of Cojutepeque, in the department of Cuscatlán. Eyddy has a small business: a beauty salon in which she has worked hard so that she can have what she needs. She has also specialized in providing the best possible service to her customers. Recently, she has noticed a strong increase in demand for her products and services, which has led her to think that she needs to equip her beauty salon better, because more customers will require more products, and she does not want to disappoint them. This led her to make a very important decision: to request this loan from INTEGRAL, which will allow her to expand her business and buy more beauty articles such as shampoos, hair creams, body creams, makeup, hair coloring, nail polish and other items that are attractive to her customers. She is confident that in this way she will be able to increase her sales and thus her earnings, which will allow her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products such as shampoos, hair creams, body creams, makeup, hair coloring, nail polish and other items her customers like.

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Reina Beatriz

texts.es: Reina Beatriz Q. D. M. D. 42 años D. edad, habita en casa propia con su esposo y un hijo en el Municipio D. San Martin del  Departamento D. San Salvador. Doña Reina posee un pequeño negocio el cual consiste en una tienda en la que ofrece productos D. primera necesidad como: bebidas, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, golosinas, detergente, jabón, etc. Tiene mucho tiempo D. trabajar en su tienda y gracias a su carisma  y dedicación en el trabajo ha logrado posicionarse en la zona y cada día su clientela aumenta más. Es muy conocida y respetada por sus vecinos ya que ella siempre se preocupa por brindar el mejor servicio posible a sus clientes. Su sueño es  ampliar su tiendita surtiéndola con variedad D. productos. Por esta razón solicita este crédito con la esperanza puesta en Dios que logrará atraer a más clientes que le demanden sus productos y así podrá obtener mayores ganancias. Con el crédito pretenD. comprar variedad D. artículos D. primera necesidad como: golosinas, bebidas, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, jabón, detergente, papel higiénico, entre otros artículos atractivos para los clientes. D. esta manera espera lograr mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia y ayudar a su hijo a superarse.
texts.en: Reina Beatriz Q. D. M. is 42 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and son in the San Martin municipality of the San Salvador department.  Doña Reina has a small business which consists of a store in which she carries basic products such as beverages, rice, beans, sugar, candy, detergents, soap, etc..  She has been working at this store for some time and thanks to her charisma and dedication she has been able to position herself in the area, and her customer base increases every day.  She is well known and respected by her neighbors as she always makes sure to proviD. the best service possible to her customers.  Her dream is to grow her store by supplying it with a variety of products.  For this reason she is requesting this loan, with her hope placed in God's hands she expects to attract more customer that will need her merchandise and this way obtain larger profits. With the money from the loan she will buy a variety of basic products such as candy, beverages,rice, sugar beans, soap, detergent, toilet paper and other articles that will attract customers.  In this way she hopes to improve the quality of life of her family and help her son to succeed.

loans.use: to buy a variety of basic products such as candies, sodas, rice, sugar, beans, soap, detergents,toilet paper among other merchandise desired by the customers.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: El señor Rolando C. B. y su esposa la señora Lidia Valdez son casados hace 5 años ambos son de la ciudad de La Paz y residen ya hace 3 años en Santa Cruz, tienen cuatro hijos la mayor de 14 años Lizeth, Rita  de 12 años, Cristina de 10 años, y Rolando de 10 años. El señor se dedica al servicio de la carpintería en Santa Cruz ellos viven el el barrio 13 de julio zona del Plan 3000, donde  el señor a instalado su taller de carpintería, con sus propias herramientas que se ha podido comprar con gran esfuerzo pero a  el le falta para poder comprar madera para poder producir ya que a vecés no puede producir la cantidad muebles de pedidos que le llega por falta de material,  y ellos quieren progresar para que con el tiempo lleguen a tener su casa propia, que quieren conseguir con su esfuerzo de sus trabajo y la ayuda que se le de les servira para poder tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Mr. Rolando C. B. and his wife, Mrs. Lidia Valdez, have been married for five years.  They are both from the city of La Paz but have lived in Santa Cruz for the past three years.  They have four children.  The oldest, Lizeth, is 14, Rita is 12, Cristina is 10 and Rolando is 10.  

The gentleman is a Carpenter in Santa Cruz.  They live in the 13 de Julio neighborhood of Plan 3000 which is where he has set up his carpentry shop with his own tools that he’s acquired with much sacrifice and effort.  However, he still needs to buy lumber so that he can produce because sometimes he’s unable to fill potential furniture orders due to lack of material.

They’d like to progress so that in time they will have a house of their own, something he wants to achieve through his own work and the help they’ll receive will help them have a better future.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Sandra Yanira

texts.es: Sandra Yanira B. D. T. D. 26 años D. edad, resiD. en casa alquilada con su compañero D. vida y su pequeño hijo en el Municipio D. Cojutepeque del Departamento D. Cuscatlán. Sandra tiene un pequeño negocio, el cual consiste en la venta D. frutas: sandias, melones, manzanas, naranjas, etc. Es una mujer llena D. vida y luchadora que sabe que la única forma D. salir adelante es trabajando y esto es lo que hace Sandra. Sueña con mejorar la oferta D. sus productos ya que sus clientes cada día la prefieren más por ser una mujer amable y por siempre tener la fruta en buenas condiciones y sobre todo al mejor precio. Esto la ha impulsado a solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL que le permita invertir en variedad D. frutas como: sandias, melones, mandarinas, manzanas, guineos, uvas, naranjas, y D. más frutas que hagan su negocio más atractivo. Con esto aspira obtener mejores ganancias que le permitan dar a su familia una vida más tranquila y estable.
texts.en:
Sandra Yanira B. D. T., 26, lives in a rented house with her life partner and small son in the town of Cojutepeque in Cuscatlán Department.

Sandra has a small business consisting of selling fruit: watermelon, melons, apple, oranges, etc.  She is a woman who is full of life and hard working who knows that the only way to get ahead in life is working and this is what Sandra does.

She dreams with improving her available stock since her customers prefer her daily because she’s a kind woman who always has fruit in good condition and, above all, at a better price.

This has pushed her to request this loan from INTEGRAL that will make it possible for her to buy a variety of fruit like: watermelon, melons, mandarins, apples, bananas, grapes, oranges and other fruit that will make her business more attractive. She hopes this will lead to better profits that will allow her to proviD. her family with a more tranquil, stable life.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: El Renacer 2,3 &4 Group

texts.en:
Mireya is the coordinator of her group El Renacer (Reborn) 2, 3 & 4, and her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an area where the economy is centered around agriculture and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.
Mireya is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. She sells ice cream, domestic ice, grocery items and underwear, all from her house and in the local school. She will use her loan to purchase some of each of these products. She will use the profits to re-invest in her business. Mireya says that her most difficult challenge is to have Dominican permission to live and work in the Dominican Republic. Like other Haitian citizens, she is working to get her Dominican residence. She started doing her business after she joined this group almost two years ago when she got her first loan. In the future she is dreaming of having her own house. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy ice cream, domestic ice, grocery items and underwear.

loans.name: Reina

texts.es:
A sus 58 años de edad Reina V. se siente orgullosa de tener su propio negocio, un espacio de su casa dedicado a la confección, oficio que aprendió desde pequeña al lado de su madre y que se ha convertido en la fuente de sustento para ella y su familia. 

Incrementar su capacidad productiva, generar empleo y convertirse en empresaria es el sueño de Reina V. quien trabaja de sol a sol como ella misma lo dice para cumplir con sus metas trazadas. 

Actualmente Reina necesita de un préstamo para comprar una máquina plana que le permita agilizar su trabajo y poder caminar en busca de ese sueño.
texts.en:
At the age of 58, Reina V. is proud to have her own business: a space in her home dedicated to Dressmaking, an occupation she learned while still a little girl alongside her mother that has become a source of support for herself and her family.

Reina V.’s dream is to increase her productive capacity, generate employment and become a businesswoman.  She works from sunrise to sunrise, as she herself states, to reach her set goals.

Reina needs a loan to buy a sewing machine that will make it possible for her to streamline her work and continue forward in search of her dream

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del  Banco Comunal “Flor de Canela”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento Puno, tiene 40 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos.  Tiene grado de instrucción educación superior..
Viene trabajando con  el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace dos años, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de abarrotes.  Paralelamente se dedica al cuidado de niños (Wawa Wasi), actividad que la realiza en su misma casa y le permite vender sus productos.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 700.00 nuevo soles, comprará arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, fideos, etc.  A veces le ayuda en el negocio su mamá. 
Su sueño es poner un centro educativo inicial y tener una tienda al mayoreo.
Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal son las capacitaciones y las reuniones ya que le permite relajarse un poco de las actividades diarias.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the “Flor de Canela” (Cinnamon Flower) communal bank located in Puno District, Puno Province and Department.  She is 40 years old, single and has no children.  She finished higher education.

She’s been collaborating with the Manuela Ramos Movement for two years.  Her first, 300 new sol, loan was invested in her grocery store.  She also cares for children (Wawa Wasi-Government sponsored child care program) in her home which allows her to sell her products.

She will use this new, 700 new sol, loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, milk, noodles, etc.  Her mother helps her in the store sometimes.  Her dream is to open an school and to have a wholesale store.

What she likes about the communal bank is the training sessions and the meetings that allow her to relax a bit from her daily activities.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, milk, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Nelly Marina

texts.es:
Nelly es socia del  Banco Comunal “Flor de Canela”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 37 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo.  Nelly tiene grado de instrucción educación superior completo.
Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos de hace un año, su préstamo inicial fue de  S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invirtió en su negocio venta de comidas rápidas.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, comprará un saco de papa, 20 kilos de pan molido, carnes y pollos.
Su sueño es tener un local en el centro de la ciudad y dedicarse al cuidado de niños (wawa-wasi).
Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal son las reuniones porque es una distracción e intercambia ideas con las demás socias.
texts.en:
Nelly is a member of the “Flor de Canela” (Cinnamon Flower) communal bank located in Puno District, Puno Province and Department.  She’s 37 years old, single and has a son.  Nelly finished higher education.

She’s been collaborating with the Manuela Ramos Movement for a year.  Her initial, 300 new sol, loan was invested in her fast food business.  She will use this new, 500 new sol, loan to buy a sack of potatoes, 20 kilos of bread crumbs, meats and chickens.  Her dream is to have a locale in city center and to care for children (wawa-wasi: government child care program).

What she likes about the communal bank is the meetings because they are a distraction and she can exchange ideas with the other members.

loans.use: to buy a sack of potatoes, 20 kilos of bread crumbs, meat and chickens.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando P. C. tiene 49 tiene una familia conformada por su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 15, 16 y 19 años y es propietario de un negocio ubicado en el centro de Barranquilla,  donde vende artículos deportivos, como ropa y calzado, con el cual ha logrado generar ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar, habiendo obtenido su experiencia comercial durante 5 años en un almacén de electrodomésticos, donde aprendió a manejar el mercado cultivando en sus relaciones sociales,  muchos clientes que aun continuaron  con él,  cuando emprendió su propio negocio, después de recibir la liquidación de sus prestaciones sociales al retirarse de esa empresa.  Armando en su negocio ofrece camisetas, sandalias, gorros, banderas alusivas a   equipos deportivos que despiertan la pasión de sus clientes,  especialmente al Junior de Barranquilla que es el equipo profesional de futbol de la ciudad de Barranquilla y cuenta con muchos seguidores y fanáticos que le compran a Armando. Este negocio ha sido muy importante en la vida de la familia, porque de aquí se desprende la actividad comercial que desarrolla la esposa de Armando, mediante la cual ofrece las mismas mercancías mediante créditos y tambien de contado a su propia clientela, lo que se constituye en un ingreso más que favorece el bienestar de todos en su hogar.
Su sueño es sacar adelante a su familia, por eso se esmera en lograr que su negocio se fortalezca cada día más, ahorrando y aumentando su capital de trabajo,  asì  como también sus clientes, quienes son los que  finalmente   con sus compras, generan las utilidades que recibe  y fortalecen su estabilidad.  Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el comprará en mayor cantidad, camisetas, sandalias, suéteres, bolsos y accesorios deportivos, para actualizar su oferta.
texts.en:
Armando P. C., 49, has a family composed of his spouse and three children who are 15, 16 and 19 years old.  He owns a business located in downtown Barranquilla where he sells athletic items, like clothes and footwear, that produces income to support his household.  

He acquired his commercial experience while employed for five years in an appliance store.  There he learned to manage the market cultivating social relationships.  When he opened his own business with his severance package from that firm many of his customers followed him.

Armando stocks t-shirts, sandals, caps, sports team banners that awaken his customers’ passion, especially for the Barranquilla Junior team, which is Barranquilla’s football team and has lots of fans that buy from Armando.

This business has been very important in the life of the family because his wife’s commercial activity springs from it too.  She sells the same kinds of items on credit and for cash to her own clientele and this is an additional source of income that benefits everyone’s wellbeing in the home.

His dream is to move his family forward and this is why he strives to strengthen his business more each day, saving and increasing his working capital as well as the number of customers who ultimatelly are the ones who strengthen his stability through profits generated by their purchases.

This is his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he will use it to buy larger amounts of t-shirts, sandals, sweaters, bags and sports accessories, to update his stock.

loans.use: to buy larger amounts of clothes, sandals, bags and sports accessories.

loans.name: Oscar Eduardo

texts.es:
Oscar de 50 años, es una hombre que aspira mucho por su familia ya que inicio su trabajo desde muy joven ayudándole a su tío después de cumplí la mayoría de edad se afilio al mercado del centro en la venta de frutas y verduras.

El empieza a trabajar desde muy temprano. Primero va a ser sus comprar de mercadería para su negocio despues abre su negocio en el mercado desde la 6H00 am a 12H00 pm para sus clientes. Su esposa también trabaja en el mercado vendiendo almuerzo. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere incrementar en su negocio comprando 16 cajas de manzanas, 18 cajas de peras y 12 cajas de granadillas para aumentar sus ganancias. El anhela seguir trabajando en el negocio y que su hijo menor goce de salud al igual que su esposa.
texts.en:
Oscar, 50, is a man who wishes the best for his family; he started working while still very young helping his uncle.  When he became an adult he affiliated himself with the central market selling fruit and vegetables.

He starts work very early.  First he goes out to make his purchases for his business and then he opens up for customers in the market at 6am and goes until noon.  His wife also works in the market selling meals.  

He wants to use the loan to increase his stock buying 16 cases of apples, 18 cases of pears and 12 cases of passion fruit to increase profits.  He hopes to stay in business and that his son and wife enjoy good health.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Nancy Isabel

texts.es:
Nancy N. vive en el barrio Ciudad Modesto, ubicado al suroccidente D. la ciudad;  allí tiene un negocio donD.  comercializa mercancías,  especialmente calzado;  ella es una mujer casada que  tiene 6 hijos en las edades D. 25 a 35 años. Nancy inició su negocio en el año 2005,  buscando ingresos adicionales para mejorar las condiciones D. vida D. su familia,  que hasta en ese momento estaban solo a cargo D. su esposo , asì ella comenzò vendiendo cervezas, con un capital inicial  que logró ahorrando D. los gastos del hogar, con el dinero  que le daba su esposo para el sostenimiento D. su familia.
Su meta es ampliarlo y lograr con sus utilidades mejorar las condiciones habitacionales  y aunque tiene poco capital D.  trabajo,  continua trabajando fuertemente para aumentarlo, generando con su actividad  una utilidad  neta del 26% y rotando sus cuentas por cobrar cada 10 días, porque ofrece su negocio a crédito y tiene una importante clientela que le compra en mayor volumen. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer crédito con a Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con su credikiva comprará en volumen cervezas y también  mercancía  variada que tiene encargada por sus clientes, con motivo D. una D. las fechas más importantes para las familias colombianas y D. gran despliegue comercial:  "el día D. las madres".
texts.en:
Nancy N. lives in the Ciudad Modesto neighborhood located in the southwest part of the city.  She has a business there selling merchandise, especially footwear.  She is a married woman and has 6 children ranging in age from 25 to 35.  Nancy started her business in 2005 in search of additional income to improve her family’s living conditions which up to that point had been solely her husband’s responsibility.  She started out selling beer with an initial capital she saved from household expenses, money her husband would give her for family support.

Her goal is to expand it and use profits to do some home improvements.  Even though she has little working capital, she continues working hard to increase it generating a net profit rate of 26% with a 10 day accounts receivable turnover because she sells on credit and has a sizeable clientele that buys in large volume.

She is currently applying for her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and will use her Kiva loan to buy a quantity of beer as well as assorted merchandise she has pending customer orders for due to the approach of one of Colombia’s most important family occasions that brings heightened spending: Mothers Day.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of beer as well as asssorted merchandise she has pending customer orders for.

loans.name: Martín

texts.es:
Martín forma parte del banco comunal “Aurora Boreal” perteneciente a la ciudad de Viña del Mar.
El se dedica al servicio de peluquería canina, desde hace 3 años. Comenzó en éste rubro, atendiendo a domicilio, posteriormente estableció su negocio en su casa y en la actualidad arrienda un local en el sector donde vive. Además agregó a su negocio la venta de artículos para mascotas, ya sea cepillos, arnés, juguetes, entre otros. La temporada de más alta demanda de sus servicios es entre los meses de septiembre y abril, por lo que a la fecha su negocio ha ido en progreso. 
Con éste préstamo arreglará su vehículo particular, ya que lo utiliza para el traslado de mascotas. Además comprará artículos varios para mascotas. 
Sus metas son posicionarse en el sector y contar con más clientela. Ya que hace 1 año aproximadamente se instaló en éste sector. 
Martín vive junto a su esposa e hijo de 3 años de edad. Sus motivaciones de continuar con el negocio surgen a partir de sus anhelos de tener una vida socioeconómica más confortable. 
Martín está muy contento y agradecido del apoyo brindado por Fondo Esperanza, debido a la facilidad de optar a los créditos y confianza entregada en él y su negocio. El participa activamente de las reuniones, ya que además es delegado del banco comunal y su grupo. Martín se siente a gusto, ya que su grupo es muy unido y solidario. Respecto a los cursos impartidos en las reuniones ha podido integrar estos aprendizajes en su propio negocio, sobre todo en el registro de sus gastos e ingresos, por lo que lleva su negocio de manera organizada. 
Viña del Mar es una ciudad y comuna ubicada en el litoral central de Chile, conocida como la Ciudad Jardín debido a los jardines y patios que poseen algunas viviendas antiguas de la ciudad. También es considerada la capital turística de Chile.
texts.en:
Martín is a member of the “Aurora Boreal” communal bank belonging to the city of Viña del Mar.

He has been a Dog Groomer for the last three years.  He started out in this line of work providing service at customers’ homes.  Later on he opened his business in his house and currently rents a locale in his neighborhood.  In addition, he added on to his business the sale of pet supplies: brushes, harnesses and toys, among others.  The months between September and April are the ones with the highest demand for his services which means his business has been progressing well.  He will use this loan to repair his private vehicle because he uses it to transport the pets.  He will also buy assorted pet supplies.  His goals are to position himself in the sector and to have more customers.  He started in this business about a year ago.

Martín lives with his wife and three year old son.  His motivation to stay in business rises from his wish to have a more comfortable socioeconomic life.

Martín is very happy with and grateful for the support provided by Fondo Esperanza reflected in the ease of loan acquisition and the trust placed in him and his business.  He participates actively in the meetings for he is a delegate from his communal bank and his group.  Martín is comfortable because his group is very united and mutually supportive.  With respect to the training courses offered, he’s been able to apply what he’s learned to his own business, especially keeping track of income and expenses, which makes it possible for him to keep his business well organized.

Viña del Mar is a city and commune along Chile’s central coast.  It is known as the Garden City due to the gardens and patios many of the old houses in the city have.  It is also considered to be Chile’s tourism capital.

loans.use: to service his vehicle and to buy pet supplies.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo, es originario del diamante de las Segovia, Estelí, pero actualmente vive en la comarca Santa Cruz, El Naranjo un pueblo aledaño  ubicado a 7 km de Estelí, tiene 31 años de edad, esta casado, tiene un hija de 4 años de edad, la cual esta en preescolar, el estudio  técnico agropecuario, se dedica al comercio.
Inicio vendiendo frutas, después tuvo la oportunidad de vender otros tipos de productos como por ejemplo jugos, plátanos, fritanga (enchiladas, tacos). Luego decidió cambiar el enfoque de su negocio y dedicarse a vender productos de consumo básico como arroz, frijoles, leche, huevo, carnes, pan, jugos, jabón de baño, snacks etc. El noto que el estaba en un buen punto de ventas pues transita estudiantes y turistas, su esposa lo ayuda a atender el negocio.
Solicito el préstamo para comprar un congelador, comprar mejores y nuevos  productos para su venta, aumentar su inventario.
Con esta inversión espera poder incrementar sus ventas, satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, tener mejores productos alimenticios que ofrecer. 
Desea en un futuro cercano poder ampliar su negocio, desea hacerle mejoras a su infraestructura. Desea consolidar su ventas en puntos estratégicos de ventas que le brinden estabilidad para el  su familia.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is from Diamante de las Segovia, Estelí, but currently lives in Santa Cruz, El Naranjo, an adjacent town located 7 kilometers from Estelí.  He’s 31 years old, married and has a four year old daughter who is in preschool.  He studied to be an agronomy technician but is currently a merchant.

He started out selling fruit but later got the opportunity to sell other kinds of merchandise like juices, bananas, fried fast food (enchiladas, tacos).  Later on he decided to change his business’ focus and he went into the sale of basic consumption items like rice, beans, milk, eggs, meat, bread, juices, bath soap, snacks, etc.  He noticed that he was at a good sales point because students and tourists pass by; his wife helps him tend to the store.

He asked for the loan to buy a freezer, to buy new and better products to sell and to increase his inventory.  He hopes to use this investment to increase sales, meet customer demand and have better foodstuffs in stock to offer.  In the near future he’d like to be able to expand the business; he wants to do some infrastructure improvements.  He wants to consolidate his sales at strategic sales points that will provide his family with stability.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and stock items for the store.

loans.name: El Renacer 5 Group

texts.en:
Timoteo lives in the rural area surrounding Hato Mayor. In this area the economy is centered around agriculture and it is one of the poorest communities around the main city of the Dominican Republic. Timoteo and his group of five entrepreneurs are taking loans for their businesses. They are sellers of many products such as clothing, shoes, groceries and communication products. This group is named El Renacer (Reborn) 5.
Timoteo requires a loan to buy groceries. He runs a grocery stall, selling in the street and to neighbors. He will buy different products such as candies, snack potatoes, chocolate bars, lollipops, etc. He has taken six previous loans since starting with his first loan from Esperanza three years ago. He started his business after he stopped working for other people and decided to start his own business. Timoteo's dreams for his future are to have his own house, raise his only child and buy a vehicle. He and his group are thankful for your support!
The woman shown inset was not available when the group met to take this picture.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es:
Luis de 29 años, es un hombre trabajador que inicio su actividad por medio de un amigo en la venta de gafas y lentes desde ese entonces sigue con su negocio de ventas.

El compra su mercadería cada 2 semanas y trabaja diariamente de 8H00 am  a 8H00 pm. su esposa también se encarga del negocio haciendo las compras. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar más mercadería para su negocio e incrementar sus ganancias. El anhela comprarse un carro y que sus hijos sigan estuduando y que sean jovenes del bien.
texts.en:
Luis, 29, is a hard working man who started his activity through a friend who was in the glasses and sunglasses sales business.  Since then he’s continued with his sales business.

He buys his merchandise every two weeks and works from 8am until 8pm.  His wife also takes care of the business making the purchases.  With help from the loan he wants to buy more merchandise for his business and increase profits.  He hopes to buy a car and that his children stay in school and that they be upstanding young people.

loans.use: to buy glasses and sunglasses.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: El sr. Francisco oriundo de la localidad de San José, su actividad es la explotación de áridos en el rio Pirai (explota y lava arena, piedra para vender a los constructores), se dedica a esta actividad hace bastante tiempo, también cuenta con una draga la cual es instrumento en su trabajo  casado con la señora Andrea quien le ayuda en esta actividad, con el dinero del crédito realizara mantenimiento de motor (draga), el Sr. Francisco es una persona muy trabajadora siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia, deseando mejorar su calidad de vida, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mr. Francisco is native of San Jose.  His business is working with sand and rocks in the Pirai river (he obtains and washes the sand and rock to later sell to contractors)  He has been in this business for quite a while.
