He also has a dredger which is the main equipment for his type of work.  He is married to Andrea who helps him in his business.  With the money from the loan he will repair his dredger.  Mr. Francisco is a very hard working man and is always thinking of the well being of his family and wishing to improve their quality of life.  He is very grateful to this institution for all the help that they provide.

loans.use: to maintain the dredger motor.

loans.name: Mirian Fani

texts.es:
Mirian de 26 años, es una mujer trabajadora que inicio su actividad hace poco ella vino de la sierra por motivo del trabajop de su esposo y con loas primeras utilidades decidio poner su tienda.

Ella trabaja en su negocio de 6H00 am a 8H00 pm con la ayuda de su esposo. Le dificulta en su trabajo la delicuencia ya que por su sector se ha vuelto peligroso. Con la ayuda del prestamo quiere comprar mas productos para su tienda de viveres. Lo que mas anhela es tener su negocio mas grande y terminar su vivienda para darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Mirian is 26 years old.  She is a hard-working woman who recently started her business.  She came from the mountains to work with her husband and they decided to put their profits into their store.

She works at her business from 6:00am until 8:00pm with the help of her husband.  A difficult part of their work is delinquency because their area has become dangerous.  With the help of the loan, she wants to purchase more products for her general store.  In the future, she would like her business to get larger and finish her home to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase rice, drinks, and oil.

loans.name: David Armando

texts.es:
David de 27 años, es un hombre que inpira mucho en su familia. Trabaja para una empresa como maestro albañil, poco a poco a reunido dinero para construir mejor su casa y darle una buena vida a sus hijos. 

El labora diariamente para poder mantener a su familia. Su esposa es empleada domestica. Tienen un hijo de ocho años que todavia estudia. Con el prestamo quieres comprar materiales de construccion para terminar de construir su vivienda y darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
David is 27 years old.  He is a man who is inspired by his family.  He works for a business as a master bricklayer.  Slowly, he has saved money to improve the construction of his house and give his children a better life.

He works every day to support his family.  His wife works as a housekeeper.  He has an 8 year old son who is still studying.  

With this loan, he wants to purchase construction materials to finish building his house and give his family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, and bricks.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma P. is from the village of Canubay, Oroquieta City. She is 33 years old, married, and has two infant children. To make a living, Erma runs a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs. Erma has been engaged in her business for two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.  

Erma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erma is requesting a loan for 3,000 PHP,  which she will use to purchase approximately eight bags of hog feeds. This loan will be Erma's second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase hog feeds

loans.name: Angel Eduardo

texts.es:
Angel de 41 años, es un hombre trabajador que inicio su actividad desde muy pequeño cuando le llevaron como oficial de construcción desde los 20 años. 

Por el momento tiene 4 trabajadores a su cargo. El labora desde las 6H00 am a 4h30 pm. Su dificultad en el trabajo son las lluvias ya que así no puede terminar de trabajar. Esta casado, su esposa tiene una tienda y vende comida los fines de semanas de jueves a domingos. Del fruto de su hogar tiene 6 hijos menores de edad que estudian en colegios y escuela publicas. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere invertir en el negocio de su esposa comprando viveres como arroz, canes, bebidas, esencias y parte en la comprar de útiles escolares para sus hijos.

El anhela terminar de construir el segundo piso de su casa y que sus hijos prosperen en su estudios.
texts.en:
Angel, age 41, has worked in the construction business for the past 20 years.  He supervises four employees and works from 6:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.  The challenges he faces at work come when it rains because he can't finish a job.  

He is married and his wife has a grocery store and sells food from Thursday to Sunday.  They have six minor children who are in school.

The loan will be used in his wife's grocery business to buy rice, sugar, beverages and essences.  Part of the loan will go toward school supplies for the children.  

His goal is to build a second floor on the house and for his children to finish their education.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, beverages and school supplies for his children

loans.name: Kalinka Dadeyva

texts.es: La señora kalinka dedicada a la venta de productos varios para el hogar esto en su domicilio ya hace un año atrás el propósito de iniciar este negocio es para ayudar a la economía de su familia ya que antes solo era el esposo el que se encargaba de todos los gastos del hogar, ahora la clienta desea este crédito para incrementar su capital de trabajo comprando mercadería como papel higiénico, lavavajillas, etc.  , y así atraer mas clientela, podemos ver que la señora se esfuerza por colaborar en los ingresos para su familia ya que lo que gana el esposo no alcanza, es muy trabajadora, su deseo es el de mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Kalinka works selling various household products from her home. She started this business a year ago to improve her family's financial situation, because before that only her husband contributed money to pay for the household expenses. 

Now Kalinka would like this loan to increase her working capital so that she can buy merchandise such as toilet paper, dishwashing liquid, etc. This way she will be able to attract more customers. 

It is evident that Kalinka is working to contribute to the income for her family because what her husband earns isn't enough. She is very hard-working and her goal is to improve her entire family's quality of life. She is grateful to the microfinance institution for the support they have given her.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as toilet paper, dishwashing liquid, etc.

loans.name: Connie

texts.es:
Connie forma parte del banco comunal “Aurora Boreal” perteneciente a la ciudad de Viña del Mar. Ella se dedica a la venta de artículos varios, principalmente cosméticos, carteras, dulces y bebidas, ya que tiene un bazar paquetería y confitería. Su local se encuentra ubicado en el centro de la ciudad de Quilpué. 
Todo lo que es mercadería para su confitería la compra en distribuidoras y a distintos proveedores en la misma ciudad, sin embargo los artículos para su bazar, los compra en la ciudad de Santiago, donde viaja una vez a la semana. 
Su familia es comerciante, por lo tanto Connie heredó éste oficio y se independizó desde hace 4 años. 
Con el préstamo comprará mercadería para su bazar específicamente carteras, cosméticos, artículos en general para el día de la madre. Además invertirá en una vitrina para su local y bebidas para su confitería.
Sus metas son comprar una máquina fotocopiadora y otra máquina para hacer café. Por lo que sus sueños y motivaciones son surgir a nivel socioeconómico.  
Connie vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de 18, 12 y 5 años de edad. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo Esperanza, además se siente muy a gusto con las demás socias, ya que se ha formado un grupo muy unido y se apoyan mutuamente. Respecto a los cursos impartidos en las reuniones ha podido integrarlos en su propio negocio, ya que distribuye mejor sus ingresos y gastos. 
Viña del Mar es una ciudad y comuna ubicada en el litoral central de Chile, conocida como la Ciudad Jardín debido a los jardines y patios que poseen algunas viviendas antiguas de la ciudad. También es considerada la capital turística de Chile.
texts.en:
Connie is a member of the "Aurora Boreal" communal bank in the city of Viña del Mar.  She sells a broad array of items, but mainly cosmetics, billfolds, sweets and beverages.  She has a small gift and sweets shop in the center of the city of Quilpué.

She purchases all of the sweets she sells from distributors and suppliers in the same city.  But the rest of the merchandise is bought in the city of Santiago where she travels once a week.  She comes from a family of merchants and inherited the business, but became independent four years ago.

She plans to use the loan to buy billfolds, cosmetics and general gifts for Mother's Day.  She also will invest in a display case for her shop and sweets for her candy business.  Her goals include buying a photocopy machine and a coffee maker.  She aspires to getting ahead and improving her social class.

Connie lives with her husband and three children, ages 18, 12 and 5.  She is happy and grateful for the support she receives from the "Fondo Esperanza".  She enjoys being with the other members, and they have become very close supporting each other mutually.  Many of the lessons she has learned in the group meetings have been applied in her business, such as how to distribute income and expenses better.

Viña del Mar is located along the central coast of Chile and is known as the Garden City because of the gardens and patios found in some of the older houses in the city.  It is also considered the tourist capital of Chile.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as billfolds, cosmetics, and gifts for Mother's Day, and to purchase a display case for her shop and beverages for her candy store

loans.name: Nury Yeny

texts.es:
Nury es socia del  Banco Comunal “Las Retamas”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, está separada y tiene dos hijos en edad escolar.  Nury tiene grado de instrucción  educación superior técnico.
Trabaja  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio de venta de abarrotes.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 2000.00 nuevo soles, comprará andamios, un saco de arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, galletas, golosinas, gaseosas, etc.  Ella recibe el apoyo de su hermana quien la apoya en el negocio.
Su sueño es ejercer su carrera y poner un negocio de perfumería.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y el intercambio de palabras con las socias.
texts.en:
Nury is a member of the communal bank "Las Retamas", which is located in the Puno District, in the province and department of Puno.  She is 30 years old, separated and has two school-aged children.  Nury has a higher technical level of education.

She has been in the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years.  Her first loan was for 300 PEN which she used in her grocery store business.

She plans to use the new loan, in the amount of 2,000 PEN, to buy scaffolding, a sack of rice, sugar, oil, detergent, cookies, sweets, sodas, etc.  Her sister helps her run the store.

Her dream is to work in her professional field and to set up a perfume shop.  What she likes about the communal bank is its punctuality and converations with the other members.

loans.use: To buy scaffolding, rice, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 4 sets of plastic tables and chairs, a microwave oven, a blender, 6 gallons of paint, 2 quintals of American rice, 80 lbs of pork, 70 lbs of beef, 1 quintal of beans, 2 quintals of sugar and 2 barrels of oil

loans.name: Manos Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Livia, 33 años D. edad, madre soltera, 1 hija D. 13 años en edad escolar. 
Livia es Socia activa como fiscal del alcancia comunal: "Manos Trabajadoras".
DesD. los 15 años se dedica al bordado a mano D. fustanes (faldas artesanales para danzas tipicas del Valle del Mantaro). Ella elabora sus bordados a pedidos y sobre todo para los dias festivos D. cada zona; en estas celebraciondes D. fiestas patronales y otros eventos participan grupos D. danzantes y se llevan a cabo muchos concursos.
El prèstamo solicitado es para la compra D. hilos y paños para bordar.
(En la fotografìa Livia esta vestida con casaca color rojo y es la cuarta D. la derecha. La fotografìa pequeña que està en la parte superior izquierda es D. uno D. los bordados que realiza).
(*)Oscar V. B. no estuvo en la fotografia por motivos D. trabajo.
texts.en:
Livia, age 33, is a single mother and has a 13-year-old daughter who is in school.  She is an active member of the communal bank "Manos Trabajadoras", where she acts as payment supervisor.

Since she was 15 years old she has been embroidering "fustanes" (artisan skirt worn for folk dances in the Mantaro Valley).  She makes her crafts on a order basis, mainly for the holidays in each area.  During patron saint celebrations and other events the dance groups participate in many contests.

The loan is to buy thread and embroidery cloth.

(In the photograph, Livia is dressed in red and is the fourth one standing from the right.  The small photograph in the upper left hand corner is of the embroidery she does)

(*)  Oscar V. B. is not pictured for work reasons

loans.use: To buy thread and embroidery cloth

loans.name: Paula Aleodora

texts.es:
Paula es socia del  Banco Comunal “Flor D. Canela”, ubicado en el distrito D. Puno, provincia y departamento D. Puno, tiene 55 años D. edad.
Está casada y tiene 5 hijos (2 independientes).  Paula tiene grado D. instrucción educación primaria.
Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace tres años, su préstamo inicial fue D. S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio D. venta D. artesanías. Actualmente se dedica a su tienda D. abarrotes.
Con éste crédito D. S/ 800.00 nuevo soles, comprará un saco D. arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, aceite, detergentes y una balanza para la tienda, su esposo le ayuda con el negocio  y también  trabaja en el magisterio. 
Su sueño es tener muchos más productos que ofrecer a sus clientes y ver a sus hijos felices.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y el intercambio con las socias.
texts.en:
Paula is a member of the Flor D. Canela (Cinnamon Flower) bank in the Puno district, Puno province and department.  She is 55, married and has 5 children (2 adults living on their own).  Paula went through primary school.
She has been with the Manual Ramos Movement for the past three years with an initial loan of 300 new sols which she used for her handicrafts business.  Now she has a general store.
With the loan of 800 new sols, she will buy a sack of rice, sugar, milk, noodles, oil, detergent and a scale for her store.  Her husband helps her and also works as a teacher.
Her dream is to have more products to offer her customers and to see her children happy.  What she likes most about the communal bank are the meetings and the networking with the members.

loans.use: To buy a sack of rice, sugar, milk, noodles, oil, detergent and a scale

loans.name: Mujeres De Debora 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Maria R.  is one of the members of the group Mujeres D. Debora 1 and 2, located in the city of Puerto Plata whose population is maD. up of Dominicans and Haitian migrants. The region's economy is dependent on the rum industry as well as tourism and real estate. 

Maria R. has been operating a business selling pigs for 10 years. She raises them and then sells them at an adult age or to a butcher shop. She raised 5 children while working selling food in her community, saving her profits and helping her husband. She tells us that her most difficult challenge was when her children traveled to Spain; they are still living there, studying with scholarships and working. One of Maria's dreams is to soon visit them in Spain.  

This is Maria's first loan with Esperanza. She is planning to use it to buy 4 young pigs. She also plans to use the income to reinvest in her business and for savings.

loans.use: to buy 4 pigs

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia started her business making beautiful flower arrangements and selling them from a street cart two years ago, after hearing about Grameen America from a friend. At that time, she worked in a store that required her to put in long hours yet paid her barely enough to support her family. Now, she has created a profitable business and discovered a profession that she truly enjoys.

Claudia is a natural saleswoman who exudes friendliness and humor, so it’s not surprising that her favorite part of the job is getting to meet and converse with new people throughout the day. Having paid off her first two Grameen America loans, Claudia is seeking a third loan of $2,000 to purchase flowers and other equipment that she needs to grow her business. She hopes to one day apply her skills to opening a neighborhood flower shop. When Claudia isn’t hard at work expanding her business, she likes to relax at home and spend time with her son. Her dream for him is that he studies hard and builds a successful career – and Claudia is doing an incredible job of leading him by example.

loans.use: to purchase flowers and tools for her flower arrangements.

loans.name: Los Lideres Group

texts.es:
Jovita 36 años D. edad, madre soltera. Socia D. la alcancia comunal "Los Lideres".
Jovita tiene 3 hijos, Lizbeth D. 14, Masiel D. 10, y Robinson D. 4 años.
Jovita tiene como negocio la venta D. ropa y calzado repontenciada (segunda mano), y venD. estos productos en la feria D. la avenida Huancavelica todos los dias domingos; los otros dias reparte a pedido por la zona donD. vive. Estos articulos Jovita tiene que darle mantenimiento como por ejemplo: luztrar los calzados, lavar y planchar las prendas.
El prestamo adquirido es para comprar otras mercaderias para poder incrementar sus ventas.
(En la fotografia Jovita esta vestida con pantalon color gris y chompa color celeste, es la cuarta D. la izquierda)
texts.en:
Jovita is 36 years old and a single member. She is a member of the Los Lideres (Leaders) community bank. Jovita has three children: Lizbeth-14, Masiel-10, and Robinson-4. Jovita has a business selling second-hand clothing and shoes at the Huancavelica Avenue market every Sunday. On the other days, she sells by delivering around the area where she lives. Jovita has to do some work on her products, for example, shining shoes and washing and ironing clothing.

This loan is to buy merchandise to increase her sales.

In the photograph, Jovita is wearing gray pants and a light blue sweater. She is the fourth one from the left.

loans.use: buy merchandise (clothing and shoes)

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a dedicated businesswoman, borrower and mother of two who makes her living selling ice cream and other homemade sweets from a push cart. She loves her job because it allows her to walk around outside all day, exploring her neighborhood and getting exercise. Prior to receiving her first loan two years ago, Rosa worked handing out fliers at the supermarket, a job that didn’t provide her any opportunity for advancement. Rosa has always excelled in math and when she was younger she dreamed of becoming an accountant, but didn’t have enough money to invest in the necessary schooling. Now, she enjoys applying the analytic skills of her ice cream business - growing her customer base and increasing her profits year after year.

Rosa is seeking a fourth Grameen America loan of $3,000 to purchase new equipment for her cart and additional food to sell. When she isn’t working, Rosa spends her evenings cooking dinner for her family and encouraging her children to follow their dreams.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and food for her ice cream cart.

loans.name: Señor De Locumba Group

texts.es:
Bàrbara 56 años D. edad, divorciada, 3 hijos varones. Presidenta del grupo comunal "Señor D. Locumba".
D. sus 3 hijos, sòlo uno depenD. D. elL. y tiene 15 años estudia en el colegio secundaria.
Bàrbara es docente jubilada; por necesidad tuvo que buscar otro ingreso y venD. comida en L. puerta D. su propia casa. Por las mañanas prepara caldos (sopas), por las tardes menu`s (almuerzos), y por las noches venD. mazamorras (postres), y comidas.
El prèstamo que solicitò es para comprar abarrotes al por mayor y poder abastecer su negocio.
(En L. fotografìa Bàrbara està vestida con chompa color rojo y pantalòn azul, es L. segunda D. L. derecha. L. persona D. L. fotografìa pequeña D. L. parte superior derecha es Erick C. H. no se encontraba presente en L. reuniòn porque estaba estudiando; L. persona que no se encuentra en L. fotografìa es Carlos V. E. y no estuvo presente por motivo D. viaje).
texts.en:
Barbara is 56 years old, divorced, and has 3 sons.  She is the president of the communal bank "Señor D. Locumba."

Of her 3 sons, only one is still dependent upon her.  He is 15 years old and is in middle school.  

Barbara is a retired teacher.  Out of necessity, she had to look for another source of income so she sells food from a door in her house.  In the mornings she prepares soup and in the afternoons lunches.  At night she sells pastries and meals.

She is requesting a loan to buy groceries at wholesale so that she can have supplies for her business.

In the photograph, Barbara is dressed in a red sweater and blue pants; she is the second person on the right.  The person in the small picture on the right siD. is Erick C. H..  He was not present at the meeting because he was studying.  Carlos V. E. is also missing from the group picture; he could not attend the meeting due to the fact that he was traveling.

loans.use: to buy groceries at wholesale to use in her business

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana forma parte del banco comunal “Aurora Boreal” perteneciente a la ciudad de Viña del Mar.
Ella se dedica a la confección hogar, esto quiere decir confección de cortinas, sábanas, cobertores, bolsos para llevar los artículos de bebé y bolsas de pan. Además cuenta con un bazar y librería. Ana arrendó un departamento específicamente para ubicar sus negocios, lo adaptó del tal manera, para ubicar su taller de confecciones en la parte de atrás del departamento y adelante lo utiliza para su bazar y librería. Se dedica a la confección hogar desde hace 16 años y al negocio del bazar desde hace 8 años. 
Con el préstamo comprará telas para su trabajo de confección. Además necesita pagar permisos y trámites de sus negocios. 
Sus metas son seguir ampliando su negocio y ser conocida en el rubro, a través de una página Web o catálogos de sus confecciones. Por ahora sus trabajos y ventas son sólo a pedidos, sin embargo le va muy bien.
Ana vive junto a su esposo y su sueño a nivel personal es viajar y conocer la ciudad de Valdivia que se encuentra ubicada al sur de Chile. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la facilidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza para acceder al crédito. Respecto a las reuniones, Ana se siente muy cómoda y a gusto, ya que existe una muy buena relación y comunicación entre las demás socias del grupo, además se transmiten datos y se recomiendan a distintos clientes, por lo que existe solidaridad entre las integrantes del banco comunal. Por otra parte los aprendizajes de venta en las reuniones los ha incorporado en su negocio, como por ejemplo en la distribución y registro de sus ganancias. 
Viña del Mar es una ciudad y comuna ubicada en el litoral central de Chile, conocida como la Ciudad Jardín debido a los jardines y patios que poseen algunas viviendas antiguas de la ciudad. También es considerada la capital turística de Chile.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the “Aurora Boreal” community bank which is located in the city of Viña del Mar.

Ana makes soft furnishings.  She makes drapes, sheets, bedspreads, diaper bags and bread bags.  She also has a bazaar and book store.  Ana rented an apartment specifically for her businesses.  She adapted it so that she could also locate her sewing workshop in the rear of the apartment.  She uses the front part of the apartment for her store.

Ana has been making soft furnishings for 16 years and has run her store for 8 years.  She will use her loan to buy fabrics for her sewing work.  She also needs to pay for licenses and permits for her businesses.

Ana's goals are to continue expanding her business and to become well known in the field through a Web page or catalogs which contain her products.  For now, she makes and sells products to order.  Her business is doing very well.

Ana lives together with her husband and her dream, on a personal level, is to travel and visit the city of Valdivia which is in the south of Chile.  She is very happy and grateful for the ease with which Fondo Esperanza enabled her to access her loan.  As regards the meetings of her community bank, Ana feels very comfortable and at ease in these meetings since there is are good relationships and good communication between the members of the group.  They pass on information and recommend each other to different customers which means there is a lot of solidarity between them.  In addition, Ana has incorporated into her business what she has learned about sales from the bank's meetings, for example, as regards distributing and recording her profits.

Viña del Mar is a city and municipality which is located on Chile's central coast.  It is known as the Garden City because of the gardens and patios that some of the city's old houses have.  It is also considered to be the tourist capital of Chile.

loans.use: to buy fabric for her soft furnishings work and to pay for licenses and permits for her businesses

loans.name: Hugo Marcelo

texts.es: El señor Hugo es mecánico con mas de 15 años de experiencia  y actualmente cuenta con un taller propio, es padre de una niña de 4 meses pero aun no vive con la madre de su hija por circunstancias ajenas, tiene su taller en la zona de Irpavi esta  es la primera vez que solicita un crédito ya que  en este momento necesita el dinero para la compra de una maquina (pluma extractor para la reparación de motor), es en lo que utilizara el dinero del crédito, es una persona muy trabajadora, con deseos de superación, tiene  mucha clientela ya que le buscan por su buen trabajo, y con esta nueva maquina piensa ampliar su negocio y crecer  gracias a la institución, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Hugo is a mechanic with more than 15 years experience.  He currently owns his own garage.  He is the father of a 4 month-old girl although he doesn't live with his daughter's mother due to circumstances beyond his control.  His garage is located in Irpavi.  This is the first time that Hugo has requested a loan as right now he needs money to buy a machine (an extractor for repairing engines).  This is what he will use his loan money to buy.

Hugo is a very hard-working person who has a desire to improve himself.  He has a lot of customers who seek him out because of the good work that he does.  With this new machine, he is planning to expand and grow his business.  He is very grateful to the institution for the support they have given him.

loans.use: to buy machinery (an extractor for repairing engines)

loans.name: Señor De Huarancayo Group

texts.es:
Marisela 49 años D. edad, casada, 2 hijos D. 16 y 14 años respectivamente. Socia D. la alcancìa comunal: "Señor D. Huarancayo", en la provincia D. Jauja - Huancayo.
Marisela tiene como negocio venta D. comida en su casa; adicionalmente tiene una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes al costado D. su casa.
marisela tiene a sus 2 hijos en edad escolar y aùn son dependientes.
El prèstamo solicitado es para comprar al por mayor vivires y productos D. primera necesidad para su restaurante.
(En la fotografìa Marisela esta vestida con casaca color gris y polo color negro, esta al medio y en la parte del fondo D. la foto)
Los socios que no se encuentran en la foto son: 
- Nancy D. Y., no estuvo presente por encontrarse laborando;
- Ediecilda Marinez C., no estuvo presente por estar D. viaje;
- Edgardo C. T., no estuvo presente porque llegò tarD./ estuvo trabajando.
texts.en:
Marisela is 49 years old, married, and has two children aged 16 and 14.  She is a member of the "Señor D. Huarancayo" community bank which is located in Jauja, Huancayo.

Marisela's business is selling food in her home.  She also has a small grocery store next to her home.  Marisela has two school-age children who are still dependent on her.  She will use the loan she has requested to buy food products and essentials (wholesale) for her restaurant.

(In the photograph, Marisela is wearing a gray jacket and a black polo shirt).

The members who are not in the photo are:
- Nancy D. Y. - who couldn't attend because she was working
- Ediecilda Marinez C. - who couldn't attend because she was away
- Edgardo C. T. - who couldn't attend because he arrived late / was working.

loans.use: to buy food products for her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, oil and sugar

loans.name: Jose Olaya Group

texts.es:
Ida, D. 37 años D. edad, casada, con 6 hijos. Socia del banco comunal: "Jose Olaya".
Ida tiene como negocio la venta D. pan y lo hace en una moto-carga que le sirve para distribuciòn. Adicionalmente a la venta D. pan tambièn se dedica al bordado D. trajes tìpicos.
Ida tiene 6 hijos D. los cuales 5 dependen D. ella. Su esposo trabaja en una panaderìa; D. allì les surgiò la idea D. comprar y distribuir pan por la localidad donD. viven.
El prèstamo solicitado es para acondicionar un techo a su moto-carga para proteger el pan D. la lluvia.
(En la fotografìa Ida esta vestida D. chompa color verD. y falda color azul claro y tiene puesto un sombrero negro tìpico D. la zona; es la segunda D. la izquierda). 
(*)La socia D. la fotografìa pequeña no estuvo presente por motivos D. trabajo: trabaja en una empresa textil para exportaciòn.
texts.en:
Ida is 37 years old and married, with 6 children. She is a member of the "Jose Olaya" communal bank.

Ida's business is selling bread. She uses a cargo motorcycle to distribute the bread. In addition to selling bread, she also embroiders traditional clothing. 

Ida has 6 children, of whom 5 are dependent on her. Her husband works in a bakery, and that is where the idea came from to buy and distribute bread in the area where they live. 

The loan she is requesting will be used to attach a roof to her cargo motorcycle in order to protect the bread from the rain. 

(In the photograph, Ida is dressed in a green sweater and light blue skirt, and she is wearing a black hat which is typical of her area; she is the second from the left.)

(*) Note: the member in the small photograph was not present because of work commitments; she works in a company that makes textiles for exportation.

loans.use: to improve her cargo motorcycle which she uses to distribute bread.

loans.name: Viviana Elsa

texts.es:
Viviana es socia del  Banco Comunal “Victor echave”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos.  Viviana tiene grado de instrucción  educación superior incompleta.
La señora  se dedica  a la venta de artículos artesanales, trabaja  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cinco años.  Su préstamo inicial fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio de artesanías.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, comprará cuatro conos de lana cusqueña y tres conos de lana sintética, para la elaboración de sus tejidos como Chompas, ponchos, medias, guantes y gorros.  En el negocio la ayudan sus hijos.
Su sueño es tener una tienda de artesanía en el centro de la ciudad y tener máquinas de coser que le permita elaborar más productos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Viviana is a member of the “Victor Echave” community bank which is located in Puno district, in Puno province and department.  She is 44 years old, a single mother, and has two children.  She didn't finish her higher education.

Viviana sells handicrafts.  She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for five years.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she used that money for her craft business.

Viviana will use this new loan for 300 soles to buy four cones of Cusco yarn and three cones of synthetic yarn to make her knitted items such as sweaters, ponchos, tights, gloves and hats.  Her children help her in her business.

Viviana's dream is to own a craft store in the city center and to own some sewing machines which would allow her to make more products.

What Viviana likes about her community bank is the ease of the loans.

loans.use: to buy four cones of Cusco yarn and three cones of synthetic yarn

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis de 51 años, es un hombre trabajador que inicio su actividad hace varios años. Anteriormente tenia una hacienda pero tuvo un accidente y el efecto fue que todas sus cosechas se incendiaron y perdió todo hasta a sus dos hijas. Un día dejo todo y se fue para playas a empezar desde cero en las ventas de chanchos.

El empieza su labor desde las 3H00am para pelar los chanchos y a las 6H00 am los lleva la mercado para su ventas. Al medio día regresa y pelan otros chanchos para luego entregarlos a las 14H00pm en el mismo mercado y con la ayuda de su esposa hace todo eso. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar mas chanchos para su ventas y mejorar sus ingreso.

El anhela darle lo mejor a su hija que quiere construir su casa de cemento para tener una vida sana con su familia.
texts.en: Luis is 51 years old.  He is a hard-working man that began his line of work several years ago.  Before this, he used to own a ranch until he had an accident that caused all of his harvest to burn down.  He lost everything, including his two daughters.  One day, he left everything behind and went to the beach to begin from scratch, selling pigs.  He would begin his work at 3:00am by butchering his pigs and then at 6:00am he would take them to the market to be sold.  He returns home midday to butcher some more, which he then delivers at 2:00pm to the same market, with the help of his wife.  With this loan, he will be able to purchase more pigs to sell and thus improve his earnings.  He hopes to be able to provide the best for his daughter and construct a cement home in order to have a better quality of life for his family

loans.use: increase his income

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela tiene 59 años, es viuda y vive al lado de sus 2 hijas mayores que ya son independientes y tiene su propia familia. Hace más de 18 años que se dedica a la venta de leche, producto que extrae de una vaca que posee. Es así que todas las mañanas realiza el ordeño, en donde sus hijas la ayudan en esta tarea, ya que es una actividad constante y de mucha paciencia. Asimismo la leche que extrae lo procesa en yogurt natural y queso, productos que también vende. El establo donde cría su vaca lo tiene ubicado en casa de un familiar, ya que dispone de amplio espacio. Por otro lado, vende mazamorras, y lo hace de manera ambulante, de esa manera se genera ingresos diarios. Manifiesta que esta contenta con el trabajo que realiza, ya que son años de experiencia y con el tiempo ha logrado ganar clientela, que en su mayoría son comerciantes de productos lácteos y que vienen de otras ciudades. Su gran anhelo es tener más vacas. Es su crédito número 14 con MFP,  se siente muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal 
Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de una vaca más para su establo.
texts.en:
Adela is 59 years old.  She is a widow and lives alongside her two daughters who are grown up and have their own families.  For more than 18 years, Adela has been selling milk which she gets from a cow that she owns.  She milks her cow every morning.  Her daughters help her in this task since it is a constant activity that requires a lot of patience.  Adela processes the milk into natural yoghurt and cheese which she also sells.  The stable where she keeps her cow is located on a family member's property since they have a lot of space.

Adela also sells 'mazamorra' (a corn-based pudding) as an itinerant street vendor.  In this way, she makes a daily income.  Adela tells us that she is happy with the work that she does since she has years of experience and, over the years, she has managed to gain customers who are mainly people who sell dairy products and come from other towns.

Adela's big wish is to own more cows.  This is her 14th loan from MFP.  She feels very happy to be a member of her community bank.  She will invest the loan that she is requesting in buying another cow for her stable.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Virginia Nieves

texts.es:
Virginia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Las Retamas”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 40 años de edad, es conviviente, con  grado de instrucción  educación superior y tiene 3 hijos en estudio. 
Su primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos que fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo utilizó en su negocio de venta al por menor de artículos artesanales, también cuenta que utilizó parte del dinero para comprar una máquina para sus tejidos.  Es socia de Manuela Ramos desde hace dos años y medio.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 100.00 nuevo soles, comprará tres conos de lana de alpaca para la elaboración de sus chompas.   Su esposo trabaja en construcción civil pero cuando le es posible la ayuda en el negocio.
Su sueño es ser empresaria de artesanías al por mayor.
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y la responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Virginia is a member of the “Las Retamas” community bank which is located in Puno district, in Puno province and department.  She is 40 years old, lives with her partner, completed her higher education, and has three children who are all in school.

Virginia's first loan from Movimiento Manuela Ramos was for 300 Peruvian soles and she invested that money in her business selling craft products retail.  She tells us that she used part of the money to buy a machine for making her knitted products.  She has been a member of Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two and a half years.

Virginia will use this new loan for 100 soles to buy three cones of alpaca yarn with which to make sweaters.  Her husband works in civil engineering but, whenever possible, he also helps her in her business.

Virginia's dream is to be a businesswoman who sells handicrafts wholesale.  What she likes about her community bank is the punctuality and responsibility.

loans.use: to buy three cones of alpaca yarn

loans.name: Yeannette Riliana

texts.es: La Sra. Yeannette tiene 25 años de edad, tiene ya 2 años dedicándose a la venta de abarrotes.  Vive en casa de sus padres, además posee dentro de su tienda un teléfono público, vende tarjetas de teléfono. Ella  se vio en la necesidad de solicitar crédito de nuestra institución debido a que desea que su negocio crezca, comprara con el dinero del crédito una heladera para poder vender refrescos fríos y también helados, y así poder ofrecer mas productos a sus clientes, ya que es mu conocida en la zona por la variedad de productos que ofrece y también por  la amabilidad con que atiende a sus clientes, es cliente nueva  de la institución,  es una persona joven con ganas de superación desea mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Yeannette is 25 years old. She has been selling groceries for two years. She lives in her parents' house. In addition to her grocery sales, she also has a public telephone in her store and sells telephone cards. 

Yeannette found herself in need of a loan from our institution because she wants to expand her business. With the money from the loan she will buy a refrigerator to be able to sell cold drinks and also ice cream. That way she will be able to offer more products to her customers. Yeanette is very well-known in the area for the variety of products that she offers and also for her friendly nature when she waits on her customers.

Yeanette is a new client of the institution. She is a young person with the desire to succeed and hopes to improve the quality of life for her whole family. She is grateful to the institution for the support they have given her.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Erika Catalina

texts.es:
La Señora. Erika T. es socia del banco comunal El Ahorro, vive por el sector de Huizhil que pertenece a la parroquia de Baños, esta parroquia se caracteriza por sus aguas termales que un atractivo para todos sus visitantes, cuanta con una gran gastronomía y su gente es muy amable y cordial.

Doña Erika tiene 28 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 13, 11 y 7 años de edad, su primera hija esta en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en la escuela. Su esposo labora como albañil, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamá compartiendo los gastos del hogar.

La Señora. Erika es comerciante, se dedica vender legumbres y verduras, esta actividad la realiza hace 8 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde.

Nuestra socia se encuentra reingresando al banco comunal ya que hace un tiempo atrás pertenecía a otro banco comunal. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de verduras para seguir creciendo en su negocio.

Su sueño es viajar por todo el mundo.
texts.en:
Erika T. is a member of 'El Ahorro' community bank.  She lives in Huizhil sector, in Baños parish.  This parish is noted for its hot springs which are an attraction for all visitors.  The area has a rich cuisine and its people are very kind and friendly.

Erika is 28 years old, married, and has three children aged 13, 11 and 7.  Her eldest daughter is in high school and her two other children are in elementary school.  Her husband is a construction worker.  They do not own their own home but live in her mom's home and share the household expenses.

Erika is a saleswoman who sells vegetables.  She has been in this business for 8 years and works from Sunday to Sunday, from 7.00am to 6.00pm.

Erika is rejoining a community bank as she used to belong to another community bank in the past.  She will use her loan money to buy vegetables so that she can continue growing in her business.

Erika's dream is to travel all over the world.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Teofila Esperanza

texts.es:
Teofila es socia del  Banco Comunal “Flor de Canela”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia Puno y departamento Puno.  Está casada y tiene 4 hijos. Tiene 38 años de edad y tiene como grado de instrucción educación superior.
Hace siete años trabaja con  el Movimiento Manuela Ramos.  Su primer inicial fue por S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invirtió en su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas (restaurante).
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 1600.00 nuevo soles, comprará arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, fideos, menestras, papa, gas, etc, y  realizará algunas mejorar en el local.  Ella  trabaja junto con su esposo y sus hijos. 
Su sueño es convertir el negocio en una quinta y preparar platos extras que le permita generar otros ingresos.
Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad, responsabilidad y el bajo interés del préstamo.
texts.en:
Teofila is a member of the "Flor de Canela” community bank which is located in Puno district, in Puno province and department.  She is married and has four children.  She is 38 years old and completed her high school education.

Teofila has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for seven years.  Her initial loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she invested that money in her restaurant business.

With this new loan for 1,600 soles, Teofila will buy rice, sugar, oil, milk, noodles, mixed vegetables, potatoes, gas, etc. and will make some improvements to her premises.  She works together with her husband and children.

Teofila's dream is to turn her business into a boarding house and prepare additional dishes that will allow her to make other income.

What Teofila likes about her community bank are the punctuality, responsibility and low interest rates.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, milk, noodles, mixed vegetables, potatoes, gas, etc.

loans.name: Celsa Gregoria

texts.es:
Celsa de 47 años, es una mujer muy emprendedora en su actividad que desde muy joven empezó a trabajar en casa privadas después con el tiempo trabajo en un comedor de comida hasta que cumplió la mayoría de edad emprendió su propio negocio de ventas de comidas y preparación de bolones de verde a clientes por sus sector.

En la actualidad ella esta estudiando para culminar la primaria y después el bachillerato y así tener otro tipo de trabajo. Ella labora de  5H00 am a preparar la masa y de 7H00 sale a dejar sus pedidos y llega a las 11H00 am a su domicilio para preparar lo almuerzos. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar mercadería para la venta de bolones y almuerzos como quilates de arroz, racimos de verdes, colas por paquetes para mejorar los ingresos en su negocio. Ella anhela adecuar su casa y alquilarla para tener otro ingresos y otra seguir incrementando su clientela.
texts.en:
Celsa, 47, is very ambitious in her work. When she was very young she started working in private houses. After a while she worked in a home-based diner until she was of age. Then she started her own business, preparing and selling meals and fried green plantain dumplings to her customers throughout her area. Right now she is studying to finish her primary education, and she plans to go on to finish her high school diploma so that she can do other kinds of work. 

She starts work at 5:00 am, preparing the dough, then at 7:00 am she leaves to deliver her orders, returning to her home at 11:00 am to make the lunches. With the help of this loan she wants to increase her business income by buying bulk merchandise and ingredients for her dumplings and lunches, including large quantities of rice, branches of green plantains, and cases of soda. Her dream is to modify her house and rent part of it to have another source of income, and to continue increasing her customer base.

loans.use: to purchase bulk merchandise and ingredients, including rice, plantains, sodas and juices.

loans.name: Sunilda

texts.es:
Sunilda es socia del  Banco Comunal “Dulce Amanecer”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 40 años de edad, está divorciada y tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar.  Sunilda tiene estudios de educación superior a.
La señora se dedica a la venta de artículos artesanales,  trabaja  con el  Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace dos años, con su primer préstamo solicitado de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, pudo invertirlo en su negocio venta de artículos artesanales.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/  1000.00 nuevo soles, comprará ocho conos de lana para la producción de chompas, chullos, gorros, chalinas, etc., y poder pagar la mano de obra del personal externo.
Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y poder exportar las artesanías que elabora.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la ganancia del ahorro.
texts.en:
Sunilda is a member of the “Dulce Amanecer” (Sweet Dawn) community bank which is located in Puno district, in Puno province and department.  She is 40 years old, divorced, and has two school-aged children.  Sunilda completed her high school education.

Sunilda sells handicrafts.  She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years.  She invested her first loan for 500 Peruvian soles in her business selling handicrafts.

With this new loan for 1,000 soles, Sunilda will buy eight cones of yarn to make sweaters, 'chullos' (woollen caps with earflaps), caps, scarves, etc. and pay labor costs for external staff.

Sunilda's dream is to improve her business and export the handicrafts she makes.  What she likes about her community bank is the money she makes on her savings.

loans.use: to buy eight cones of yarn for making sweaters, 'chullos' (woollen caps with earflaps), caps, scarves, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa L. es socia del banco comunal El Ahorro, vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, cuenta con 4 ríos que la bañan y con varios lugares turísticos, su gente es muy amable y cordial.
 
La Señora. Rosa tiene 42 años, es divorciada y tiene 4 hijos de 23, 16, 14 y 4 años de edad, su primer hijo está comprometido y vive independiente, su segundo y tercer hijo  estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Rosa es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, esta actividad la realiza hace un tiempo atrás, es vendedora ambulante y no tiene ni día ni horario fijo de trabajo. También se dedica  lavar ropa ajena de sus conocidas.

Es socia del banco comunal hace un año y medio. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa usada para tener más surtido en su mercadería.
 
Su sueño es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Rosa L. is a member of the 'El Ahorro' community bank.  She lives in Cuenca city center.  This city is a World Heritage Site.  It is surrounded by four rivers and has several tourist sites.  The people are kind and friendly.

Rosa is 42 years old, divorced, and has four children aged 23, 16, 14 and 4.  Her eldest son is engaged and lives independently, her second and third children are attending high school in the city.  They don't own their own home but live in a rental house.

Rosa is a saleswoman who sells used clothing.  She has been in this business for some time.  She makes her sales as an itinerant street vendor and doesn't work regular days or hours.  She also washes clothes for people that she knows.

Rosa has been a member of her community bank for one and a half years.  She will invest her loan money in buying used clothing so that she can better stock her business.

Rosa's dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy used clothing

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Dulce Amanecer”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 36años de edad, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar.  Silvia tiene  grado de instrucción  superior. 
La señora se dedica a la venta de artículos artesanales,  trabaja  con el  Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace cuatro meses, su préstamo inicial fue de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio venta de artículos artesanales.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, comprará materiales como lanas para la producción de chompas, chullos y  chalinas.  Ella trabaja sola en su negocio.
Su sueño es tener una empresa y exportar su artesanía en grandes cantidades.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones porque intercambiamos palabras con las demás socias, estamos alegres.
texts.en:
Silvia is a member of the Communal bank " Dulce Amanecer" ( Sweet Morning), located in the district of Puna, a province and department of Puno.  She is 36 years old, single, and has two children of schooling age.  Silvia has a degree in higher education.  She sells arts and crafts and has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement four months now.  Her initial loan was for 500 Nuevo Soles, money which she used towards her business of selling arts and crafts.  With this new loan of 300 Nuevo Soles, she will purchase materials such as wool for the production of sweaters, scarves, and hats.  Silvia works alone in her business and her dream is to have a company and export her products in large quantities.
What she likes most about the communal bank is the meetings because she can talk to the other members; they are very happy.

loans.use: To purchase wool in bulk in different colors

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es: Genoveva tiene 60 años, vive con una de sus hijas en su casa que es propia. Hace  más de 6 años vende mazamorras, postre típico de su zona, y que actualmente lo ofrece en un puesto que estableció hace 4 años. Es así que atiende desde la mañana hasta llegada la noche. Durante la semana se da el tiempo suficiente para abastecerse de mercadería para continuar con la preparación de éste postre. Ante el buen gusto de preparar mazamorras  y el buen servicio que brinda a sus clientes, le ha favorecido en las ventas, es por eso  que se proyecta a elaborar en mayor proporción mazamorra. Es su crédito número 15  que tiene con MFP,  considera que su experiencia de trabajo que ha realizado en su banco comunal es muy positiva ya que significó para ella un espacio de aprendizaje y agradece ese apoyo comprometiéndose a seguir siendo responsable en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería y mejorar la infraestructura de su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Genoveva, age 60, lives with one of her daughters in her own house. For over six years, she has been selling mazamorras -- a typical dessert in her area (a sweet corn-based pudding). She currently sells them from morning till night from a vending post that she has installed four years ago. During the week, she has enough time to replenish her stock of ingredients necessary for the preparation of this dessert.

Genoveva's skill in preparing manzamorras and the good service she offers to her clients have allowed her to grow her sales; it is for this reason that she plans to make manzamorras in greater quantity. 

This is Genoveva's 15th credit with MFP, and she feels that her experience as part of the communal bank has been very positive, given that it gave her a space where she could learn new things. She is grateful for this support and is committed to repaying the loan in a timely manner. She plans to use the loan to purchase ingredients as well as to improve the infrastructure of her vending post.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for the preparation of mazamorra (a sweet corn-based pudding) as well as to improve the infrastructure of her vending post.

loans.name: Ruth Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La Señora. Ruth B. es socia del banco comunal El Ahorro, vive por el sector del Cebollar en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, cuenta con 4 ríos  que la bañan y con varios lugares turísticos, su gente es muy amable y cordial.
 
Doña Ruth tiene 49 años, está separada y tiene 5 hijos  de 30, 27, 25, 24 y 14 años de edad, tres de sus hijos son casados e independientes, su hijo de 27 años trabaja y le ayuda  economícamente y su hijo de 14 años estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. La casa en la que habita es propia.
 
La Señora. Ruth se dedica a la venta de quintales de arroz y azúcar, este negocio lo tiene en su casa hace un año

Es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y  lo va a invertir en la compra de quintales de azúcar y arroz para su negocio.

Su meta es vender sus  productos al por mayor.
texts.en: Ruth B. is member of the communal bank El Ahorro ( The Savings), she lives by the Cebollar sector in the city of Cuenca; this city is a cultural heritage site.  It is replenished by 4 rivers and has various tourist locations.  Its people are very friendly and cordial.  Ruth is 49 years old, divorced, and has 5 children of ages: 30,27,25,24, and 14 years of age.  Three of her children are married and independent, her 27 year old son works and helps her financially, and her 14 year old studies at a school in the city.  The house she lives in is her own.  Ruth sells quintals of rice and sugar, a business she has been running out of her home for a year.  This is her first loan while in the communal bank and she will invest it in the purchase of quintals of sugar and rice for the business.  Her goal is to sell her products in bulk.

loans.use: to purchase quintals of rice and sugar

loans.name: Yeny Margot

texts.es:
Yeny  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Victor echave”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno.  Es soltera y tiene 2 hijos.  Cuenta con estudios de educación superior.
La señora se dedica a la venta de artículos de perfumería y cosméticos.  Hace cuatro meses trabaja  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su préstamo inicial fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de productos cosméticos.
Con éste nuevo préstamo  de  S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, comprará productos cosméticos para poder abastecerse para la campaña del día de la madre.
 Su sueño es tener más capital y mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Yeny is a member of the comunal bank Victor Echave located in the district of Puno, a province and department of Puno.  She is single with 2 children and counts on a secondary education.
She sells perfumery and cosmetic products.  She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement four months now and her initial loan of 300 nuevo soles was invested in her business of cosmetic products.  With this new loan of 300 nuevo soles she will purchase cosmetic products in order to stock up for the Mother's Day campaign.  Her dream is to have more capital and improve her earnings.  What she likes most about her comunal bank is the loan facility.

loans.use: to purchase various cosmetics

loans.name: Banco Mujer Mujeres En Acción Group

texts.es:
El grupo está compuesto por 11 socias, todas señoras muy trabajadoras con muchos sueños y metas por cumplir, sus edades van desde los 26 años hasta los 60 años. La mayoría de integrantes solo completaron la educación primaria y se dedican a las actividades agropecuarias para ayudar a sus familias; que en muchos casos es la única fuente de ingresos económicos para el hogar. Esta es la primera solicitud de crédito de Banco Mujer Mujeres En Acción y se enteraron de los servicios de Fundación Mujer, gracias a que la actual tesorera, Doña Emilce B., ya había estado en un grupo hace más de 4 años. 
Las solicitantes van a invertir el préstamo en la compra de cerdos, pollos, terneros, alimentos, concentrados, abonos, químicos y otros insumos para la cría de animales y siembra de cacao. Las integrantes del grupo tienen la experiencia de muchos años en las actividades productivas, pero no cuentan con capital de trabajo para poder hacer crecer sus negocios, y si a esto le sumamos otras dificultades como el alto costo de la materia prima, el transporte los productos, falta de un mercado fijo, y los bajos precios con los que logran vender sus productos. Todos estos obstáculos son los que tiene que enfrentar día a día, por ello el crédito viene hacer de gran ayuda para todas las microempresarias que integran esté Banco Mujer.  
El grupo se ha fijado objetivos muy importantes como agrandar sus negocios, llegar a ser autosuficientes, seguir estudiando, y muchos otros. Donde el crédito es un primer paso para alcanzarlos.
texts.en:
The group is composed of 11 members, all of which are hard-working women with a lot of dreams and goals yet to fulfill.  Their ages range from 26 up to 60 years of age.  The majority of its members only completed elementary education and have dedicated themselves to agricultural activities in order to help their families, who in most cases, is the only source of income for the household.  This is the first loan from Banco Mujer Mujeres En Accion (Women's Comunal Bank Women in Action) and they heard of the services of Fundacion Mujer thanks to the current treasurer, Emilce Bermudez who had been in a comunal group for more than 4 years.

The members will invest the loan in the purchase of pigs, chickens, calves, feed, concentrates, fertilizers, chemicals and other inputs to raise livestock and grow cocoa.  The members have many years experience in their productive activities but do not have the working capital to grow their businesses; and if we add to these struggles the high cost of raw materials, product transportation costs, lack of a stable market, and the low prices in which they manage to sell their products, all of these obstacles are what they have to face day-to-day.  This is why the loan is of great help for all of the entrepreneurs who make up Banco Mujer.
The group has set forth very important objectives such as: growing their business, becoming self-sufficient, continuing their education, and many more. This loan is the first step to reach those objectives.

loans.use: to purchase Pigs, Poultry, Livestock and Agriculture

loans.name: Las Vecinitas Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Las Vecinitas, se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Tlayacapan, en el estado de Morelos México, está conformado por 5 integrantes, ellas son la Señora Irene va a comprar con su préstamo mercancía jabón por kilo, aceite por caja, azúcar por bulto, huevo por caja etc. La señora Yuridia Azucena va a comprar bolsa para dulces, globos, serpentinas, gorritos, dulces, la señora Luz María va a comprar cirios pascual para la temporada de semana santa, la señora Isabel va a comprar chiles secos, guajillo, pasilla por kilo frijol peruano, flor de mayo, la señora Irma va a comprar mantelería para los tablones. La señora Irma tiene 47 años de edad es casada y tiene 3 hijos ya casados, Rubén de 29 años de edad, Brenda Mayra de 25 años de edad y Ramiro de 20 años de edad, ella tiene su negocio de renta de mesas y sillas para fiesta, ella solicito su crédito para comprar manteles para las mesas, ella inicio su negocio hace 10 años, su esposo en su camioneta le echaba viajes a una persona que rentaba mesas y sillas y vio que era negocio, porque son cosas que no se echan a perder  y tiene la camioneta en la que transportan las sillas y las mesas, su negocio es importante porque tiene ingresos, tiene buenas cuentas, ella proporciona a sus clientes un buen trato y buen servicio, ella más que nada trata de motivar a sus clientes proporcionándoles los manteles del color que más les agrade, lo pida el cliente con meseros, con brin colines, su hijo el más chico le ayuda a acarreas las mesas, sus sueños y esperanzas son que su casa este bien terminada le falta el repellado y el baño ponerle las regaderas, ampliara su negocio para que de ahí vaya saliendo para los gastos y que cada uno de sus hijos tenga su propio negocio. Tlayacapan es un pueblo mágico por las artesanías del barro y por su Iglesia que es ex convento y museo donde hay momias. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decir a KIva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por sus préstamos y vamos a pagar puntualmente para que nos sigan apoyando con sus préstamos”.
texts.en:
This solidarity group called, Las Vecinitas ( The Neighbors ) is located in the community of Tlayacapan in the state of Morelos Mexico.  It is made up of 5 members, they are: Irene who will use her loan to purchase merchandise such as soap by the pound, boxes of oil, sugar in bulk, boxes of eggs, etc; Yuridia Azucena will be purchasing bags for candy, balloons, streamers, and hats; Maria will purchase paschal candles for the Easter holiday; Isabel will purchase dried peppers, guagillo and pasilla by the pound, Peruvian beans, and May flower; Irma will purchase tablecloths.  Irma is 47 years old, married, and has 3 children who are married.  Ruben is 29 years old, Brenda Mayra is 25 years old, and Ramiro is 20 years old.  Irma has a business renting out tables and chairs for parties and solicited this loan to purchase tablecloths.  She began her business 10 years ago, her husband used to make trips for a person who rented out chairs and tables and she noted that it was good business because they are materials that do not deterriorate plus she has the truck in which to transport the tables and chairs.  Her business is important because it creates earnings, is in good standing, and she gives her clients a good deal and good service.  More than anything else, Irma tries to motivate her clients by offering colored tablecloths of their choosing, waiter service with the tables, trampolines, and her youngest son helps her transport the tables.  She dreams and hopes to complete her home which still needs plastering and the bathroom needs shower heads.  She will expand her business so she can obtain money for expenses and so each one of her kids can have their own business.  Tlayacapan is a magical town due to its crafts of clay and its church that is an ex-convent and a museum that houses mummies.
The members of the group would like to say to Kiva and Fundacion Realidad, " Thank You for the loans, we will pay on time so that you continue to show support with your loans.".

loans.use: to purchase tablecloths

loans.name: Miriam Mercedes

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Valroc. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable y trabajadora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Miriam, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 17, 15 y 12 años  de edad, el mayor estudia en Universidad y los menores en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.

Tiene un bazar en su casa en el cual además de vender artículos de bazar también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas) y zapatos aunque esto en menor cantidad. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 19h00. Sus productos los va a comprar a Guayaquil cuando necesita surtir su negocio y también recibe mercadería en su local. Nos cuenta que lleva con su negocio por tres años y que le ha ido bastante bien.

Este crédito es para comprar artículos de bazar, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, ropa y zapatos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace tres años y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.

Su sueño es tener su casa bien arreglada y equipada con todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days in Rocafuerte canton, the members of Valroc Communal Bank meet. This area is known throughout the country for the delicious sweets made by the locals, and for the warmth of its friendly and hardworking people.

Here we meet Miriam, who is 39 years old, married, and has three children who are 17, 15 and 12 years old. The oldest is at university and the younger ones are in high school. Her husband is a merchant.

She has a bazaar in her house in which she sells not only bazaar items, but also all types of clothing, Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and accessories for women), and shoes, but in smaller quantities. She works every day from 8 AM until 7 PM. She goes to buy the products in Guayaquil when she needs to stock her business and she also receives merchandise at home. She tells us that she has been working in this business for three years and that it has been going pretty well.

This loan is to buy bazaar items, perfumes, creams, cosmetics, clothing and shoes. She has been in the communal bank for three years and likes it because the payments are easy to make.

Her dream is to have her house well maintained and equipped with everything she needs.

loans.use: to buy bazaar items, perfumes, creams, cosmetics, clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Paula Maura

texts.es:
Paula  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Victor echave”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 60 años de edad.  Es conviviente y tiene tres hijos independientes.  Estudió educación primaria (incompleto).
Viene trabajando  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace siete años,  se dedica al servicio de transporte urbano.  Paralelamente se dedica a la venta de utensilios, joyas y cadenas.  Su préstamo inicial fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles.
Con este nuevo préstamo de  S/ 3000.00 nuevo soles, comprará llantas y repuestos para su carro.  Trabaja junto con su esposo.
Su sueño es superarse más en el negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y las charlas educativas respecto al negocio.
texts.en:
Paula is a member of the communal bank "Victor Echave," located in the Puno district, Puno province and department. She is 60 years old. She has a common law husband and three independent children. She has an incomplete primary education.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for seven years. She works in urban transport. She also sells utensils, jewelry and chains. Her initial loan was 300 soles. With this new loan of 3,000 soles, she will buy tires and spare parts for her car. She works together with her husband.

Her dream is to get ahead more in her business and improve her earnings. What she likes about the communal bank are the punctuality and the educational chats about business.

loans.use: to buy tires and spare parts for her car.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 60 años, vive con su hija en su casa propia en compañía de sus 2 hijos, que están casados y tiene sus familias respectivas. Tiene 24 años de experiencia en la venta de verduras, es así que estos productos los expende en las principales ferias comerciales, ubicadas en las zonas rurales de su localidad. Desde entonces sale 3 veces por semana, llevando toda la mercadería que puede, ya que en cada zona rural tiene separado un puesto en algún mercado, solo pagaría el costo durante el tiempo que se queda vendiendo. Para cuando se le acabe la mercadería, ella junto a su hija se dirigen a los mercados mayoristas, donde consigue los productos a un menor precio. Considera que este negocio le resulta rentable, y por ello desea implementarse de más productos alimenticios para generarse más ganancias. Es su crédito número 15  con MFP, se siente muy satisfecha de haber logrado permanecer un buen tiempo en su banco comunal de la cual esta muy satisfecha y se compromete una vez más a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita,  lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en: Juana is 60 years old and lives with her daughter in her house along with her two sons, who are married and have their own families. She has 24 years of experience selling vegetables, which she dispenses in major trade fairs, located in the rural zones of her area. She goes out three times a week, carrying all the merchandise she can, as she has separate booths in markets in each rural zone. She only pays the cost during the time she's selling. When she runs out of merchandise, she and her daughter go to the wholesale markets, where they get products at a lower price. She considers this business profitable, and wishes to sell more food products to generate more earnings. This is her fifteenth loan with MFP. She feels very satisfied to have managed to stay such a long time in her communal bank, and promises once more to make punctual payments. With the loan she is seeking, she will invest in the purchase of merchandise to supply her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
Amelia es una D. las siete integrantes D. L. Nueva Alcancia Comunal “L. AMISTAD”, es casada y resiD. en L. zona D. Matucana. Su negocio no tiene un nombre especifico pues se inicio hace 5 anos vendiendo gelatinas y con L. idea D. obtener mayores ganancias se compro un carrito sanguchero en donD. dia a dia apoya a su esposo con los gastos D. servicios como luz y agua. Junto a  su esposo han logrado adquirir un mototaxi por lo cual tienen otros ingresos para su familia. Amelia invertira el credito en L. compra D. gaseosas y golosinas para vender conjuntamente con las hamburguesas  y frituras que ofrece a sus comenzales.
Amelia nos cuenta que anheL. terminar construir su casa e inagurar una gran bodega D. venta D. productos D. primera necesidad. L. Alcancia Comunal “ L. Amistad” agradece L. confianza puesta en ellos y sus negocios y estan comprometidos ha trabajar con el programa Prosperidad.
texts.en:
Amelia is one of the seven members of the communal bank “L. AMISTAD”; she is married and lives in the Matucana area. Her business does not have a specific name -- she started five years ago selling jelly at first and then, in order to increase her income, purchased a "carrito sanguchero" (a mobile kitchen-cart for preparing fried food) where she now works day in and day out so that she could support her husband in meeting household expenses such as water and electricity bills. 

Together, Amelia and her husband were able to save and buy a mototaxi (a motorcycle with a tricycle-like attachment for transporting passengers), so now they have an additional source of income for the family. Amelia will use the loan to purchase sweets and soft drinks that she will sell alongsiD. hamburgers and fried dishes that she offers to her customers.

Amelia would also like to finish building her house and put up a convenience store with a wiD. range of basic necessity products. The communal bank "L. Amistad" appreciates the trust that is placed in them and their businesses and are committed to continue working with the Prosperidad (prosperity) program.

loans.use: to purchase sweets and soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Maria Elena  Moyano Group

texts.es: Un grupo con características de éxito y empuje para los negocios a si se denomina cada integrante de la alcancía comunal  María Elena Moyano conformada por diez integrantes hace más de  6 años. Cada integrante de dicha alcancía tiene un propósito y un objetivo en la vida el cual es el surgimiento de sus negocios para una estabilidad económica para ellos y sus familias. Tal es así el caso del señor José U. de 48 años de edad casado y padre de 3 hijos, él como todos los días se dedica a la venta de buffet para eventos como en matrimonios y reuniones familiares etc.,  el comenzó en este trabajo a raíz que su hijo estudia  gastronomía peruana, y a si pudo hacer de este comercio un negocio familiar. Con el paso del tiempo ha podido incrementar su negocio y a su ves remodelarlo comprando insumos nuevos y variados, como menajes  y enseres para los buffet. En el futuro le gustaría seguir ampliando  su negocio y expandir por nuevas zonas de trabajo, con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en compra de suministros para la preparación de comidas y postres.
texts.en:
The communal bank "María Elena Moyano" is a successful group of ten individuals that was started six years ago. Every member of the group has a purpose and a goal in life which is to grow their businesses in order to provide economic stability for themselves and for their families. 

This is the case with José U., age 48, who is married and has three children. Jose works every day to provide catering services for weddings, family reunions, and so on. He started in this line of work because his son was studying Peruvian cooking, and this provided an opportunity to start a family business. 

With time, Jose was able to grow and develop his business, purchasing new and varied kitchenware and furnishing for the buffet services he provides. In the future, he would like to keep growing the business and expand into new areas. Jose will use the current loan to purchase ingredients for the preparation of dishes and desserts.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: María Virginia

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Valroc. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable y trabajadora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un bebé de 6 meses  de edad. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella y su esposo tienen un negocio de bazar y cabinas telefónicas, allí además de vender artículos de bazar también venden ropa, perfumes, tarjetas y recargas telefónicas, trabajan todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 21h00. Los productos para el bazar los compra en Portoviejo. Nos cuenta que lleva con su negocio ocho años y que les ha ido bastante bien.

Este crédito es para comprar artículos de bazar, perfumes, tarjetas telefónicas y ropa. Está en el Banco Comunal hace tres ciclos y le gusta porque los créditos les dan sin tantos requisitos.

Su sueño es agrandar más su negocio
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank Valroc meet every fortnight in the canton of Rocafuerte. This place is renowned for its delicious sweets, which are famous in the whole country and are prepared by warm and friendly local people.

Here we met Señora María. She is 23 years old, married and has a 6-month-old baby from this union. Her husband is a merchant. She and her husband have a small hardware store and telephone booths. In addition to hardware, they sell clothes, perfumes, recharge phone cards. They work every day from 8 am to 9 pm. They buy their supplies in Portoviejo. María says that she has been in this business for eight years and that they have done quite well.
This loan will be used to buy hardware articles, perfume, phone cards and clothes. She has had so far three loan cycles and likes her communal bank because the loans are granted without much red tape.

Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy hardware articles, perfume, phone cards and clothes.

loans.name: Jessica Moserrate

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Valroc. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable y trabajadora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Jessica, tiene 21 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una hija de 3 años de edad y está embarazada de tres meses de su segundo hijo. El marido es constructor contratista.

Ella realiza el crédito para el negocio del esposo, él  se dedica a trabajar en el campo de la construcción,  realiza trabajos para Ingenieros que reciben obras del Estado, trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00, nos cuenta que trabaja con la ayuda de 10 operarios a quienes les paga un sueldo semanal, lleva tres años que se dedica a esta actividad.

Este crédito lo requiere para comprar unas carretillas y otras herramientas necesarias en sus trabajos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace tres ciclos y le gusta porque a través de los créditos ella puede contribuir en algo para el hogar.
 
Su sueño es terminar su casa que la tiene en construcción.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank named Valroc meets in the city of Rocafuerte every two weeks. This place is known for its delicious sweets prepared by the locals that are known throughout the country and for the warmth of the kind and hardworking people.

Here we meet Jessica. She is 21 years old, married common-law, she has a 3-year old daughter and she is three months pregnant with her second child. Her husband is a construction contractor.
