Anne J. K. is a woman of thirty years, married to Gilbert Tirop, and they have three children.  They live in Leltot, in the outskirts of Elodret.  Anne does maize and wheat farming and has been doing so for three years.  She gets a monthly income of seven thousand shillings.

This will be Anne's second loan from KADET LTD.  She repaid all other loans successfully.  With this loan, she plans to buy maize seeds, wheat seeds, and fertilizer for her farm.  With the income that she is going to get, she plans to buy a dairy cow for milk production so that she can add to her income. 

In the future, she would like to be a large-scale farmer, and also to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy maize and wheat seeds, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria K. lives in the Ndeeba neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has eight children, one of whom attends school. Victoria has a poultry business.  She has been in this business for less than one year, and she works seven days a week. Victoria sells her products from home by means of retail.  Victoria is requesting a loan for 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more bags of chicken feed and drugs.  She also generates additional income by raising pigs. The main business challenges for Victoria include thieves, transportation of chicken feed, and increasing prices of chicken feed.  Her goals for her business are to own 2,000 chickens and a delivery van to ease transportation. Victoria lives in a home, which she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, food, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feed

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema N. lives in the Kanyanya neighbourhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has four children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of her mother. 

Rehema sells bales of second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Rehema sells her products from home, by means of retail. 

Rehema has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more boxes of bar soap and powdered soap. The main business challenges for Rehema include thieves and seasonality. Her goals for her business are to buy a plot of land and also to start importing clothes herself. 

Rehema lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and  piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, food, and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: El sr. Daniel vive  Zona Monte Alto hace mucho tiempo,  su actividad es el transporte  ya que realiza el recorrido de la zona hacia el centro, su esposa la señora francisca es empleada domestica en la ciudad ambos trabajan para mantener el hogar, salen desde muy temprano de su casa rumbo a su y trabajo,   son personas responsables tienen su casa propia que a base de esfuerzo compraron, les falta terminar la construcción motivo por el cual solicitaron el crédito para la compra de material de construcción para terminar de construir su vivienda y	 así brindar mayor comodidad a su familia, el Sr. Daniel esta agradecido con nuestra entidad por haber confiado en ellos y brindarles un apoyo para poder culminar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Daniel has lived in the Monte Alto are for a long time. He works in transportation, running a route between Monte Alto and the city center. His wife, Francisca, is a housekeeper in the city. Daniel and Francisca both work to support their household. They leave their home very early to go to work. They are both responsible people and they have their own home that they bought thanks to their hard work. 

Daniel and Francisca still need to finish the construction work on their home. For this reason they requested a loan to purchase construction materials to finish building their home. In this way they will be able to provide better comfort for their family. Daniel is grateful to our institution for trusting him and his wife and for providing the support they need to finish their home.

loans.use: to complete the construction work on his house.

loans.name: Naluvule Rural Women's Association Group

texts.en: 28-year-old N. Slyvia was selling clothes before she had a change of mind and ventured into her current hardware business at the Naluvule trading center in Kampala. That was almost a decade ago. This mother of 4 says that with the passage of time, she has gone through a mill of chequered experiences in running her business. These experiences have both been positive and negative but being the upbeat person that she is, she has chosen always to make the best out of her bad situations. Monthly, she says this business generates for her 500,000 Ugandan shillings in profit. She says that with this loan she is going to purchase more bags of cement and metallic doors to resell. She is looking at the prospect of better sales revenues after she makes those purchases.

loans.use: to buy cement and doors to resell

loans.name: Nury Del Socorro

texts.es:
Debido a su separación a sus 49 años de edad, Nury del Socorro M. G., se vio obligada a emprender su propio negocio, producción y venta de arepas, el cual se ha convertido en la fuente de sustento para ella y sus dos hijos. 

Desde las 3:00 de la mañana esta emprendedora está en pie realizando las labores propias de su negocio y aunque su larga jornada va hasta después del medio día, Nury está convencida de que sólo así podrá salir adelante y ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos quienes son el motor que la impulsa a trabajar día a día. 

Nury trabaja con el sueño de mejorar su negocio hasta convertirse en una empresa reconocida que genere mayores ingresos. Actualmente necesita de un préstamo para comprar un horno a gas lo que le mejorará el proceso puesto que es más rápido y le reducirá los costos que actualmente debe pagar por el servicio de energía.
texts.en:
Due to her separation at 49 years old, Nury del Socorro M. G. had to start her own business making and selling arepas, which supports her and her two children.

At 3:00am, this entrepreneur is on her feet doing work for her business, and her long day goes until after noon.  Nury is convinced that this is the way she can succeed and offer her children a better quality of life.  This is what drives her to work every day.  

Nury works with the dream of improving her business and having it become a recognized store that generates a larger income.  She currently is asking for a loan to purchase a gas stove, which will improve the process because it is faster and will reduce the costs she pays for energy.

loans.use: to purchase a gas stove.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey O. N. is forty-nine years old.  He is married and he and his wife have seven children aged between sixteen and three years old, whom they hope to educate to university level. His business is located at a busy market known as Juakali in Kisumu. Kisumu is the region in Kenya that harbors Lake Victoria and is commonly referred to as the lake basin. 

Godfrey runs a well-known auto spare parts shop by the name of Tumaini Spare Parts Shop. In addition to the shop, he also runs a garage in the same place. He has been operating this business for eighteen years now and has managed to provide employment to ten people. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraint. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. 

Godfrey is using this loan of Kes 50,000 to increase his inventory of auto spare parts to expand his buisness and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to grow his business and be able to import car engines from Dubai. In the future, he sees himself owning a transport business. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: increase his inventory of spare parts

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam N. lives in the Kalerwe neighbourhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 6 children, none of whom is in school.  Mariam has a business selling fruits and vegetables at the market by means of retail. She has been in this business for less than one year and works 7 days out of every week. 

Mariam has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more boxes of tomatoes, cabbages and onions. The main business challenges for Mariam include thieves and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on a wholesale basis only and also start growing the fruits herself.   

Mariam lives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, food and school fees.

loans.use: buy more tomatoes, onions and cabbages to resell

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: La Sra. Sonia tiene 34 años, casada y con un  hijo pequeño, tiene ya  2 años dedicándose a la venta de comida, realiza el almuerzo completo al medio día y por las noches vende pacumuto(pollo frito)acompañado con sodas y un tanto de cerveza los fines de semana. La Sra.  Sonia vive en casa de sus suegra con buena comunicación con sus cuñadas. Dña.  Sonia   se vio en la necesidad de solicitar crédito de nuestra institución debido al crecimiento apresurado de su negocio ya que incluso los clientes le piden que incorpore una rokola y con el dinero del crédito comprara una rokola. Ella   es cliente antigua  de la institución con buen comportamiento de pago,  ella es una persona joven trabajadora, su deseo es ampliar su negocio, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Sonia is 34 years old, married and has one young son. She has been selling food for 2 years. She offers a complete lunch in the afternoon and in the evenings she sells (fried chicken) accompanied by sodas and some beers on the weekends. Sonia lives in a home with her mother-in-law and has a good relationship with her in-laws. Sonia saw the need to request a loan from our institution because of the speedy growth of her business and because her customers have asked her to buy a jukebox. With the money from this loan she will purchase a jukebox. Sonia is a long-standing client with our institution with a good repayment history. She is a young, hard-working woman and her goal is to expand her business. She is grateful to the institution for the support they have given her.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and to buy a jukebox.

loans.name: Ayitchevo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement AYITCHEVO est composé de 18 membres qui se connaissent de par leurs activités et qui vivent tous dans le même village et dans la même agglomération à Allada. La présidente de ce groupement, du nom de Célestine, est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé.
Célestine est mariée à un certain Eugène et a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Il y a une vingtaine d’année que Célestine et son mari se sont installés à Houngbado à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique. Célestine n’est jamais allée à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Célestine mène comme activité depuis vingt cinq ans environs, la transformation de noix de palme en huile de palme puis la vente de ce produit à Allada. C'est à Avakpa (dans l'Atlantique) que Célestine s'approvisionne. Parallèlement à cette activité, Célestine prépare de l'"akassa" (aliment local fait à base d'amidon de maïs) qu'elle vend à Avakpa. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Célestine sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Son ambition est d’amener son activité à un niveau plus élevé.
texts.en:
The AYITCHEVO group is composed of 18 members who know one another through their occupations and who all live in the same village and district in Allada. The president of the group, named Celestine, is the woman who is holding her hand up in the picture. In order to increase the level of their activities to better answer their customers' expectations, this group is requesting ALIDe's financial support.
Celestine is married to one Eugene and has four children, who all attend school. The couple takes charge of the various family affairs together. About twenty years ago, Celestine and her husband settled in Houngbado (in Allada, Atlantic region). Celestine never went to school. To provide for her and her family's needs, Celestine has been in the business of processing the palm fruit into palm oil for about 25 years; she then sells this product in Allada. Celestine gets her supplies from Avakpa (Atlantic region). In addition to this activity, Celestine prepares "akassa" (a local food product based on corn starch), which she sells in Avakpa. Celestine is requesting a loan from ALIDe with the objective to develop her business and to better satisfy her customers. Her ambition is to bring her activity to a higher level.

loans.use: to purchase palm fruits and corn

loans.name: José Guadalupe

texts.es:
El señor José esta solicitando su cooperación para este crédito ya que tiene que operar a su esposa la señora Leonila de sus ojos. 
Y no cuenta con el dinero necesario para pagar la clínica donde  realizaran la operación ya que es urgente porque su esposa esta perdiendo la vista. Desea que su esposa este bien de salud. 
Pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe como empleado de una compañía de trasportes como administrador.
texts.en: Jose is requesting your help with this loan because his wife, Leonila, needs to have eye surgery. He does not have the money necessary to pay the clinic where the surgery will take place. This surgery is urgent because his wife is losing her eyesight. Jose wants his wife to be in good health. He will repay the loan with the salary he receives as an administrator of a transportation company.

loans.use: pay for medical expenses for his wife.

loans.name: Julieth Verónica

texts.es:
Contribuir con los gastos del hogar fue el propósito con el que Julieth Verónica G. inició su peluquería, pues aunque sus sueño es ingresar a la universidad la falta de recursos económico no se lo ha permitido, por ello, se dedicó al oficio que desde pequeña aprendió al lado de su madre. 

A sus 19 años de edad, Julieth se caracteriza por su responsabilidad, es por ello que de domingo a domingo esta joven emprendedora trabaja en su peluquería en la que además vende productos de belleza. 

En el futuro, Julieth espera crecer su negocio hasta que sea reconocido en la ciudad, por ahora, necesita de un préstamo para comprar productos de belleza y así mejorar su inventario e incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Julieth started her salon with the goal of contribuiting to paying the household expenses. Although her dream is to go to university, the lack of economic resources has prevented her from doing this. So, she is working in the trade that she has learned at her mother's side since she was little. 
At 19 years old, Julieth is characterized by her responsibility. For this reason, from Sunday to Sunday, this young entrepreneur works in her salon in which she also sells beauty products. 
In the future, Julieth hopes to grow her business until it is well know in the city. For now, she needs a loan to buy beauty products and so to improve her inventory and increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Mary Cruz

texts.es: La señora Mary  madre de una hija, lucha en la vida por darle una buena educación, la actividad que tiene esta en crecimiento  gracias a los esfuerzos realizados de cada día en la venta de hamburguesas, inicio su negocio hece mucho tiempo atrás de manera muy humilde obteniendo buenos resultados ya que las hamburguesas que prepara son muy agradables para su clientela, debido  a esta razón es que se animo a solicitar un crédito nuevo en la institución para incrementar su capital de trabajo comprando insumos e ingredientes para la elaboración de sus riquísimas hamburguesas por la demanda de la clientela, siendo este un emprendimiento de una mujer dedicada a su trabajo por el cual ese esfuerzo su trabajo lo realiza todos los dias a partir de las 16:00 pm hasta las 24:00 pm, durante la semana para que sus niña y ella misma puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida para un futuro próximo.
texts.en:
Mary is the mother of one daughter and she works hard to provide her with a good education. Mary's business is growing thanks to her daily efforts selling hamburgers. She started her business a long time ago with just a humble operation. She had success early on because her customers really like the hamburgers that she prepares. 

For this reason Mary has requested a new loan from our institution to increase her working capital. She will buy supplies and ingredients to make her delicious hamburgers to meet the demands of her customers. Because Mary is very dedicated to her business she works every day from 4pm until midnight so that she and her daughter can have a better quality of life in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and ingredients to make delicious hamburgers.

loans.name: Antonio José

texts.es:
En la parte de atrás de la humilde casa de Antonio José B. se encuentra un espacio destinado a la producción de arepas y aunque vive a unos 15 minutos de Santa Bárbara al suroeste de Antioquia, esto no es impedimento para que su producción sea vendida diariamente en el municipio y a sus vecinos. 

A sus 63 años de edad cansado de trabajar como empleado esporádicamente y con pocos ingresos para sostener a su esposa y cubrir los gastos del hogar, desde hace algún tiempo decidió enfrentarse solo para ganarse la vida. Actualmente se ha incrmentado el número de pedidos por lo que necesita de un préstamo para construir una estufa eficiente que le permita responderle a sus clientes y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
In the back of Antonio José B.'s humble home is a designated space for making arepas. Although he lives about 15 minutes away from Santa Barbara, in the southeast of Antioquia, this does not keep him from selling his product daily in the city and to his neighbors.  

At 63 years old, tired of working sporadically as an employee and having little income to support his wife and cover household expenses, he decided to go out on his own to make his living. Currently, his orders have increased which is why he needs a loan to build an efficient stove that will allow him to respond to his customers and to improve his income.

loans.use: build an efficient stove.

loans.name: Emprendedores De Vitarte Group

texts.es: Un grupo entusiasta y emprendedor como bien lo dice su nombre, así se caracteriza la alcancía comunal Emprendedores de Vitarte integrada por 7 miembros hace más de 5 meses. Un grupo con mucho en común como el deseo de superación y con una historia en particular de cada integrante, tal es así el caso de la señora Pilar Q. de 42 años de edad casada y con seis hijos. Ella se dedica diariamente a la venta de Yogurt, trabajo que viene desempeñando desde hace más de siete años y que aprendió en un Taller que realizó EDAPROSPO. Con el esfuerzo de su trabajo  ha logrado mejorar su calidad de vida, ya que ha amoblado su casa y a la vez está dándoles una Educación de calidad a sus hijos. Pilar Q. eventualmente se dedica a la venta de menús los fines de semana, para a si lograr algunos ingresos extras. Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá para la compra de materiales que le permitirán ampliar la venta de menús. En el futuro le gustaría formalizar su negocio, lo cual le permitirá expandirse por otros sectores, para a si seguir cumpliendo las metas y deseos de ella y de su familia.
texts.en:
The community bank Emprendedores de Vitarte [Entrepreneurs of Vitarte] is an enthusiastic and enterprising group, as their name says.  It started more than five months ago, and has seven members.  The group has a lot in common, like the desire to succeed, and each member has their own story.  This is the case with Pilar Q., who is 42 years old, married, and has six children.  She works every day selling yogurt.  She began doing this work more than seven years ago, and learned it at a workshop held by EDAPROSPO.  

With the effort of her work, she has succeeded in improving her quality of life, since she has furnished her home, and she is giving her children a quality education.  Pilar Q. eventually began selling menus on the weekends to earn extra income.  With this loan, she will invest it to purchase materials that will allow her to expand her menu sales.  In the future, she would like to formalize her business, which would allow her to expand into other areas so that she could continue meeting her goals and the desires of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials that will allow her to expand her menu sales business.

loans.name: Claudina

texts.es: La señora Claudina  era cliente del grupo solidario "leo" quien trabajo 18 secuencias  demostrando puntualidad y responsabilidad  con sus pagos, ella se dedica a  la   venta de comida se levanta muy temprano para preparar los alimentos y poderlos vender a los  choferes del sindicato para ella es un trabajo sacrificado debido a que debe levantar ollas con bastante peso para poder salir a su negocio que se encuentra ubicado  en la zona el tejar  con los ingresos que percibe mantiene y paga los estudios de sus   cuatro hijos  debido a que hace poco tiempo falleció su esposo y quedó viuda y también falleció su hija mayor quien le ayudaba con los quehaceres del trabajo, fue un golpe para ella ya que perdió a dos miembros de su familia, pero ahora esta saliendo adelante. Ahora el crédito lo  destinará  para comprar de abarrotes para su segunda actividad ya que también tiene una tienda de barrio en el mismo lugar que vende comida  y así mejorar sus ingresos, es una persona muy fuerte y luchadora, agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Claudina used to be a member of the "Leo" communal bank and made her payments punctually and responsibly through 18 loan cycles. She sells food, rising very early to prepare the products and be able to sell them to the drivers' union. This is very difficult work for her, because she has to carry extremely heavy pots to get them to her business, which is located in the El Tejar neighborhood. 

With the income she earns she cares for her four children and pays for their education. Not too long ago her husband died and she has not remarried. Her oldest daughter, who helped with her work, also died. It was a great blow for her to lose two members of her family, but now she is getting by. 

She will use this loan to buy groceries for her second business, which is a neighborhood store in the same location where she sells food, and in this way she will increase her income. She is a very strong person and a real fighter, and she is grateful for the support offered by Emprender.

loans.use: to purchase barrels of oil and groceries for her second business

loans.name: Ayub

texts.en:
Ayub O. O. is a married man. His wife is a businesslady and they have six children aged between twenty-seven and thirteen years old. His business is located at the busy Nyalenda market in Kisumu. Kisumu is the region in Kenya that harbors the Lake Victoria and is commonly referred to as the lake basin. 

Ayub runs a general store in which he sells items such as beverages, sugar, detergents, flour, cooking oil, etc. to the local people. He has been running this business for five years now. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is that there are other people in the area doing the same business, and thus his customers are not loyal as they are spoilt for choice. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well.  

Ayub is using his loan of Kes 80,000 to increase his stock of cooking oil, sugar, flour, milk and bread to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to grow his business and be able to open another general store in a different area. He describes himself as hardworking and honest.

loans.use: buy cooking oil, sugar, flour, milk and bread to resell

loans.name: Las Rosas Group

texts.en:
Ana requires a loan to buy flour, cooking oil, butter and baking soda. She runs a small bakery where she prepares homemaD. bread in her house.  With the profits, she is planning to save to build her own house.  Most of our associates do not have their own houses, or they have them in a simple structure. One of the most important challenges and dreams for them is to buy or build their own houses.

Ana lives in the Santo Domingo area in one of the poorest communities surrounding the main city of the Dominican Republic. Ana and her group of 20 women are taking out loans for their businesses. This group is named Las Rosas 1, 2, 3 & 4.

This is Ana´s second loan with Esperanza International. She has taken a step toward improving her business by investing her last loan to increase her sales by starting her business again. She has had her business for over 10 years but stopped running it for some years.  After taking out her first  Esperanza loan she restarted her business. Her most difficult challenges are to build her house, save money, and proviD. for her 5 children.

She says that her favorite thing is to listen to music. Ana and her group are thankful for your support! 

This group has two photos because there were too many to be in just one, and we try to show the faces most visibly by having two photos.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, butter and baking soda

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Composé de neuf femmes mariées les membres du groupe BENKADI ont une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et de 6 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales nucléaires avec leurs enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier HEREMAKONO-NORD de la ville de BOUGOUNI, troisième région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Par des relations d’amitié et de commerce, ces femmes se sont connues et font le commerce de condiments alimentaires, de pagnes, de draps de lit, de tissus teintés et de poissons avec Rokia T.. 
Dans le souci d’améliorer leur capacité d’achat afin de satisfaire l’attente des clients, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, avec qui elles sont à leur deuxième  prêt de groupe. Le prêt précédent a été bien remboursé. 
Madame Rokia T. fait le commerce de poisson frais qu’elle a appris auprès de sa maman depuis le bas âge. Avec ce prêt Rokia T. compte acheter 200kg de poissons de mer et 120 kg de poisson d’eau douce. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des bozos pécheurs installés au long du fleuve SANKARANI dans la préfecture de YANFOLILA, tandis-que les poissons de mer congelés sont achetés de la Côte d’Ivoire. Toutes les ventes se font en détail, au comptant et à crédit dans la ville de BOUGOUNI à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Avec ce prêt le elle compte obtenir un bénéfice mensuel de 20 000 FCFA alors que les autres membres du groupe comptent sur un bénéfice mensuel de 15 000F CFA qui sera utilisé selon elles dans leur activité.
texts.en:
Made up of nine married women, the members of this Benkadi group have an average age of 38 and on average, 6 children each. They live in nuclear families with their children and husbands. The women live in the HEREMAKONO-NORD district of the town of BOUGOUNI, third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.  

These women met because of friendships and commercial relationships, and they sell condiments, lengths of African-print cloth, sheets, dyed cloth, and, in the case of Rokia T., fish. 

Wishing to expand their purchasing power so that they can satisfy the demand of their clientele, they decided to join the Microfinance Institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are on their second group loan. The preceding loan was correctly reimbursed. 

Mrs. Rokia T. sells fresh fish, a business she learned from her mother when she was very young. With this loan she intends to buy 200 kg of saltwater fish and 120 kg of fresh water fish. She buys her fresh water fish from Bozo-ethnicity fishermen along the river SANKARANI in the prefecture of YANFOLILA, whereas she buys her ocean fish frozen in Ivory Coast. All her sales are retail, for cash or credit, in the town of BOUGOUNI to a clientele composed of men and women. With this loan, she expects to make a monthly profit of 20,000 F CFA whereas the other members of the group expect a monthly profit of 15,000 F CFA which they say will be used for their businesses.

loans.use: to buy ocean fish and fresh water fish for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: invest in her business selling lingerie.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: La Sra. Rosario de 32 años de edad, soltera, vive en casa familiar con sus dos hijos menores de edad, solventando ella sola todos sus gastos.  Tiene su kiosco dentro de un colegio en el cual vende dulces, empanadas, panchitos y otros, ya hace tres años, como actividad secundaria se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, ropa, zapatos y otros a pedido. El crédito que se le otorgo es para la compra de mercadería, dulces galletas, jugos para surtir su kiosco. La Sra. Rosario es una persona muy trabajadora luchadora sola tiene que seguir adelante para el  bienestar de su familia,  quedo muy agradecida por la oportunidad que se le brindo con un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Rosario is 32 years old, single, and lives in the family home with her two young children.  She is responsible for all of her expenses.  For three years, she has had a kiosk inside a school where she sells candy, meat pies, salted peanuts, and other items.  She also sells cosmetics, clothing, shoes, and other items by order.  

With this loan, she will purchase merchandise to stock her kiosk, including candy, cookies, and juices.  Rosario is a hard-working person who has to fight alone for the well-being of her family.  She is very thankful for the opportunity that this new loan gives her.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her kiosk at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Huaraypata Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HUARAYPATA ”; Este banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Huaraypata,  provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Matilde: es casada y tiene 45 años de edad; la socia tiene 2 hijos; la socia se dedica  a la crianza de pollo, a la venta de flores, y a la atención de sus tienda de abarrotes, la socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y nos comenta que ella trata de ocupar su tiempo en todo lo que le gusta hacer y desea sacar a sus hijos adelante, para ello ella bien trabajando en todo lo que se pueda y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos. La socia solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de más pollitos y de este modo aumentar su galpón, también desea implementar su tienda de abarrotes. 

Los otros socios del banco comunal se dedican a la venta de comidas caceras; venta de flores, venta de verduras, tienda de abarrotes, venta de verduras, agricultura.


La socia está muy agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "Huaraypata". This bank is located in the community of Huaraypata, in the province of Quispicanchis, and the department of Cusco.
The member is called Matilde. She is married and 45 years old. She has 2 children. She works raising chickens and selling flowers, and also has a grocery store. The member is a very hardworking woman and she tells us that she trys to spend her time doing things that she enjoys and that she wants to help her children to be successful. For this reason, she tries to do her work well and improve the quality of life for her children. She is requesting a loan to buy more chicks and so to increase the flock in her coop. She also wants to implement her grocery store.
The other members of the community bank work selling homemade meals, selling flowers, selling vegetables, running a grocery store, selling vegetables, and in agriculture. 
The member is very grateful for the loan and promises to make the repayments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to invest in their businesses.

loans.name: Adiel

texts.es:
Adiel B. es un hombre de 36 años, que se dedica a la venta de naranjas al por mayor y al detal en la  plaza del mercado de Barranquillita, espacio de gran movilización comercial muy conocido en la ciudad, donde transitan  amas de casa, vendedores ambulantes, empresas y negocios en general; desde allí Adiel distribuye sus productos  hacia municipios del departamento del Atlántico y a todos los vendedores ambulantes del mercado y de la ciudad de Barranquilla, así como a algunos supermercados que también  le compran. Su negocio inició hace 6 años, dándole curso a su naturaleza independiente, porque necesitaba desarrollar su autonomía y al mismo tiempo generar ingresos para  el auto sostenimiento. Adiel ha recibido  seis financiamientos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con ellos ha logrado financiar su cartera de clientes,  pues antes solo vendía de contado y ahora puede ofrecer este servicio, pero eso si escogiendo clientes rentables; su meta es continuar ampliando su cobertura en lugares donde hasta el momento no ha llegado y para eso se prepara, pero  mientras esto ocurre continua trabajando con su  ayudante y generando una rentabilidad no menor del 40%. 
En la Actualidad Adiel está solicitando su credikiva para comprar naranjas y verduras al por mayor, pues desde hace 5 meses está suministrándole diariamente estos productos, a los hogares de Bienestar familiar, programa que el gobierno desarrolla en los estratos 1 y 2 del Sistema de Identificación y Clasificación de Potenciales Beneficiarios para los programas sociales,  con el propósito de lograr una atención integral  a la Primera Infancia, contribuyendo con el   mejoramiento de la alimentación y nutrición de niños y niñas.  Adiel proyecta que esta inversión será exitosa, porque está enfocada a aumentar la distribución de sus productos en este programa de una gran envergadura y estabilidad, que le representan a él un impacto positivo de sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Adiel B. is 36 years old and works selling oranges at wholesale and for retail in the market plaza in Barranquillita, a large commercial space that is very well known in the city where housewives, traveling vendors, business, and stores shop.  From there, Adiel distributes his products to municipalities in the Atlántico department, all the traveling vendors in the market and the city of Barannquilla, and some supermarkets also buy from him.  His business started six years ago from his natural independence, because he needed to develop his independence and also generate income to support himself.

Adiel has received six loans from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which has allowed him to offer financing to his customers.  Before he only accepted cash, and now he can offer this service, but only if he chooses profitable customers.  His goal is to continue growing his business in areas where he has not gone yet.  He is preparing for this, but until it happens, he continues working with his assistant and generating a profit of no less than 40%.

Currently, Adiel is asking for this Kiva loan to purchase oranges and vegetables at wholesale.  For about five months, he has been supplying these products daily to the homes of Family Welfare, a government program developed in the levels 1 and 2 of the System of Identification and Classification of Potential Beneficiaries of social programs.  It has the goal of drawing attention to the importance of early childhood and contributing to the improvement in feeding and nutrition of children.  Adiel believes this investment will be successful, because he is focused on increasing the distribution of his products in this large scale and stable program, which will have a positive impact on his income.

loans.use: to purchase oranges and vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Barra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BARRA est composé de quatre femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et de 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, époux et enfants. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de BOUGOUNI, région de SIKASSO en république du Mali. Ces dames se sont connues par des relations de mariage et de commerce. Dans l’intention d’augmenter leur capacité  financière enfin de faire assez de stock, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela pour faire le commerce des céréales et de condiments. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe et elles n’ont connues aucun problème de remboursement. 
Avec ce prêt Adiaratou D. la présidente du groupe compte acheter 200kg de beurre de karité et 500 kg de graines de néré. Les produits sont achetés auprès des fournisseurs des  villages environnants de Bougouni pour ensuite être revendus en détail et en gros sur le marché de BOUGOUNI au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt ces femmes espèrent obtenir un bénéfice de 20 000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé dans leurs activités.
texts.en:
The BARRA group is made up of four married women whose average age is 30 with four children each, on average. They live in traditional extended families with their brothers and sisters, husbands and children. These women live in the Massablacoura district of the town of BOUGOUNI, SIKASSO region, in the Republic of Mali. They met because of being in-laws or business colleagues. With a view to growing their working capital so that they can purchase enough stock, they decided to join the Microfinance Institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to sell cereals and condiments. They are on their second group loan and they have had no problem with reimbursement.  

With this loan Adiaratou D. , the president of the group, intends to buy 200 kg of shea butter and 500 kg of  "néré" seeds. These products are bought from suppliers in the villages surrounding Bougouni to be sold wholesale or retail at the BOUGOUNI market, for cash or credit, to a clientele composed essentially of women. 
 
With this loan, the women hope to make a monthly profit of 20,000 F CFA which will be used for their business needs.

loans.use: to purchase condiments for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies and ingredients for making Churrascos [grilled meat]

loans.name: Butaaha Tweimukye Group, Kyenjojo

texts.en: Mary K. is an old but strong and very hard-working lady who works tirelessly with her husband. She is the leader of the Butaaha Tweimukye group of Kyenjojo.  She is involved in agriculture, raising pigs that she sells while her husband has a shop selling pork. Mary sells piglets and pigs from her home and is able to generate income that has helped her educate and take of her children. This business is a self-initiative which she boosted with the help of a loan. She hopes to continuously expand her pigsty and have a financially and socially stable business. Mary needs a loan to be able to buy more piglets and pig feed.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales nucléaires avec leurs enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans la ville de BOUGOUNI qui relève de la 3eme région administrative de la république du Mali. Ces dames se sont connues à travers des relations de commerce. Dans l’intention d’augmenter leur ressource financière afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela pour faire le commerce de savons, des céréales et d’oignons avec Djénébou S..
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe et le précédant a été bien soldé.  
Avec ce prêt Djénébou S. compte acheter 5 sacs de 50 kg d’Oignons auprès des grossistes de SIKASSO pour les revendre ensuite en détail au comptant et à crédit au grand marché de la ville de BOUGOUNI à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt les femmes envisagent obtenir un bénéfice de 10 000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé selon elles dans leurs activités.
texts.en:
This BENKADI group is composed of married women with an average age of 28 and on average, three children. They live in nuclear families with their children and spouse. These women reside in the town of  BOUGOUNI which is part of the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They know each other because of being business colleagues. 

With the intention of growing their working capital so as to satisfy the needs of their clientele, they decided to join the Microfinance Institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to sell soap, cereals, and, in the case of Djénébou S., onions. They are on their second group loan and the preceding was correctly reimbursed. 

With this loan, Djénébou S. intends to buy five sacks of 50 kg of onions from wholesalers in Sikasso, which will be sold retail, for cash or credit, at the big marketplace of the town on Bougouni to a clientele composed essentially of women.

With this loan the women expect to make a profit of 10,000 F CFA per month which they say will be used for their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase onions for resale.

loans.name: Solidario Dios Es Amor Group

texts.es:
Solidario Dios Es Amor: este grupo esta formado por dos señoras y un señor D. los Cuales las dos señoras se  dedican a la venta frutas y verduras y  nececitan el credito para la compra D. frutas y verduras. 
Don Clementino Por su parte se dedica a la barberia el nos cuenta que a tenido un asenso en su negocio porque tiene mucha demanda D. sus clientes.el es presidente del grupo y se siente muy contento porque tiene la oportunidad D. un credito ya que cree que nececita D. mas capital para trabajar el nececita el credito para la compra D. cosmeticos para barberia su sueño es tener otro local y asi tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Solidario Dios Es Amor: this group is comprised of two women and one man, of which the two women sell fruits and vegetables and need the loan to buy fruits and vegetables. 
Don Clementino, for his part, is a barber, and tells us that he has been promoted at work because he is in demand by his clients. He is the president of the group and he feels very happy because he has the opportunity to get a loan. He believes he needs more capital in order to work. He needs the loan to buy cosmetics for the barber's shop. His dream is to have another premises and so to have greater income.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for a barber's shop and to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shoes at wholesale rate

loans.name: Reyna Florentina

texts.es:
Reyna  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Wiñay”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y  departamento de Puno, tiene 56  años de edad.  Está casada y tiene 2 hijos independientes.  Tiene grado de instrucción  educación primaria. 
Se dedica a la venta de golosinas y carne de cordero.  Trabaja   con el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace más de seis años, el préstamo  inicial fue por S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 2000.00 nuevo soles, comprará golosinas,  gaseosas y galletas, estos productos los compra en Desaguadero para luego venderlos en la ciudad, en el negocio le ayuda su hijo y su esposo quien trabaja en construcción civil.
Su sueño es tener una tienda de abarrotes bien implementado.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es el compañerismo y la responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Reyna, age 56, is married and has two grown children. She is a member of the communal bank “Wiñay" in the Puno district of the Puno province in the department of Puno. Reyna has primary school education. 

Reyna makes her living selling sweets and lamb meat. She has been working with the Manuela  Ramos organization for over six years; the initial loan was for 300 soles which she invested in her business. 

Reyna will use the new loan of 2000 soles to purchase sweets, soft drinks, and cookies. She buys her inventory in the town of Desaguadero and later resells it. Her son and her husband, who works in construction, also help her with the business. Reyna's dream is to have a well-appointed grocery store; what she likes best about her communal bank is the team spirit and the sense of responsibility.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, soft drinks, and cookies

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena tiene 23 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su pareja Juan de 33 años y su  querida hija Jacky de 08 años de edad a quien desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Con mucho esfuerzo Elena ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva, cacao, maní y ajonjolíes, productos que tiene mucha demanda en el mercado, y que su comercialización se hace al por mayor en los centros de acopio de San Francisco y Kimbiri. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse y sustentar los gastos de educación de su querida hija; es por ello que pone todas sus ganas en sacar adelante sus cultivos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, ya que se siente muy feliz haciéndolo, lleva 05 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta su comunidad que es un recorrido de 02 horas de caminata. Para el futuro espera comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos. Este es su 12avo crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en su anterior crédito y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre está al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con el crédito solicitado comprará fungicidas y estiércol de animales para fertilizar sus campos de cultivo, para obtener una buena producción de sus frutos.
texts.en:
Elena is 23 years old and she is a very hard working woman. She lives in a house that she owns together with her partner, Juan, who is 33 years old, and their beloved daughter Jacky who is 8 years old, to whom they want to provide a better quality of life. 

With a great deal of effort Elena has manages to work her fields to make them very productive. She cultivates cocoa, peanuts, and sesame seeds, products that are in great demand in the market. She sells in wholesale at the commercial centers of San Francisco and Kimbiri. Her cultivations have given her the necessary income to support herself and to cover the education expenses of her beloved daughter. This is the reason why she puts all of her efforts into her cultivations. What she most enjoys about her work is taking care of the plantations as she always feels very happy doing so. She has 5 years in the business. She considers the most difficult part of her work to be the transportation of her products from the fields to her community, which is about 2 hours’ walking distance. In the future she hopes to purchase more land to increase her cultivations. This is her 12th loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she has been very punctual with her past loan and she hopes to remain so with this one. In her communal bank she is a member who participates and she is always up to date with the agreements that have been reached by the group. With the loan that she requests she will purchase fungicides and manure to fertilize her plantations to obtain a good yield of her products.

loans.use: to purchase fungicides and chicken manure to fertilize her fields.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame K. sells plastic containers such as pails, baskets and basins, in Eguafo near the fishing town of Elmina. Her husband works in a gold mine and Maame’s income helps pay for their utility bills and accommodations.  

Maame is keen to grow her business and plans to use her Kiva loan to buy more plastic items to sell. She wants to reinvest any additional profits she earns back into her business for further growth.

loans.use: buy more plasticware to sell

loans.name: Leidy Diana

texts.es:
Leidy Diana A. trabaja hace un año como propietaria de una peluquería la cual montó con el fin de convertirse en microempresaria y además para poner en práctica todos los conocimientos adquiridos en una institución para el aprendizaje de técnicas de belleza, en la ciudad de Medellín.
 
Para Leidy es muy satisfactorio haber pasado de empleada a convertirse en su propio jefe y manejar sus horarios de acuerdo a sus necesidades. Esta mujer emprendedora sueña con poder vincular a 2 personas más a su negocio y requiere capital para comprar mejores insumos y pagar algunas deudas que la peluquería le ha generado, así podrá tener mejor manejo de su economía y abrirles las oportunidades de empleo a otras personas.
texts.en:
Leidy Diana A. has owned a hairdressing salon for one year.  She set up the business so that she could become a small businesswoman and put into practice all the skills that she learned in an institute where they teach beauty techniques, in the city of Medellín.

It has been very satisfying for Leidy to go from being an employee to becoming her own boss and managing her hours according to her needs.  This enterprising woman dreams of being able to hire two more people to work in her business and she needs capital to buy better supplies and pay off some debts that her hairdressing salon has created.  In this way, she will be able to better manage her finances and create job opportunities for other people.

loans.use: to buy a display case and beauty products

loans.name: Maria Fabiao

texts.pt:
Maria Fabiaõ M. nasceu no Dsitrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique Viuva mãe de 2 filhos de 15 e 18 anos de  idade todos vaõ a Escola. Fez somente 5ª classe não continuou devido a gravidez precoce e teve que interoper seus estudos. Vive na casa propria com a sua família e sustenta sua sobrinha que vive com ela.

Nunca saiu da sua cidade natal, é funcionaria de uma instituição do estado onde trabalha como servente ha mais 14 anos. Naõ possui empregado e tem salario de 2.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e as vezes consegue poupar uma parte na sua conta bancaria.

Ja teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku porque esta proximo do local onde ela trabalha. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, pedra, areia, blocos e outros) para continuar com a construção da sua casa. 

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros créditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos empréstimos para terminar com a construção da sua casa.
texts.en:
Maria Fabiaõ M. was born in Boane District, Maputo Province, in southern Mozambique. She is widowed and the mother of two children, ages 15 and 18. Both attend school. She only completed 5th grade and didn't continue due to a pregnancy that interrupted her schooling. She lives in her own home with her family and supports her niece, who lives with her.

She has never left her native city, and she is employed at a state institution where she has worked for over 14 years. She doesn't have any employees and earns a salary of 2,500 meticais per month, which she uses for household expenses. She sometimes is able to save a portion in her bank account. 

She has had loans from other banks in the past, and learned of Hluvuku because it is near the location where she is working. This is her first loan at Hluvuku, and it is for 10,000 meticais. She plans to buy construction material (cement, stone, sand, bricks, and other items) to continue building her home. 

She is committed to paying on schedule to be able to obtain future loans. She plans to request new loans to finish building her home.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cement, stone, sand, bricks, and other items).

loans.name: Juana Irma

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Wiñay” ubicado en el distrito D. Puno, provincia y departamento D. Puno, tiene 55 años D. edad.  Está separada y tiene 06 hijos (2 dependientes y 4 independientes).  La señora estudió educación superior técnico. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace más D. seis años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio D. venta D. productos D. quinua (cereal) y venta D. joyas y cosméticos por catálogo.
Ella requiere un nuevo crédito por la suma D. S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar treinta conos D. lana D. diferentes colores para sus tejidos D. chales, comprará quinua y solicitará productos D. Avon, como colonias y desodorantes.  La señora trabaja sola.  
Su sueño es tener un kiosco en el centro o en el muelle D. la ciudad para poder vender con comodidad sus productos D. quinua.	
Lo que le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es la responsabilidad y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the communal bank named "Winay", located in the district of Puno, of the province and department of Puno. She is 55 years old, separated, and she has 6 children (2 are dependent and 4 are independent). She has achieved post-secondary technical training.

She has been with the Manuela Ramos movement (Kiva Field Partner) for more than six years. Her first loan was in the amount of S/. 300 nuevos soles. The funds were invested in her quinoa cereal business and her jewelry and cosmetics sales business.

She requires a new loan in the amount of S/. 2000 nuevos soles, funds that will be used to purchase thirty cones of wool of various colors to knit wraps. She will also purchase quinoa and Avon brand products such as colognes and deodorants. She works alone. 

Her dream is to have a store in the downtown area or at the city dock to be able to sell her products more comfortably. 

She enjoys the responsibility and the timeliness of her communal bank.

loans.use: to purchase quinoa cereal, wool and cosmetics

loans.name: Milton

texts.en:
Milton O. M. is a married man.  His wife is a businesslady.  They have four children aged between seventeen and nine years old, whom they hope to educate to the university level. 

Milton's business is located at Kisumu. Kisumu is the region in Kenya that harbors Lake Victoria and is commonly referred to as the lake basin. He runs a shop in which he sells phones, phone accessories and auto spare parts.  His shop is well-known and is called Celtake Phone Services. He has been running this business for four years now and has managed to give employment to two people. 

Milton says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. However he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 70,000 to increase his stock of phones and phone accessories to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to grow his business and open other mobile phone shops in different towns. He describes himself as hardworking and honest.

loans.use: buy phones and phone accessories

loans.name: Danny

texts.es:
Danny F. Q., tiene la edad de 19 años, está soltero  y vive aun con sus padres y sus hermanos. El pretende con el dinero realizar la compra de herramientas y maquinas para la facilitación de sus trabajos en construcción. El cuenta con experiencia  ya de varios años trabajando en esto y  cuenta con algunas herramientas pero le faltan unas de importancia por lo cual quiere comprarlas. El tiene como meta realizar trabajos de acabados de buena calidad y ser más competitivo en su trabajo con una mayor eficiencia. Otra de sus metas es generar ganancias para seguir invirtiendo y ayudarle a su familia con el sustento diario.
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Danny F. Q. is 19 years old, single, and he lives with his parents and siblings. He plans on purchasing tools and machines to help him carry out his construction jobs. He has various years working in the field and he has a few tools but he is missing some important ones, which is why he wants to buy them. His goal is to provide good finishes to his projects and to be more competitive in his work by increasing efficiency. Another one of his goals is to generate more income to keep investing and to help his family with the daily expenses.

It is the first loan he has received from Fudecosur (Kiva Field Partner). He has not had other previous loans with state banks, but Fudecosur has provided him with a loan with greater ease and the interest rate is much lower.

loans.use: to purchase construction tools

loans.name: Otilia Tomas

texts.pt:
Otilia Tomas da Conceição T. nasceu em Xinavane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique casada mãe de 3 filhos de 27, 29 e 34 anos de  idade todos ja naõ vaõ a Escola. Fez somente 5ª classe não continuou porque foi ap lar muito cedo (casamento prematuro). Vive na casa propria com a sua família e sustenta seus netos que vivem com ela.

Saiu de Xinavane para o Distrito de Boane com o seu marido. Tem uma propriedade de terra que usa para a produção de Horticulas ha mais de 18 anos e possui empregado que lhe ajuda na preparação da terra onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt a 4.000.00mt em media por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e as vezes consegue poupar uma parte na sua conta bancaria.

 Ja teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colaboradores desta instituição. Este é o seu setimo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar insumos agricolas ( sementes, fertelizantes, adubos e outros) para aumentar as suas areas de produção. 

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros créditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos empréstimos para aumentar as areas agricolas e se tornar a maior produtora de Horticolas.
texts.en:
Otilia Tomas da Conceição T. was born in Xinavane, Maputo Province, in southern Mozambique. She is married and has three children, ages 27, 29 and 34, all of whom are no longer in school. She only completed 5th grade and didn't continue her schooling due to an early marriage. She lives in her own home with her family and supports her grandchildren, who live with her.

She left Xinavane for Boane District with her husband. She has land that she has been using to grow crops for over 18 years. She has one employee who helps her to prepare the land. She has monthly earnings of about 3,000 to 4,000 meticais on average, which she uses for household expenses and is sometimes able to save a portion in her bank account.

She has had loans at other banks, and learned of Hluvuku through partners of the institution. This is her seventh loan with Hluvuku, and is for 20,000 meticais. With the loan, she plans to purchase agricultural inputs (seeds, fertilizers, and other items) to increase the area of production. 

She is committed to paying on schedule in order to obtain future loans. She plans to request new loans to increase the agricultural area and to become the largest producer of crops.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs (seeds, fertilizers, and other items).

loans.name: Carmen Judith

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Intocables” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 20 años de edad, de estado civil soltera sin hijos, estudió educación secundaria. 
La señorita es una socia nueva que recientemente se incorpora al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invertirá en su negocio de venta de comidas y bebidas (restaurante), por lo que comprará insumos como: arroz, azúcar, papa, verduras, sillas y mesas.  En el negocio le ayudan sus hermanos, además contrata ayudantes.
Su sueño es sobresalir en el negocio y terminar su carrera.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the communal bank named "The Untouchables", located in the district of Puno, in the province and department of Puno. She is 20 years old, she is single, and she does not have children. She has a high school education. 

She is a new member who has recently joined the Manuela Ramos movement (Kiva Field Partner). She requires a loan of S/.500 nuevos soles. The funds will be invested in her prepared foods and drinks (restaurant) business. She will purchase ingredients such as: rice, sugar, potatoes, vegetables, and she will also purchase chairs and tables. Her siblings help her with her business and she also hires helpers. 

Her dream is to succeed with her business and to finish studying for a career.

She enjoys the easy loan process in her communal bank.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as rice, sugar, potatoes, vegetables, and chairs and tables.

loans.name: Unified Women Group

texts.es:
El banco D. emprendimiento Mujeres Unidas es un grupo conformado por  D. 11 personas que conocen muy bien por que la mayoría del grupo se dedica a la venta calzados y  realiza sus ventas Cerca a las oficinas,  son muy unidas se ven todos los días; el único varón del grupo se dedica a la venta D. celulares. 	
La presidenta es la Sra. Daisy vive en casa propia por la av. Circunvalación vive junto a sus 2  hijas que ya son independientes, la mencionada señora es muy buena líder y se dedica a la compra y venta D. celulares como su principal actividad y también venD. juguetes, su tienda esta ubicado en una calle muy conocida D. la ciudad D. Cochabamba; con el dinero del credito comprara celulares y accesorios por cantidad,  es una persona muy trabajadora y esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado. Todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que están agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The communal bank named "Unified Women" is a group maD. up of 11 members who all know each other very well. The majority of the group sells shoes and they carry out their sales near business offices. They are very close and they see each other every day. The only man in the group sells cellular phones. 

The president of the group is Daisy. She lives in her own home located on Circunvalacion Avenue, and she lives together with her two grown daughters. She is a very good leader and she buys and sells cellular phones are her primary business. She also sells toys. Her store is located on a very well known street in the city of Cochabamba. With the funds from this loan she will purchase cellular phones and accessories in large quantities. She is a very hardworking woman and she is thankful to the organization for the support given her. All of the members are very responsible and hardworking individuals and they are thankful to the organization for the support provided to them.

loans.use: to purchase cellular phones and accessories in large quantities.

loans.name: Enterprising Women Group

texts.es: La Sra. Barbara  es casada, tiene 3 hijos, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” grupo  conformado por 8  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades D. comercio. Barbara  trabaja desD. hace 8 años en la venta y confección D. pantalones D.  vestir en un taller alquilado junto con una socia, este trabajo surge a raíz D. que su esposo ganaba sueldo minimo y no podían cubrir  sus gastos primordiales y es así que barbara se asocia con una amiga y pusieron su pequeña empresa nos cuenta que nada fue fácil trabajo my duro tocaba puertas y asi vendia sus pantalones hasta que ahorro un dinero y empezó en un taller junto a  su socia,  gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mejores ingresos económicos , sus hijos van a colegios privado,  tiene 4 maquinas propias para su negocio, y sobre todo su familia tiene una mejor calidad D. vida. Barbara nos cuenta que ahora esta ahorrando para comprarse una maquina industrial. El prestamo que se le otorgo fue para comprar mercaderia (telas, hilo, etc). Sabemos que Barbara cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en: Barbara is married and she has 3 children. She is a member of the communal bank named “Enterprising Women". It is a group of 8 members who have various business types. Barbara has been in business for 8 years, selling dress clothes at a rented shop she has with a partner. This business came to be because her husband earned minimum wage and they were not able to cover the basic expenses and so Barbara partnered with a friend and they established a small business. She said that it was not at all easy and she had to work hard, knocking on doors to sell her dress clothing. She finally managed to save some money and she set up a shop with her partner. Thanks to her effort and dedication she has managed to secure a better income. Her children go to a private school, she has 4 sewing machines for her business, but above all, her family has a better quality of life. Barbara says that she is now saving to purchase an industrial sewing machine. The loan that she was granted will be used to purchase merchandise (fabrics, thread, etc.). We know that Barbara will meet her goals with a great deal of work and effort and that the loans granted to her by Edaprospo (Kiva Field Partner) will help her.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and thread.

loans.name: Recardina Carlos

texts.pt:
Recardina Carlos F. nasceu na cidade de Matola, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique casada mãe de 3 filhos de 05, 10 e 18 anos de  idade todos vaõ a Escola. Fez somente 6ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua família e sustenta sua sobrinha que vive com ela.

Nunca saiu da cidade da Matola, tem um negocio proprio de criação e venda de frangos ha mais de 4 anos. Naõ possui empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 12.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e consegue poupar uma parte na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de sua amiga que é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar pintos, vitaminas, vacinas e ração para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros créditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos empréstimos para adquirir o maior numero de pintos possiveis e se tornar a maior criadora de frangos na sua zona.
texts.en:
Recardina Carlos F. was born in the city of Matola, Maputo Province, in southern Mozambique. She is married and the mother of three children, ages 5, 10 and 18. All are attending school. She only completed 6th grade and didn't continue due to her financial circumstances. She lives in her own home with her family and supports her niece who lives with her.

She has never left the city of Matola, and has had her own business raising and selling chickens for over 4 years. She does not have any employees. She has monthly earnings of around 12,000 meticais, which she uses for household expenses, while saving a portion in her bank account. 

She has never had loans at other banks, and learned of Hluvuku through her friend who is a client of the institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku, and it is for 15,000 meticais. She plans to use it to purchase roosters, vitamins, vaccines, and feed to increase her inventory. 

She is committed to paying on schedule to be able to access future loans. She plans to request new loans to obtain the largest possible number of roosters and to become the largest breeder of chickens in her area.

loans.use: to purchase roosters, vitamins, vaccines, and feed.

loans.name: Bouah

texts.en:
Bouah N. is a widow and has five children. To support her family, Bouah has been preparing and selling banku for the past 20 years at Eguafo, near the fishing town Elmina. (Note: Banku is a Ghanaian staple made of fermented maize and cassava dough. It is usually served with a soup, fish or pepper sauce.) 

Bouah needs a loan from Kiva to grow her business. It will be used to purchase more ingredients, especially maize and fish, so that she can increase the volume of food for sale. She plans to reinvest her extra profits back into her business. 

In this picture, N. is showing some of the corn dough she uses to prepare banku.

loans.use: buy ingredients needed to make banku to sell

loans.name: Norys Sonia

texts.es:
Norys es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Intocables” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 28 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 2 hijos.  La señora estudió educación secundaria y en la actualidad esta estudiando cosmetología. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año.  Su primer  préstamo  solicitado que fue por la suma de  S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, lo invirtió en su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de lanas de alpaca y manualidades como esqueletos y cholitas (artesanías).
Norys solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles dinero que utilizará para comprar cincuenta libras de lana.  En su negocio trabaja sola, su esposo es maestro de obra.
Su sueño es tener un trabajo seguro y abrir un local para dar el servicio de cosmetóloga.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo por parte de Manuela y el préstamo de la cuenta interna.
texts.en:
Norys is a member of the communal bank named "The Untouchables", located in the district of Puno, in the province and Department of Puno. She is 28 years old, married, and she has 2 children. She has a high school education and she is now studying cosmetology.

She has been with the Manuela Ramos movement (Kiva Field Partner) for the past year. The first loan she requested was in the amount of S/.500 and she invested the funds in her business. She sells alpaca wool and crafts such as skeletons and dolls (crafts). 

Norys requests a new loan in the amount of S/.500 nuevos soles. The funds will be used in the purchase of 50 pounds of wool. She works alone in her business. Her husband is a construction worker. Her dream is to have steady work and to open a business providing cosmetology services.

She enjoys her communal bank for the easy loan process on the part of Manuela Ramos and the personal loans.

loans.use: to purchase fifty pounds of wool.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI de BALIMAYA - TON - MASSABLACOURA est composé de femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 2 enfants et vivant dans de familles conjugales nucléaires avec leurs enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans la ville de BOUGOUNI qui relève de la 3eme région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles se sont connues par des relations de commerce. Dans l’intention de développer leur commerce en faisant assez de stock enfin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso pour la première fois  et cela pour faire le commerce de céréales, de savons, de la pâte d’arachide et divers condiments alimentaires.
Avec ce prêt Batoma T. compte acheter 15 boites de 2kg de concentrée de tomate, 5 sacs de 25kg de sel, 10 paquets de 100 morceaux de cube maggi et diverses autres qualités de condiments. Les produits sont payés auprès des grossistes de Bamako pour les revendre ensuite en détail et au comptant au marché de BOUGOUNI à une clientèle composée d’hommes et  de femmes.
Avec ce prêt ces femmes  espèrent obtenir chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 10 000 FCFA par mois qui dont une partie sera réinvesti dans l’activité et l’autre partie sera utilisé dans les frais de santé familiale.
texts.en:
The BENKADI group of BALIMAYA - TON - MASSABLACOURA is composed of married women who average 36 years of age and two children each, and who live in nuclear conjugal families with their children and spouses. They live in the city of BOUGOUNI (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through their commercial activities. 

They sell cereals, soap, groundnut paste, and various food condiments. Hoping to expand their businesses by boosting their stock to better meet customer demand, they decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. This is their first loan cycle.   

Batoma T. will use this loan to buy fifteen 2 kg boxes of condensed tomato, five 25kg bags of salt, ten 100-unit packets of Maggi cubes, and various other grades of condiments. She buys her stock from Bamako wholesalers for resale at retail and for cash at the BOUGOUNI market to a clientele composed of both men and women.

With this loan, the group members expect to earn a monthly profit of 10,000 FCFA each, to be reinvested in the business and to help pay for family health care.

loans.use: to buy condiments for resale

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
El señor Ramiro M. Fernández tiene 33 años de edad es concubino con la señora Yolanda López Villarroel más de10 años agricultores, tienen 2 hijos de 11 y de 7 años de edad dependientes que estudian en nivel primaria, la familia vive en la comunidad de Alto Colomi km 52 carretera Cbba-Santa Cruz hacia el norte.
                                                                                                                                                                                    
El señor Ramiro nos cuenta que los años anteriores sufrió un accidente que tuvo unos gastos bien fuertes económicamente para su familia, motivo por lo cual ellos se apersonaron a solicitar un credito, para comprar abono orgánico (gallinaza) y semilla de papa ya que en otros lugares le pidieron muchos requisitos.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
El señor Ramiro y su esposa desean que a futuro con este crédito puedan agrandar la producción agrícola y mejorar su calidad de vida y vivir más cómodos y felices.
texts.en:
Mr. Ramiro M. F. is 33 years old and he lives with is partner Yolanda Lopez Villarroel. They have more than 10 years' experience as agriculturists and they have 2 children, 11 and 7 years old. They are dependent and they are in primary school. This family lives in the community of Alto Colomi, at Kilometer 52 of the North Cbba-Santa Cruz high way.

Ramiro tells us that he suffered an accident a few years ago and he had a few very large expenses for his family. This is the reason why they have requested a loan. He plans on purchasing organic fertilizer (chicken manure) and potato seeds. Other organizations required many requisites.

Ramiro and his wife want to improve their agricultural yield and to improve the quality of their life, living more comfortably and happy.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer for his agriculture business.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es: Emilio tiene 64 años de edad, es natural del distrito de Quimbiri, está casado con Maura de 51 años de edad y fruto de su relación tienen 06 hijos donde viven juntos en su propia casa ubicada en la comunidad de Villa Quintiarina anexo del distrito de Quimbiri. La labor que realiza Emilio es labrar la tierra, él posee 20 hectáreas de terreno, en donde cultiva plantas de cacao, café y maní, es conocedor del arduo trabajo que se realiza por ello tiene 38 años de experiencia y hasta el momento continúa en esta actividad. Para él es importante ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos económico. Sin embargo esta actividad se ha convertido en una actividad familiar, ya que sus hijos lo apoyan cuando tiene que cosechar, además que cuenta con jornaleros que contrata para este proceso y luego trasladar los productos recolectados hasta cierto tramo para ser transportados con carros a los puntos de venta. Se siente muy comprometido con su trabajo; porque gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que sus plantas están en buen estado, asimismo menciona que durante el invierno, se intensifica más su labor ya que debe cuidar sus plantaciones de la plaga de insectos que atacan sus productos. Este es su 12avo crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro aporte con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal donde es un socio muy admirado por el resto de los integrantes. Con el crédito solicitado comprará semillas de maní y ajonjolíes para ampliar sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Emilio is 64 years old and a native of the Quimbiri district.  He’s married to 51 year old Maura, they have six children, and live in their own home in the Villa Quintiarina community of the Quimbiri district.  Emilio works on 20 hectares of land that he has, where he raises cacao, coffee, and peanuts. He is no stranger to hard work, has been doing it for 38 years, and continues to do so.  It’s important to him because it’s his primary means of income.  He’s managed to turn this activity into a family affair and his children help him at harvest time.  He also employs field hands to help with this labor and to move the harvested products to locations where they can be transported to points of sale by car.

He feels very committed to his work because; thanks to his efforts he now enjoys having his plants in good shape.  He says that during the winter his work gets harder because he then needs to protect his plants from blights and insects.

This will be his 12th loan through MFP and he knows that if he repays it on schedule he will be able to qualify for additional loans in the future, with peace of mind, and without creating problems for the rest of the members.  He will use the money from this loan to buy peanut seed and sesame seed to expand his crops.

loans.use: To buy seed

loans.name: Nasia Custodia

texts.pt:
Nasia Custodia L. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província de mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique casada mãe de 2 filhos de 07 e 11 anos idade todos vaõ a Escola. Fez somente 8ª classe não continuou porque teve que cuidar dos filhos que teve antes de terminar com os estudos. Vive na casa propria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Nunca saiu da cidade de Maputo, tem um negocio proprio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade  ha mais de 8 anos e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 2.000.00mt a 3.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e com ajuda do seu marido as vezes consegue poupar uma parte na sua conta bancaria.

Ja teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de sua amiga que é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (portas, pedra, cimento, areia, pedra e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa. 

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros créditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos empréstimos para concluir a casa.
texts.en:
Nasia Custodia L. was born in the city of Maputo, Maputo Province, in southern Mozambique. She is married and the mother of two children, ages 7 and 11. Both are attending school. She only completed 8th grade and didn't continue with her education because she had to care for the two children who were born before she finished her studies.
