She lives in her own home with her family and doesn't support anyone additional.

She has never left the city of Maputo, where she has had her own business selling basic goods for over 8 years. She has monthly earnings of around 2000 to 3000 meticais, which she uses for household expenses. With the help of her husband, she sometimes manages to save a portion in her bank account.

She has had loans at other banks in the past, and learned of Hluvuku through her friend who is a Hluvuku client. This is her first loan with Hluvuku, and it is for 15,000 meticais. With the loan, she plans to purchase construction materials (doors, stone, cement, sand, and other items) to continue building her house.

She is committed to paying on schedule to be able to obtain future loans. She plans to request new loans to complete the house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (doors, stone, cement, sand, stone, and other items).

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe DANAYA sont tous des femmes mariées et ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales nucléaires avec leurs enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident au quartier Massablacoura de la ville de BOUGOUNI troisième région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles se sont connues par des relations de mariage. Avec le souci d’acheter assez de balles de friperie afin d’augmenter leur stock, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela pour faire le commerce d’articles divers et d’habillements avec Mariam S.. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de groupe et les trois précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt ces Mariam S. compte acheter 2 douzaines de maillots pour petits garçons, 20 complets de robe  et beaucoup d’autres habillements pour les nouveau nés, sur le marché de Bamako pour ensuite les revendre en détail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes dans le marché de BOUGOUNI. 
Avec ce prêt les femmes comptent chacune obtenir un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour surmonter les frais d’éducation des enfants.
texts.en:
The members of the DANAYA group are all married women who average 30 years of age and five children each. They live in nuclear families with their children and spouses. These reside in the district of Massablacoura, in BOUGOUNI (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of marriage. 

These sellers of clothes and various merchandise decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to stock up on bales of used clothing. They are on their fourth group loan. The three previous loans were correctly repaid.

Mariam S. plans to use her loan to buy two dozen shirts for small boys, twenty dress suits, and lots of clothing for newborns. She gets her merchandise at the Bamako market for resale at retail at the Bougouni market, for cash or credit, to a clientele composed of both men and women.

With this loan, the group members expect to earn a monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA each, which they will use to pay for the children’s tuition fees.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Intocables” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 52 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene dos  hijos.  La señora estudió educación secundaria (incompleto). 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año, su primer  préstamo  fue por S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de miniaturas de alasitas (artesanías).
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevos soles, comprará diez cajas de casitas de vidrio y carritos (todo en miniaturas).  Ella trabaja junto con su esposo.
Su sueño es crecer en el negocio y tener una tienda de abarrotes  o zapatería.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Francisca is a member of the “Las Intocables” communal bank, located in the Puno district in the province with the same name.  She is 52 years old, in a live in relationship, and has two children.  She has a junior high school education (not completed).

She works with the Manuela Ramos movement and has for one year.  Her first loan was for 5,000 PEN, which she invested into her business.  She sells miniatures (crafts).

She will use the 1,000 PEN from this new loan to buy ten boxes of glass and little cars (all miniatures).  She works with her husband.

Her dream is to grow her business and open a small grocery store or shoe store.  What she likes about the communal bank is the ability to get loans.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Deolinda Almeida

texts.pt:
Deolinda Almeida M. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique casada mãe de 1 filho de idade escolar. Fez 12ª classe não continuou porque teve que começar a trabalhar para aliviar algumas despesas familiares. Vive na casa cedida pelos tios com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Nunca saiu de Boane sua terra natal, é funcionaria do Ministerio de Educação trabalha como docente ha mais de 8 anos. Tem um salario mensal de 7.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e consegue poupar uma parte na sua conta bancaria.

Ja teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de sua amiga que é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.500.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, pedra e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa. Os emprestimos anteriores foram de 5.000.00mt e 12.000.00mt aplicados na habitação.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros créditos no futuro. O seu Sonho é de solicitar novos empréstimos para concluir a casa e continuar com os seus estudos.
texts.en:
Deolinda Almeida M. was born in Boane District, Maputo Province, in southern Mozambique. She is married and the mother of one school-age child. She completed 12th grade and didn't continue with her schooling because she needed to start working to contribute to family expenses. She lives with her family in a house given to her by her uncles and doesn't support anyone additional.

She has never left Boane, her native region, and is an employee of the Ministry of Education. She has worked as a teacher for over eight years. Her monthly salary is 7000 meticais, which she uses for household expenses and is able to save a portion of in her bank account.

She has had loans at other banks, and learned of Hluvuku through her friend who is a client there. This is her third loan at Hluvuku. The loan is for 15,500 meticais, with which she plans to buy construction materials (cement, sand, stone, and other items) to continue building her house. The previous loans were for 5,000 and 12,000 meticais, both for the house. 

She is committed to paying on schedule to be able to obtain future loans. Her dream is to request loans to complete the house and continue with her studies.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cement, sand, stone, and other items).

loans.name: Kelegna Group

texts.fr:
Composé de veuves et de femmes mariées les membres du groupe KELEGNA ont une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et de 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales nucléaires avec leurs enfants et avec ou sans époux. Ces femmes résident dans la ville de BOUGOUNI (3ème  région administratif de la république du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues par des relations de commerce. Dans l’intention d’augmenter leur ressource financière et de faire assez de stock enfin de satisfaire le besoin de la clientèle elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela pour faire le commerce de céréales, de fruits et légumes, d’habits et avec Ramatou T. pour faire le commerce de bois e chauffe et du charbon de bois. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt et tous les trois prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Avec ce prêt Ramatou T. comptent acheter 20 chargements de charrette en bois de chauffe et 15 sacs de 100kg de charbon de bois. Les produits seront achetés auprès des fournisseurs des villages environnants de BOUGOUNI pour ensuite être revendus au comptant et en détail à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes dans la ville de BOUGOUNI. 
Avec ce prêt les femmes espèrent obtenir chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 15 000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé dans les frais de santé et d’éducation de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Composed of widows and married women, the members of the group KELEGNA average 34 years of age and four children each. The women live in conjugal nuclear families with their children and with or without a husband. And they reside in the city of BOUGOUNI (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through business relationships. 

With the intention of increasing their financial resources, and to build up enough inventory, they decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. Their purpose is to do commerce in grains, fruit and vegetables, and clothing. In the case of Ms. Ramatou T., it is to do commerce in firewood and charcoal. The group members are on their fourth loan. All three previous loans have been correctly repaid.

With this loan, Ramatou intends to buy twenty cart loads of firewood and fifteen 100-kg sacks of charcoal. The goods will be purchased from suppliers from the villages surrounding BOUGOUNI and then will be sold retail and for cash to a customer base composed of women and men in the city of BOUGOUNI. 

Through this loan, the women each hope to obtain a monthly profit of 15,000 francs CFA that will be used for health care costs and for educating their children.

loans.use: to buy various goods

loans.name: Guimer

texts.es:
El Señor Guimer V. A. tiene 23 años vive en concubinato y es padre de una hija; él desde muy temprana edad empezó a trabajar como albañil, actualmente el trabaja como moto taxista  en el sindicato “CARRASCO”  el trabaja hace mas de 2 años como socio activo, el servicio que brinda es rentable por la alta cantidad de personas que solicitan este servicio por la facilidad,  rapidez y eficiencia. El sindicato cuenta con paradas y turnos para cada afiliado, en diferentes puntos de la localidad de Ivirgarzama donde las personas acuden para solicitar dicho servicio, su esposa cuenta con una pequeña tienda de barrio, para así poder ayudar con los gastos familiares que no abastece con la actividad laboral de su pareja, para en un futuro poder brindarle lo mejor a su hija. 
 	Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de mercadería para abastecer y surtir más su venta y de esta forma poder brindar una mejor calidad en sus productos a sus clientes lo que le permitirá también mejorar sus ingresos, consecuente mente mejorar su calidad de vida.
 	Cabe señalar que el señor Guimer V. A. se apersono a solicitar su préstamo luego de que sus compañeros de su sindicato le comentaron de las buenas condiciones crediticias con las que trabaja nuestra institución
texts.en:
Guimer V. A. is 23 years old, is in a live-in relationship, and has one daughter.  From a very young age he began working as a mason.  Now he drives a moto-taxi as part of the CARRASCO union and has been an active member for two years.  This service is profitable because many people use it.  It’s fast and efficient.

The union has shifts and stops in different parts of town for each member.  They are located in places where people gather for said service.  His wife runs a small neighborhood store so that she can help with the family expenses that [Guimer’s] current salary will not cover.  They want to give a better life to their daughter in the future.

This will be his first loan through our institution, which he will use to buy merchandise to stock the store and have a better assortment and be able to provide a better quality of products to his customers.  This will allow him to increase his income and quality of life.

Guimer came to request a loan after his fellow members from the union told him about the way our institution works.

loans.use: to stock his store

loans.name: Pima Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées, les femmes du groupe PIMA ont une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent dans de familles conjugales traditionnelles avec les frères, sœurs, co-épouses, enfants et époux et résident dans la ville de BOUGOUNI, au quartier MASSABLACOURA dans la 3ème région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues par des relations de mariages et de commerce. Dans l’intention d’augmenter leurs ressources financières afin de satisfaire la clientèle, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe et les précédents ont été correctement soldés. Ce groupe de femmes fait de la petite restauration avec les fritures de patate douce, de farine de blé, de banane plantain et l’achat vente de céréales. Avec ce prêt Fatoumata M. compte acheter, 6 tonnes de maïs, 500 kg de fonio et 3 tonnes de petit mil. Les produits sont achetés auprès des fournisseurs des villages environnants de BOUGOUNI pour les revendre ensuite au comptant et en gros sur le marché de Bamako à une clientèle  composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Avec ce prêt les femmes envisagent obtenir chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 20 000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé selon elles dans leurs activités.
texts.en:
All married, the woman of the PIMA group have an average age of 38, and 5 children. They live in traditional married families with brothers, sisters, co-wives, children, and husbands, and they live in the city of Bougouni, in the Massablacoura district in the 3rd administrative region in the Republic of Mali. 
They know each other through familial and business ties. In order to increase their financial resources to satisfy customer demand, they have decided to turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their fifth group loan and their previous loans were all repaid in full. This group of women sells fried sweet potatoes, wheat flour, plantains, and buys and sells grain. 
With this loan, Fatoumata M. plans on buying 6 tons of corn, 500 kg of fonio, and 3 tons of millet. These products will be bought from suppliers in neighboring villages and then sold for cash and wholesale at the Bamako market to a client base made up of both men and women. With this loan, the women hope to each earn a monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA which will be reinvested in their business.

loans.use: to buy grain.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.pt:
Angelina T. nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique Viuva mãe de 4 filhos de idades entre 13 a 25 anos de idade, os 2 mais novos vaõ a Escola. Fez somente 9ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condicoes financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém para alem de seus filhos.

Saiu de Namaacha para o Distrito de Boane quando se juntou ao seu marido. Tem um negocio proprio de venda de roupa usada diversa numa das bancas do mercado ha mais de 10 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um rendimento mensal de cerca 6.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e consegue poupar uma parte na sua conta bancaria.

Ja teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de sua amiga do mercado onde tem banca que é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar fardos de roupa usada para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros créditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos empréstimos para construir casas para arendar, como forma de aumentar a renda familiar.
texts.en:
Angelina T. was born in Namaacha District, Maputo Province, in southern Mozambique. She is a widow and mother of 4 children, ages 13 to 25. The two younger children go to school. She only completed 9th grade and did not continue due to her financial circumstances. She lives in her own home with her family and doesn't support anyone besides her children.

She left Namaacha for Boane District when she got together with her husband. For over 10 years, she has had her own business selling used clothes at a stall at the market. She doesn't have any employees and her monthly earnings are around 6000 meticais. She uses these for household expenses and is able to save a portion in her bank account. 

She had had loans from other banks in the past, and learned of Hluvuku through a friend at the market where she has her stall. This is her third loan with Hluvuku, and it is for 15,000 meticais. She plans to use it to buy used clothes in bulk to increase her inventory.

She is committed to paying on schedule to be able to obtain future loans. She plans to request loans to build houses to rent, as a way of increasing her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: La Sra. Isabel es viuda hace bastante tiempo, salió adelante sola, vive en la zona central con sus hijos ellos ya son independientes ya tiene sus familias, la Sra. Isabel se dedica a la venta D. pollos broster,  ella atienD.  D. 12:00 a 6:00 D. la tarD. realiza el preparado D. pollos broster y silpancho todos los días tiene varios años ya viviendo en la zona, el préstamo lo invertirá para compra D. material D. construcción para  la construcción D. un cuarto en su casa ya que le falta terminar, es una persona fuerte y luchadora orgullosa D. haber sacado adelante a sus hijos, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Isabel has been a widow for a long time and got ahead on her own.  She lives in the central zone with her children, who are now independent and have their own families.  Isabel sells roasted chickens, tending shop from 12 to 6 in the evening, and prepares roasted chickens and silpancho [fried ground chicken or beef with bread crumbs and spices] every day.  

Isabel has lived in this zone for many years.  She will use this loan to purchase construction materials to build a room in her home that she has not yet finished.  She is a strong person, and a fighter who is happy to have helped her children get ahead.  She is grateful with the institute for their support.

loans.use: buy construction materials for the construction of a room.

loans.name: Gumercindo

texts.es:
El cliente vive en el municipio de Entre Ríos del trópico de Cochabamba, empezó a trabajar a muy temprana edad junto a su padre, como peón en la tierra de su padre en el departamento de sucre. 
Gumersindo se independizo a muy temprana edad, ya que su padre ya no podía mantenerlo, porque eran varios hermanos y tuvo que emigrar al trópico de Cochabamba, cuando llego trabajo como peón y posteriormente fue ahorrando y se dedicó al comercio de ropa, y actualmente vende en las diferentes ferias del trópico.
El crédito que solicita es para ampliar su negocio de venta de ropa, más específicamente para comprar más ropa, Gumersindo necesita un impulso, para poder ampliar y mejorar  su negocio, que ha sido su sueño de toda su vida, también tiene un deseo de comprar una casa,  Ahora con el crédito seguirá creciendo y podrá comprar algún día su vivienda propia.
texts.en:
This client lives in Entre Ríos in the Tropics of Cochabamba.  He began working as a field hand on his father’s land in the Sucre department when he was very young.  Gumersindo went out on his own when he was young because his father was no longer able to support him.  He had many brothers, so he had to immigrate to the Tropics of Cochabamba.  When he first arrived, he worked as a field hand.  He saved his money and later began selling clothing.  Now he sells in various fairs around the area.

He is asking for this loan so that he can expand his clothing business, specifically to buy more clothing.  He needs some backing so that he can expand and improve his business, which he has dreamed of all his life.  He also wants to buy a house.  This loan will allow him to continue growing and someday be able to buy his own house.

loans.use: to expand his clothing business

loans.name: Betsayda

texts.es:
Betsayda es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Intocables” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 23 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene un  hijo.  Estudió educación superior. 
Hace dos años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo solicitado fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de artesanía de alasitas.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, comprará cinco docenas  de maletitas, diez paquetes de dólares y fardos de euros en miniaturas.  La señora nos cuenta que viaja a diferentes lugares y trabaja junto con su mamá, su esposo trabaja en el magisterio.
Su sueño es tener más capital y tener carros para darlos en alquiler.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es ahorrar.
texts.en:
Betsayda is a member of the “Las Intocables” comunal bank, located in the Puno district and department.  She is 23 years old, married, and has one son.  [Betsayda] has a higher education.

She’s been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for two years and used her first loan for 500 PEN to invest into her arts and crafts business.  She will use this loan for 1,000 PEN to buy five dozen small cases, ten packets of miniature dollar bills, and bundles of miniature euros.  She tells us that she goes to different places and works with her mother.  Her husband works for the magistrate.

She hopes to have more capital and cars to rent out.  What she enjoys most about the communal bank is being able to save.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Solidario Los Cipresales Group

texts.es: Solidario los Cipresales: Este grupo esta conformado por tre señoras las cuales se dedican a la elavoracion de guipiles y a la venta de los mismos,ellas nos cuenta que llevan ya barios años de dedicarse a esta actividad y estan contentas ya que pues han tenido demanda de sus clientes y sus ganancias han mejorado pero ahora ellas solicitaneste credito para la compra de materia prima porque con lo que tienen no les alcanza para seguir elavorando mas guipiles,el sueño de ellas es darles a sus hijos lo mejor para que en un futuro tengan mas oportunidades de desarollo y sean unos profecionales.
texts.en:
Solidario los Cipresales is a group of three women that dedicate themselves to the production and sale of guipiles [Mayan blouses].  They tell us that they have done this for many years and are happy that they are in demand to their customers, and that their earnings have improved.

But now they ask for this loan to purchase primary materials because what they have is not enough to make more guipiles.  Their dream is to give their children the best so that in the future, they can have more development opportunities and become professionals.

loans.use: purchase primary materials.

loans.name: Nueva Vida Group

texts.en:
Doña Maria Petrona is the President of the Nueva Vida Group, which in English translates to the ¨New Life Group¨. Maria is 58 years old, married, and has 7 children. Her husband works in agriculture and helps support the family. 

Maria would like to use her portion of the group´s loan to purchase more pigs and hens for her animal raising business. She has 12 years experience raising animals and enjoys the work very much. She purchased her first pens and animals with family savings and started her business with a desire to work for herself. She hopes to continue to grow her business and run a much larger farm someday in the future.

Other group members of the Nueva Vida Group are involved in making sweaters and pants, clothing sales, general store management, and animal raising and sales.

loans.use: purchase more pigs and hens for her farm

loans.name: Superacion Group

texts.en:
Doña Rosa is the group leader for the Superaciòn Group (Translation: ¨The Overcoming Group¨). She is 25 years old, is single, and has one child. Rosa was a student through primary school before she started to work full-time. She currently works making sweaters and other clothing items. (It can get cold up here in the highlands!) 

Doña Rosa would like to use her portion of the group´s loan to purchase more materials in order to weave more sweaters for sale in her community. Rosa has 8 years of experience with her business and would love to one day make and sell a wiD. variety of garments and always have plenty of materials on-hand to meet demand. She started her business with some help from her brother and the support of her group members. 

The other members of the Superaciòn Group work in clothing making, native garment sales, animal raising and selling, and pottery making and selling. This is the second loan through ASDIR for this group of women. The previous loan was paid back ahead of schedule with no problem.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make sweaters

loans.name: Los Pioneros Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LOS PIONEROS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Justina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio de comida, venta de ropa, venta de verduras.

La señora Justina,  indica que hace once ciclos que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida, el que hace 8 años y que lo aprendió de un familiar.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para invertir en su negocio de comida, este material lo comprará de los mercados y lo comercializará en el centro (ciudad de La paz)todos los días con la ayuda de una empleada. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene una hija.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.
texts.en:
The “LOS PIONEROS” community association is beginning its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Exaltación Center.  It’s made up of eight members and run by a board of directors lead by Justina.  The members are involved in a number of businesses, including food sales, clothing sales, and vegetable sales.

Justina started working with Pro Mujer 11 cycles ago, after having been invited in by a friend.  She has a food business which she learned from her family.  She has had it for eight years.

She will use this loan to invest into her food business.  She will buy supplies from the markets and will sell in the La Paz city center, with the help of one employee, during the day.  Working in this way allows her to earn an income to support her family however possible.  She is married and has a daughter.

She tells us that she likes the training she gets from Pro Mujer.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition for his children

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia tiene 50 años, natural del distrito de Kimbiri; está casada con Pedro de 57 años y juntos viven en su propia casa con sus 05 hijos, en la comunidad de Villa Quintiarina caserío del distrito de Kimbiri. Eugenia y su pareja son el pilar de su familia, desde muy niña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar en la chacra, posee su propia parcela de 15 hectáreas en donde cultiva cacao, plátano y maní. Han transcurrido 23 años trabajando en esta actividad y considera que le gusta recolectar los frutos; pues de esa manera recibe la recompensa gracias al esfuerzo que dio a sus plantas, sin embargo lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio de la ciudad de san francisco, lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por su cosecha. 
Durante la temporada de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos, además de los jornaleros que contrata, para así poder recolectar en menor tiempo sus productos. Por otro lado, Eugenia menciona que hay momentos que no tiene suficiente capital para invertir en su trabajo y pagar a los jornaleros por adelantado para que le ayuden en esta actividad que demanda mucho esfuerzo, es por ello que acude a los préstamos que facilita la institución MFP. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es sembrar más plantaciones de cacao porque cuenta con espacio suficiente en su parcela. Este es su 12avo crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es una socia responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, contratará jornaleros para que le brinden el apoyo en la recolección de frutos.
texts.en:
Eugenia is 50 years old and a native of Kimbiri.  She is married to 57 year old Pedro and they live together in their own home in the Villa Quintiarina settlement of the Kimbiri district, along with their five children.

Eugenia and her husband are the pillars of their family.  Her parents taught her how to work the land when she was a little girl and now she has 15 hectares of her own, where she raises cacao, banana, and peanuts.  She’s been doing this for 23 years and enjoys collecting the fruits of her labor.  In this way she receives the reward, thanks to the effort she puts into her crops.  Never the less, the most difficult part is transporting her products to their point of sale in the city of San Francisco, where she can sell her harvest for better prices.

During the harvest season, she’s able to get some help from her children, and also hires field hands, in order to be able to collect the crops quicker.  She also tells us that there are times when she doesn’t have enough capital to invest into her work and pay the field hands in advance, so that they will help with this hard work.  This is why she has seen fit to request this loan though MFP.

At this time her biggest priority is to plant her cacao crops, because she has enough space in her fields.  This will be her 12th loan through MFP and she has always been on time with her payments.  She expects to be on time this time as well.  The will use the 2,000 PEN from this loan to hire field hands to help her collect her fruits.

loans.use: to hire field hands

loans.name: Adjoa Authur

texts.en:
Adjoa Authur K. makes a living selling banku, a Ghanaian staple made of fermented maize and cassava, at Eguafo Village near Elmina.  She is married and has one child. Adjoa Atta’s income helps pay the household utility bills and school fees. 

Adjoa Atta needs a loan from Kiva to increase the volume of food she sells. She plans to purchase more maize with this loan. Ultimately, Adjoa Atta wants to earn enough to purchase a piece of land to build a home some day.
 
At the time of visit, she had finished selling and so was showing the pot she uses to prepare the banku.

loans.use: to buy more maize to make banku

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Maria J. es la propietaria de un restaurante ubicado en el barrio Los Andes de la Ciudad de Barranquilla, con este negocio operado con mucha disciplina y mucho trabajo ha logrado sacar adelante a sus dos hijos  en las edades de 21 y 26 años; ella comenzó desde hace 20 años vendiendo con su madre,  pasteles y sancochos  que le encargaban los fines de semanas, debido a su gran acogida, decidieron convertirlo en un restaurante trabajando todos los días  como hasta el momento lo hace. Su clientela es clasificada y fiel aunque en su mayoría realizan ventas de contado también otorgan créditos a sus clientes más rentables.  Este es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará materias primas e insumos al por mayor para preparar sus comidas y lograr  disminuir los costos y también realizará mejoras locativas para lograr un ambiente confortable para sus clientes. Su meta es mejorar su infraestructura y hacer crecer su negocio día a día, por eso cada día se prepara con una oferta de menús que deleitan el paladar de quienes lo consumen y con todo esto impactará integralmente a su clientela real y potencial.
texts.en:
Maria J. owns a restaurant located in the Los Angeles neighborhood of Barranquilla.  This business, run with great discipline, has allowed her to get her two children, ages 21 and 26, ahead.  She began selling cakes and soup with her mother on the weekends 20 years ago.  Because of their success, they decided to open a restaurant, working every day, as they do now.  Her customers are loyal and even though most of their sales are in cash, they extend credit to some of their most profitable customers.

This will be her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy supplies and ingredients in quantity, so that she can reduce her costs and also provide a better atmosphere for her customers.  Her goal is to improve the infrastructure and grow her business each day.  Each day she prepares a menu that tempts the pallet of those who eat.  This will impact all of her current and future customers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada Arroyo de pita la cual se caracteriza por ser la unica comunidad en varios kilometros  que cuanta con un bachillerato, en esta comunidad vive la señora Haydee C. que tiene 29 años, estudio solo la secundaria y esta casada con el señor jesus con el cual tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos asisten a la escuela en su comunidad.
Doña Haydee nos platica que hace mas de un año inicio a trabajar en la venta de ropa interior para dama y perfumeria por catalogo con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad, ella decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio ya que deseaba ayudar a su esposo con los gastas del hogar y los estudios de sus pequeños hijos.
Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de catalogos, ropa y perfumeria para su posterior venta.
Ella nos platica que desea que cada dia su negocio prospera ya que desea darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y que en un futuro tengan una profecion.
Ella se encuentra muy agradecida con la fundacion por el credito que le ha otorgado ya que con esta prestamo tendra la oportunidad para que su negocio cresca.
texts.en:
The community of Arroyo de Pita is located in the state of Oaxaca, and is characterized as being the only one with a high school within various kilometers.  Haydee C., age 29, lives in this community, but only studied to junior high school.  She is married to her husband named Jesus and they have three children who attend the local school.

Haydee tells us that she began selling ladies underclothing and perfumes through a catalog to her friends and neighbors more than a year ago.  She decided to start her own business so that she could help her husband pay the household expenses and support their children.
  
She needs this loan in order to buy catalogs, clothing, and perfumes for resale.  She tells us that her business prospers daily and she wants to give her children a better quality of life and wants them to have professional careers in the future.

She is very grateful to the foundation for the loan.  This will allow her to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for resale

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada Arroyo de pita la cual se caracteriza por ser la unica comunidad en varios kilometros  que cuanta con un bachillerato, en esta comunidad vive la señora Estela N. tiene la edad de 33 años, estudio hasta el cuarto grado de primaria y se encuentra casada con el señor santos el cual trabaja de policia, ella tiene dos hijos los cuales asisten a la escuela en su comunidad.		

ella nos platica que hace mas de dos años decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio ya que el sueldo de su esposo no alcanza para cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia.

Doña estela nos platica que ella vende empanadas de pollo, carne molida y queso de lunes a viernes en la preparatoria de su comunidad en la hora del recreo. Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de maiz, carne, sal, aceite, tomates, chiles, cebolla, col y queso para la elaboracion de sus empanadas.

ella nos comenta que las ventas son buenas y que espera que con este credito su negocio prospere ya que desa darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y que en un futuro estudien una carrera.

ella se encuentra muy agradecida con la fundacion por el prestamo que le ha otorgado ya que le ayudara no solo a que su negocio creesca sino a creser como persona.
texts.en:
In the state of Oaxaca there is a community called Arroyo de Pita which is known for being the only community for many kilometers with a high school. This community is where Ms. Estela N. lives. She is 33 years old, studied through the fourth grade of primary school, and is married to Mr. Santos, who works for the police. She has two children who attend the school in her community.

She tells Fundacion Realidad A.C (FRAC) that over two years ago, she decided to start her own business because her husband's salary was not enough to cover all of their family's necessities.

Ms. Estela tells FRAC that from Monday through Friday, she sells chicken, ground meat, and cheese empanadas outside the school in her community during the recess hour. She needs this loan to invest in the purchase of corn, meat, salt, oil, tomatoes, chilies, onion, cabbage, and cheese for making her empanadas.

She also tells FRAC that her sales are good and that she hopes this loan will help her business to prosper. She hopes to provide her children with a better quality of life so that they can have careers in the future.

Estela is very grateful to the foundation for the loan she has been offered because it will not only help her business to grow but it will also help her to grow as a person.

loans.use: to buy corn, meat, salt, oil, tomatoes, chilies, onion, cabbage, and cheese

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
For five years now, Ama N. has been selling charcoal and pepper in the village of Efuago, which is near the fishing town of Elmina. She is married to a farmer.  

Ama is keen to grow her charcoal business and needs a loan from Kiva to buy more bags of charcoal for resale. She plans to save the extra income to purchase a piece of land some day.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to resell

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada Arroyo de pita la cual se caracteriza por ser la unica comunidad en varios kilometros  que cuanta con un bachillerato, en esta comunidad vive la señora Aurelia R. P. que tiene 57 años de edad, estudio hasta el segundo año de primaria y esta casada con el señor silvstre el cual trabaja de jornalero, Doña Aurelia tiene dos hijos pero actualmento solo estudia la mas chica, tiene 16 años asiste al bachillerato.

Doña Aurelia nos platica que hace mas de 12 años tiene un pequeño molino de maiz con el cual muele el maiz a sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad,ella se levanta todos los dias a las cinco de la mañana para iniciar su trabajo, ademas de trabajar en su molino ella vende maiz y masa por kilos.

ella nos platica que decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio porque deseaba ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y con el pasar de los años las necesidades del hogar fueron mas grandes "y no hay de otra mas que trabajar  para ganarse la papa(comida)".

ella nesesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de maiz y darle mantenimiento a su molino.

Doña Aurelia nos dice que desea comprar un molino nueo y mas grande asi que piensa ahorrar un poco de sus ganancias para poder lograr  su objetivo.
texts.en:
In the State of Oaxaca there is a community called "Arroyo de Pita", characterized for being the only community in the area that has a high-school, in this community lives Aurelia R. P., who is 57 years old, went to 2nd grade and is married to Silvestre, a farm worker, Aurelia has two children but currently only the 16th year old goes to high-school. 

Aurelia says that she's had a corn mill for 12 years that she uses to grind corn for her friends and neighbors, she gets up at 5 a.m. every morning to begin her work, in addition of working at her mill she sells corn and mix by the kilogram.

She tells us that she decided to work on her own business because she wanted to help her husband with the family expenses and as time went by the home needs were larger "and there is no other choice but to work to have a bite to eat".  

She needs this loan to invest it in the purchase of corn and give maintenance to her mill.

Aurelia wishes to buy a newer and bigger mill so she will save some of her profits to reach this goal.

loans.use: to buy corn and pieces to repair her corn mill

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada Arroyo de pita la cual se caracteriza por ser la unica comunidad en varios kilometros  que cuanta con un bachillerato, en esta comunidad vive la señora Yolanda C. que tiene la edad de 56 años, estudio hasta el cuarto grado de primaria y es madre soltera de dos hijos pero actualmente solo vive con el mas pequeño que asiste a la preparatoria de la comunidad.	

Doña yolanda nos platica que hace mas de 27 años tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes a la cual llamo "Abarrotes Yoli", ella decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio ya que tenia dos hijos y tenia que sacarlos a delante sola.		

ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de arroz, frijol, aceite, sopa, jabon, pasta dental, refrescos, dulces, cafe, galletas, jugos, veladoras, crema, queso, tomates, chiles, cebolla, papel higienicas y chiles enlatados para surtir su negocio. 

ella espera que con este credito su negocio prospere ya que desea que su hijo estudie una carrera.	

Doña yolanda se encuentra muy agradecida con la fundacion por elprestamo que se le ha otorgado y envia un saludo a la personas que hacen posible estos creditos.
texts.en:
In the State of Oaxaca there is a community called "Arroyo de Pita", characterized for being the only community in the area that has a high-school, in this community lives Yolanda C., 56 years old, studied up to 4th grade and is a single mother of two, she currently lives with the youngest one that is going to the community's high-school.  

Yolanda tells us that more than 27 years ago she opened a grocery store called "Groceries Yoli", she decided to work on her own business because she had two children and she had to get them ahead by herself.

She needs this loan to purchase rice, beans, oil, soup, soap, toothpaste, soda, candy, coffee, cookies, juice, candles, cream, cheese, tomatoes, pepper, onion, toilet paper and canned peppers to stock her store.

She hopes that with this loan her business grows because she wants her son to go to university and get a degree.

Yolanda is thankful to the foundation for the loan given to her and she says hi to everyone that made it possible.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, oil, soup, soap, toothpaste, soda, candy, coffee, cookies, juice, candles, cream, cheese, tomatoes, pepper, onion, toilet paper and canned peppers

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada Arroyo de pita la cual se caracteriza por ser la unica comunidad en varios kilometros  que cuanta con un bachillerato, en esta comunidad vive la señora Juana Toralba que tiene la edad de 55 años, ella no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar pero a lo largo de su vida a prendi a contar y a escribir un poco, ella es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de nombre Erick que asiste a la preparatoria de su comunidad.

Doña juana nos platica que ella desde muy pequeña inicio a trabajar y actualmente se dedica a la venta de nopales, chiles, ciruelas y platanos, los cuales vende en el mercado de Tierra Blanca.

ella nos dice que inicio a trabajar en su propio negocio ya que desea que su hijo estudie una carrera y darle una mejor calidad de vida.

ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de platanos, nopales, chiles, platanos y bolsas desechables para poder realizar su actividad.

ella nos dice que espera en un futuro poder poner una pequeña verduleria en su comunidad para seguir ayudando a su hijo con sus estudios, Tambien envia un saludo   a la fundacion y mucho agradecimiento por el prestamo que le ha otorgado.
texts.en:
In the State of Oaxaca there is a community called "Arroyo de Pita", characterized for being the only community in the area that has a high-school, here lives Juana T. who is 55, had no opportunities to go to school, but throughout her life she learned o count and write a little, she is a single mom, her son Erick attends the community's high-school.  

Juana says that from a young age she started to work and currently sells cactus, pepper, plums and bananas, at the market of Tierra Blanca.

She tells us that she started her own business because she wants her son to go to University and give him a better quality of life.

She needs this loan to invest it in the purchase of bananas, cactus, peppers, bananas and plastic bags for her business activity.  

She tells us that she hopes in the future to be able to start a small vegetable store in her community and this way continue to help her son with his studies, she sends greetings to the foundation and is thankful for the loan that they provided.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, cactus, peppers and plastic bags

loans.name: Yadira

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada Arroyo de pita la cual se caracteriza por ser la unica comunidad en varios kilometros  que cuanta con un bachillerato, en esta comunidad vive Yadira R. que tiene 22 años de edad, solo estudio la secundaria y esta casada con el señor Even Ezer con el cual tiene dos hijos.

ella nos platica que su esposo es panadero y tienen una panaderia en su comunidad, ella trabaja en la panaderia desde que se caso, tambien nos comenta que en tiempo de calor vende raspados de sabores en su casa.

ella nos platica que inician a trabajar desde el medio dia en la elaboracion del pan y por la tarde salen a venderlo en la comunidad, Yadira nos dice "cuando hay mas venta es en tiempo de frio porque bien que se le antoja a uno un cafesito con pan para quitar el fri y entrar en calorsito".

Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de arinas, azucar y leña para la elaboracion del pan y invertira  poco en la compra de hielo y saborisantes para poner su venta de raspados.

ella espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere ya que desea darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y que en un futuro estudien una carrera.
texts.en:
In the State of Oaxaca there is a community called "Arroyo de Pita", characterized for being the only community in the area that has a high-school, Yadira R. lives in this community, she is 22 years old, studied up to grade 9 and is married to Evan Ezer, with whom she has two children.  

Her husband is a bread maker and they have a bakery in the community where she was worked since they got married, she also tells us that during hot season she sells shaved ice of different flavors from her house.

They start working at noon making bread and in the afternoon they go out to sell it.  Yadira says that: "Sales are high when it's cold because they (customers) feel like having a coffee with a piece of bread to warm up".  

She needs this loan to invest it in buying flour, sugar and firewood to make bread and she will also invest a bit in buying ice and flavors to start selling shaved ice.  

She hopes that with this investment her business grows because she wishes to give her children a better quality of life and the opportunity to attend university.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for bread making and shaved ice making.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada Arroyo de pita la cual se caracteriza por ser la unica comunidad en varios kilometros  que cuanta con un bachillerato, en esta comunidad vive la señora Teresa R. que tiene la edad de 40 años, solo estudio la primaria y esta casada con el señor Federico con el cual tiene un hijo de nombre Ulises que asiste a la primaria de la comunidad.

Ella nos platica que su esposo trabaja en el campo de jornalero y lo que el gana no alcanza ya que cada dia todo sube de precio a si que decidio ayudarlo asiendo los domingos ventas de tamales para ganar un poco de dinero y contribuir con el gasto del hogar.

Doña  Teresa vende sus tamales casa por casa con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad, tambien nos dijo " a veces me buscan para hacer los tamales de los cumpleaños de los hijos de algunos vecionos y ahi me gano unos centavos(dinero) mas".

Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo enla compra de maiz, variedad de chiles, carne, tomatesy manteca de cerdo para la elaboracion de sus tamales y posteriormente venderlos.


ella se encuentra muy agradecida con la fundacin por darle la oportunidad para que su negocio cresca por medio de este prestamo.
texts.en:
In the State of Oaxaca there is a community called "Arroyo de Pita", characterized for being the only community in the area that has a high-school, Teresa R. lives in this community, she is 40 years old, only went to elementary school and is married to Federico with whom she has a son named Ulises that goes to elementary school.  

She mentions that her husband works as a farm worker, and what he makes is not enough, because prices keep going up, so she decided to help him by making tamales for sale on Sundays to make a bit of money and contribute to the family expenses.  

Teresa sells her tamales door by door to her friends and neighbors, she also told us that "sometimes they (customers) make orders of tamales for birthdays and this way I can make extra money".  

She needs the loan to invest it in the purchase of corn, peppers, meat, tomatoes and pork fat to make tamales for sale.  She is thankful to the foundation for giving her the opportunity for her business to grow with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make tamales for sale

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada Arroyo de pita la cual se caracteriza por ser la unica comunidad en varios kilometros  que cuanta con un bachillerato, en esta comunidad vive la señora Teresa A. V. que tiene la edad de 43 años, estudio hasta el tercer gado de secundaria y estacasada con el señor ciriaco que trabaja en el campo, con el cual tiene dos hijos los cuales asisten a la escuela en su comunidad.

Doña teresa nos platica que ella tiene una pequeña tiendita de abarrotes la cual abrio con el apoyo de su esposo para ayudarse un poco con los gastos del hogar y los estudios de sus pequeños.

tambien nos comenta que asistio a un curso de reposteria en el cual aprendio a cosinar pasteles y postres y algunas veces en las señoras de la comunidad mandan le mandan ha hacer los pasteles de cumple años de sus hijos y gana un poco de dinero extra.

ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de arroz, frijol, aceite, sopa, jabon, pasta dental, refrescos, dulces, cafe, galletas, jugos, veladoras, crema, queso, tomates, chiles, cebolla, papel higienicas y chiles enlatados para surtir su negocio.

ella espera que con este credito su negocio prospere ya que desea darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y en un futuro que estudien una carrera.
texts.en:
In the State of Oaxaca there is a community called "Arroyo de Pita", characterized for being the only community in the area that has a high-school, Teresa A. V. lives in this community, she is 43 years old, went to 9th grade and is married to Ciriaco, who works in the fields, they have to children that go to the community school.  

Teresa has a small grocery store that she opened with her husband's help to contribute with the home expenses and their children's studies.

She also tells us that she attended a pastries course in which she learned to make cakes and desserts and sometimes the ladies in the community make cake orders for their children's birthdays and this way she makes a bit of extra cash.  

She needs this loan to invest it in the purchase of rice, beans, oil, soup, toothpaste, soda, candy, coffee, cookies, juice, candles, cream, cheese, tomatoes, onions, toilet paper and canned peppers to stock her business.  

She hopes that this loan will help grow her business, she wishes to give her kids a better quality of life and the opportunity to have post-secondary studies in the future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada Arroyo de pita la cual se caracteriza por ser la unica comunidad en varios kilometros  que cuanta con un bachillerato, en esta comunidad vive la señora Laura O. la cual tiene 30 años de edad, estudio hasta el quinto grado de primaria y esta casada con el señor Herminio el cual trabaja como jornalero, ellos tienen dos hijos los cuales asisten a la primaria de la comunidad.

Doña Laura nos platica que ella decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio porque lo que gana su esposo en el campo es muy poco y no alcanza para cubrir todas las necesidades de su hogar. 


Ella nos platica que vende chiles rellenos y tamales los fines de semana con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad, ella vende casa por cas y dice "Dios da para todos y siempre termino mis tamales"

Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de maiz, variedad de chiles, tomates, carne, aceite y  manteca para elaborar sus tamales y chiles para  posteriormente venderlos

ella espera que su negocio prospere cada dia y deje ganancias ya que desea invertir un poco en refrescos y a futuro poner una pequeña tiendita en su hogar.

ella se encuentra muy agradecida con la fundacion y envia un saludo a las personas que hacen posible estos prestamos.
texts.en:
In the State of Oaxaca there is a community called "Arroyo de Pita", characterized for being the only community in the area that has a high-school, Laura O. lives in this community, she is 30, with studies of 5th grade, married to Herminio who works as a journeyman, they have two children that attend elementary school in the community.

Laura tells us that she decided to work on her own business because what her husband makes in the fields is not enough to cover the needs of their home.  

She sells stuffed peppers and tamales on the weekend to her friends and neighbors, she sells door to door and says that "God gives to everyone and I always sell out of my tamales".

Laura needs this loan to invest it in the purchase of corn, peppers, tomatoes, meat, oil and fat to make the tamales and stuffed peppers and sell them.  

She hopes that her business prospers and gives profits so that she can invest some of it in soft drinks and a have a small store in her house.  She is very thankful to the foundation and sends greetings to the people that make these loans possible.

loans.use: to purchase of corn, peppers, tomatoes, meat, oil and fat to make the tamales and stuffed peppers for sale.

loans.name: Camino Al Exito Group

texts.es: Un grupo emprendedor y con una gran visión D. futuro, así se caracteriza la alcancía comunal Camino al Éxito integrada por 8 miembros hace más de 8 meses. Un grupo con mucho en común como el deseo de superación y con una historia en particular de cada integrante, tal es así el caso de la señora Bonifacia A. de 43 años de edad casada y con tres hijos. Ella se dedica diariamente a la venta de Bisutería, con el esfuerzo de su trabajo  ha logrado darles una mejor educación a sus hijos y ayudar con los gastos en el hogar, ya que ahora tiene mayores ingresos  económicos. Una de sus grandes metas es inaugurar su propio Bazar de Bisutería. Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá para comprar más material para la elaboración de la Bisutería. En el futuro le gustaría ampliar su negocio con una cadena de Bazares, para a si obtener mayores ingresos para ella y su familia.
texts.en: Entrepreneurial and with vision, those are the characteristics of the community bank "On the Way to Success" formed more than eight months ago by eight members. A group with lots in common, such as the wish for improvement and with a particular story for each member, such as Bonifacia A., 43, married with three children, she sells jewelery and with her efforts, she has been able to provide a better education to her kids and help with the family expenses because she now has more income.  One of her goals is to open a jewelry store.  With the loan she will buy materials to make more jewelry.  In the future, she would like to expand her business with a chain of jewelry stores and have more income for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy more material to make jewelry.

loans.name: Consuelo Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Consuelo tienen la edad de 26 años, solo estudio la primaria y se encuentra casada con el señor adrian el cual trabaja en  el campo de jornalero, ella tiene dos hijas y vive en la comunidad de Arroyo de pita la cual se caracteriza por ser la unica comunidad en varios kilometros que cuenta con una preparatoria. 

doña consuelo nos platica que desde hace algunos años siempre a tenido el deseo de abrir una pequeña verduleria en su hogar pero desafortunadamente no tenia los recursos economicos para iniciar a trabajar en su negocio, ella nos platica que le gustaria trabajar para poder ayudar a  su esposo con los gastos del hogar y los estudios de sus hijos.

ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de chiles, tomates, cebollas, manzanas, platanos, col, cilantro, jicamas, brocoli, lechugas, tambien desea invertir un poco en la compra de dulces.

ella espera que con este prestamo su negocio ya empiese a funcionar y a futuro espera ir agrandandolo poco a poco.

ella se encuentra muy agradecida con la fundacion por la confianza que le otorgo al brindarle este prestamo el cual le dara la oportunidar de iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio y darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos
texts.en:
Ms. Consuelo is 26 years old. She only attended primary school and she is married to Mr. Adrian who works as a field laborer. She has two daughters and lives in the community of Arroyo de Pita, which is known for being the only community for many kilometers with a high school.

Consuelo tells Fundación Realidad A.C (FRAC) that ever since a few years ago, she has always had a desire to open a small produce stand in her home but that unfortunately, she never had the economic resources to start her business. She also tells FRAC that she would like to work in order to help her husband with the household expenses and her daughters' schooling.

She needs this loan to invest in the purchase of chilies, tomatoes, onions, apples, bananas, cabbage, cilantro, jicama, broccoli and lettuce. She would also like to invest a bit in purchasing sweets.

Consuelo hopes that she will be able to get her business off the ground with this loan, and in the future she hopes to expand it little by little.

She is very grateful to the organization for showing confidence in her by offering this loan, which will give her the opportunity to start her own business so that she can provide her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to start her own business selling produce and sweets

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La señora cecilia tiene la edad de 50 años, estudio hasta el tercer grado de primaria, y se encuntra casada con el señor Jose L. con el cual tiene dos hijos los cuales asisten ala universidad en tierra blanca, ella y su familia viven en la comunidad de Arroyo de pita En el estado de Oaxaca su comunidad se caracteriza por ser la unica comunidad en varior kilometros que tiene bachillerato. 

doña cecilia nos platica que desde hace un poco mas de tres años decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio ya que con sus hijos estudiando la carrera el dinero que su esposo gana no les alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos de su hogas, ella nos dice que vende refrescos y dulces desde su hogar con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad. 

ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de refrescos, jugos y dulces para posteriormente venderlos. 

Doña cecilia espera en un futuro con sus ganancias ir agrandando su negocio y convertirlo en una pequeña tiendita de abarrotes, tambien nos mostro su agradecimiento para la fundacion por la confianza que le ha otorgado al brindarle este credito.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 50 years old and studied through the 3rd grade of elementary school. She is married to Jose L., with whom she has two children who attend college in Tierra Blanca. She and her family live in the community of Arroyo de Pita in the state of Oaxaca. Her community is characterized by being the only community in many kilometers that has a high school.

Cecilia tells as that she decided to start working in her own business a little more than three years ago. Since her children were studying in college, the money that her husband makes was not enough to cover the costs of their home. She tells us that she sells soft drinks and sweets from her home with her friends and neighbors from the community.

She needs this loan to invest in the purchase of soft drinks, juices and sweets to sell later on.

In the future, Cecilia hopes to continue expanding her business and turn it into a small grocery store. She also expressed her gratitude to the foundation for trusting her with this loan.

loans.use: to sell soft drinks and sweets

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi E. is married to a farmer and they have 7 children. To supplement her husband’s income, Esi runs a stall selling provisions. As shown in the photograph, she sells eggs, cooking oil, seasonings and other food items. 

Esi aspires to grow her business and plans to use her Kiva loan to purchase larger quantities and more varieties of food items for her stall. She hopes that this will help keep her current customers coming back and also attract new ones.  She is focused on long-term growth and plans to reinvest whatever extra income she earns back into her business.

loans.use: buy more food items to resell

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada Arroyo de pita la cual se caracteriza por ser la unica comunidad en varios kilometros  que cuanta con un bachillerato, en esta comunidad vive El señor Isidro G. tiene la edad de 45 años, es profesor y esta casada, el tiene tres hijos los cuales estudian en la escuela de la comunidad.

el nos platica que hace mas de 15 compro algunos terrenos y decidio invertir en la siembra de caña de azucar ya que vive en una zona cañera y en eses tiempos la caña dejaba buena ganacia,el vende su cosecha cada zafra(tiempo en que los ingenios producen azucar) al ingenio la margarita que se encuentra a un poco mas de un hora de su comunidad, el nos cuenta que cone l pasar de los años la caña ha ido perdiendo valor pero a el legusta trabajar en ella y nos dice "yo amo mis tierras porque aun que sea un poquito de dinero me va dando cada año mi caña". Don Isidro necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de fertilizantes, y abonos para su sembradio. El espera que con esta inversion su caña cresca sana y fuerte  para que la proximma zfra le deje buenas ganancias. el se encuentra muy agradecido y manda un saludo a las personas que hacen posible estos creditos.
texts.en: In the state of Oaxaca there is a community called Arroyo de Pita which is known for being the only community for many kilometers with a high school. This community is where Mr. Isidro G. lives. He is 45 years old, a teacher, and is married with three children who attend school in the community. He tells Fundacíon Realidad A.C (FRAC) that more than 15 years ago, he bought some land and decided to invest in planting sugarcane because he lives in a sugarcane-producing zone and in those days, sugarcane brought in a good profit. He sells his harvest each zafra (period of time when the refineries produce sugar). The Margarita refinery is located a little more than an hour from his community. He also tells FRAC that over the years, sugarcane has been losing its value but he likes working in it and says, "I love my land because even if it's just a little money, each year it keeps giving me my sugarcane." Mr. Isidro needs this loan to invest in the purchase of organic and chemical fertilizers for the fields he currently has planted. He hopes that with this investment his sugarcane will grow healthy and strong so that he earns a good profit during the the next zifra. He is very grateful and sends his greetings to the people who make these loans possible.

loans.use: to plant and grow sugarcane

loans.name: Avelina

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada Arroyo de pita la cual se caracteriza por ser la unica comunidad en varios kilometros  que cuanta con un bachillerato, en esta comunidad vive La señora Avelina S. tiene la edad de 55 años, solo estudio la primaria y esta casada con el señor bonifacio el cual se dedica al tranajo del campo.

Doña Abelina nos platica que hace mas de 30 años abrio una pequeña tiendita de abarrotes y con el pasar de los años le fue invirtiendo mas y metio un poco de papeleria, su tienda es una de las mas grandes y mojor surtidas de la comunidad, ademas de tener sus abarrotes ella vende pollo en su casa de lunes a domingo con sus amigos y vecinos, doña avelina es una mujer muy alegre, entusiasta y trabajadora, ella nos dice que inicio atrabajar en su negocio porque deseaba ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y ahora solo desea que su negocio prospere dia a dia para ayudar a sus hijas a dale estudios a sus nietos, 

ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de lapiz, lapiceros, hojas blancas y de colores, resistol, tijeras, cartilinas, papel bond, plastilina, unicel, fomy, cuadernos, libretas, laminas,arroz, frijol, aceite, sopa, jabon, pasta dental, refrescos, dulces, cafe, galletas, jugos, veladoras, crema, queso, tomates, chiles, cebolla y  papel higienico ara resurtir su negocio. ella se encuantra muy contenta por el prestamo otorgado y envia un saludo a la fundacion y mucho agradecimiento ya que con este prestamo hara que su negocio prospere
texts.en:
There is a community in the state of Oaxaca called Arroyo de Pita, which is known for being the only community for miles around that offers the possibility of obtaining a high school diploma. In this community lives Avelina S.. She is 55 years of age, has only studied at primary school and is married to Bonifacio, who works in agriculture.

Avelina tells us that she opened a small grocery store over 30 years ago. With the passing of time she invested more and more into her business, expanding it to include a bit of stationery as well, until it became one of the biggest and best stocked in the community. As well as selling groceries, Avelina also sells chicken in her house to her friends and neighbours, seven days a week. Avelina is a very happy, enthusiastic and hardworking woman. She tells us that she started her business because she wanted to help her husband with living expenses and give her children a better quality of life. Her only wish is that her business prospers day by day to help her daughters provide her grandchildren with an education.

Avelina needs this loan to purchase pens, pencils, white and coloured paper, glue, scissors, paper for posters, bond paper, plasticine, styrofoam, foam rubber, exercise books, notebooks, lamination paper, rice, beans, oil, soup, soap, toothpaste, refreshments, sweets, coffee, biscuits, juice, candles, cream, cheese, tomatoes, chillies, onions and toilet paper to restock her store. Avelina is very happy to receive the loan that has been granted to her and sends her greetings and much gratitude to the foundation for the loan that will make her business prosper.

loans.use: to purchase groceries, stationery and chicken

loans.name: Abigail

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada Arroyo de pita la cual se caracteriza por ser la unica comunidad en varios kilometros  que cuanta con un bachillerato, en esta comunidad vive Abigail S., ella tiene la edad de 41 años, estudio hasta el tercer grado se secundaria y es soltera.

Ella nos platica que hace mas de 4 años inicio atrabajar en su propio negocio de venta de refrescos y productos de bellesa de la marca Avon con sus amigas y vecinas de la comunidad, ella vende casa por casa, primero lleva sus catalagos a sus clientes, levanta un pedido, lo encarga a sus proveedores y posteriormente cuando llega el paquete lo entrega con sus clientas y recebe el pago por sus productos.

ella nos dice que espera que con esta credito su negocio cresca mas cada dia. Abigail necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de refrescos, catalogos, perfumeria y cosmeticos para posteriormente venderlos.

ella se encuentra muy agradecida con este prestamo que se le ha otorgado el cual le brindara la oportinidad de que su negocio creesca
texts.en:
In the state of Oaxaca there is a community called Arroyo de Pita, which is known for being the only community for miles around that offers the possibility of obtaining a high school diploma. In this community lives Abigail S.. She is 41 years of age, studied until Year 9 at secondary school and is single.

Abigail tells us that she started her own business more than four years ago selling refreshments and Avon beauty products to her friends and neighbours in the community from door to door. First she brings her clients catalogues, then she takes their orders which she sends to the Avon providers and finally she delivers the cosmetics to her clients and receives payments for the products.

Abigail tells us that she hopes to use this loan to expand her business day by day. She needs this loan to purchase refreshments, catalogues, perfumes and cosmetics to resell.

Abigail is very grateful for the loan that she has been granted, which will give her the opportunity to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and refreshments

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Intocables” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y tiene cuatro  hijos.  La señora estudió educación secundaria. 
La señora se dedicaba  a la venta de comidas preparadas, ahora se dedica a la venta de abarrotes.  Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres años.  Su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de comidas.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, comprará productos para su tienda como: arroz, azúcar, leche, aceites y otros.  La señora trabaja sola, su esposo trabaja como transportista de servicio urbano.
Su sueño es ser una gran empresaria.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es el préstamo de la cuenta interna.
texts.en:
Pilar is a member of the communal bank named "The Untouchables", located in the district of Puno, in the province and department of Puno. She is 42 years old, married, and she has four children. She has a high school education. 

She used to sell prepared foods but now she has a convenience store. She has been with the Manuela Ramos movement (Kiva Field Partner) for the past three years. Her first loan was in the amount of S/.300 nuevos soles and the funds were invested in her catering business. 

With this new loan is in the amount of S/.500 nuevos soles she will purchase products for her store, such as: rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil, and others. She works alone and her husband is a public transport driver in the city. 

Her dream is to have a large business. 

What she most enjoys about her communal bank is personal loans.

loans.use: to purchase products for her store, such as rice, sugar, milk, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Helder Fredman

texts.es: Helder Fredman tiene 34 años. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de cerdo hace mas de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, el inicia este negocio  por la necesidad de trabajar ya que  no tenía un trabajo estable y decide establecer el negocio en su vivienda y empieza con la compra de un cerdo y al tener afluencia de clientes decide invertir más en su negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo destinado para la compra de  mas  cerdos. En futuro le gustaría realizar ciertas remodelaciones a su vivienda.
texts.en: Helder Fredman is 34 years old. His business has been the buying and selling of pigs for the past 5 years. He started the business for the need to work. He didn't have stable employment and so he decided to set up a business at his house. He started with the purchase of one pig and when he had an affluence of clients he decided to invest more in his business. The loan will be used as capital funds to purchase more livestock. In the future he would like to carry out some home improvements.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Deysi Lourdes

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “OLLANTAY DE WAYRACPUNCU”; Este banco está ubicado en la Provincia de Urubamba y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Deysi; es conviviente; la socia tiene 43 años de edad; la socia tiene 2 hijos, de 23 y 21 años de edad; la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista y también ella tiene un restaurante, la socia a su vez tiene una tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende en su restaurante, desayunos, almuerzos, ella compra al por mayor arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite y otros; la socia desea el crédito para poder invertir  en la compra de insumos para cocinar en el restaurante, la socia también implementara su tienda. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos para su negocio.


La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Deysi is part of “Ollantay de Wayracpuncu” communal bank, located in the Urubamba province of Cusco department.  She is 43 years old and has a live in partner and two children who are 23 and 21 years old.  

Deysi alternates household activities with retail business.  She has a restaurant and in turn, a grocery store.  In her restaurant, she sells breakfast and lunch and purchases rice, sugar, noodles, oil and other things in bulk.  Deysi wants this loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients to cook in the restaurant.  She also wants to set up her store.  

Deysi wants the loan to invest in the purchase of products for her business.  She is very grateful for the loan and is committed to completing her loan payments with discipline.

loans.use: invest in the purchase of products for her business.

loans.name: Beautiful Skies Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CIELITO LINDO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Yaneth. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: revistas, venta de cortinas, venta de comidas, venta de salchipapas, repostería, venta de rellenos.

La señora Yaneth,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por recomendación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de salchipapas que viene realizando hace una año atrás, negocio que aprendió por intermedio de una amistad.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de incremento de capital (para la venta de salchipapas) y la compra de una cabina telefónica. Los insumos para la elaboración de las salchipapas las adquiere de la calle Rodríguez y los venderá en Sensata de martes a domingo en horas de 16:00 a 23:00, con la ayuda de sus papas. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hijo, pues ella es soltera.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.
texts.en:
The communal bank named "Beautiful Skies" is on their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer (Kiva Field Partner), as part of Centro Focal de Santiago II. The group is made up of 8 members and it is lead by a board of directors and the group president Yaneth. The members of the communal bank have various business types, including: magazines, curtain sales, prepared food sales, salchipapas (a traditional fast food consisting of sausages and french fries), dessert sales, and stuffing sales.

Yaneth says that it is the first time that she has joined Pro Mujer and she joined following a recommendation by a friend. She currently has a business selling salchipapas, a business she started last year. She learned the business from a friend.

The loan will be used to increase her working capital (for her salchipapas business) and to purchase a telephone booth. She acquires the ingredients she needs to make salchipapas at Rodriguez Street and she sells them at Sensata from Tuesday to Sunday, from 4pm to 11pm, with the help of her parents. This business generates an income to support her son in as much as she can. She is single. 

When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the orientation.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make salchipapas and to purchase a telephone booth.

loans.name: Fabiana Melina

texts.es:
Fabiana  es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Intocables” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene una  hija.  La señora estudió educación secundaria (incompleto). 
La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres años, con su primer  préstamo  solicitado que fue de  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, invirtió  en su negocio de servicios de fotocopias y venta de títeres.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 1800.00 nuevos soles, comprará 1 ciento de títeres, una caja de papeles en general y tóner para la máquina. En el negocio le ayuda su hija.
Su sueño es tener más capital y tener más mercadería en el negocio.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Fabiana is a member of the communal bank "The Untouchables", located in the district of Puno, in the province and Department of Puno. She is 45 years old and she is a single mother to her daughter. She has a high school education (incomplete). 

She has been with the Manuela Ramos movement (Kiva Field Partner) for the past three years. Her first loan was in the amount of S/.300 nuevos soles and she invested the funds in her photocopy business and on her puppet sales.

With this new loan in the amount of S/. 1800 nuevos soles, she will purchase 100 puppets, a box of paper and toner for her copy machine. Her daughter helps her with her business. 

Her dream is to earn more capital and to have more merchandise for her business. 

What she most enjoys about the communal bank is the easy loan process.

loans.use: to purchase 100 puppets, a box of paper and toner for the photocopy machine.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio, de 38 años de edad, natural del distrito de Kimbiri, esta casado con  Claudia de 37 años y fruto de su relación concibieron  03 hijos y juntos habitan en su propia casa  donde reina la felicidad.
