Julio, es un hombre que se esmera cada día por dar lo mejor a sus hijos, su trabajo consiste en labrar la tierra, es campesino y cuenta con 06 hectáreas de terreno en donde cultiva cacao y café, que son plantas nativas de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. Han transcurrido 17 años trabajando y hasta el momento continúa en esta actividad para forjar un futuro a sus hijos. Asimismo ellos lo apoyan durante la temporada de cosecha, además de contratar jornaleros, ya que este proceso requiere de mucho esfuerzo y rapidez y lograr recolectar los frutos para luego comercializarlos a las empresas acopiadoras, quienes le remuneran muy bien por cada kilogramo de cada producto que vende. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta la ciudad de san francisco; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus productos. Por ahora lo que más prioriza es comprar más semillas de cacao ya que cuenta con espacio suficiente para cultivar. Este es su 12avo crédito con MFP, esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito más adelante. En su banco comunal es un socio muy participe. Con el crédito solicitado contratara jornaleros para que le apoyen en el desmonte de maleza que perjudican sus plantaciones.
texts.en: Julio is 38 years old and he is originally from the district of Kimbiri. He is married with Claudia, 37 years old, and they have 3 children from their relationship. They live together in a house that is their own and where happiness reigns. Julio is a man who works every day for the welfare of his children. His work consists of working the land. He is a farmer and he has 6 hectares of land where he cultivates cocoa and coffee. These are native plants to the jungle region of Valle Rio Apurimac. Seventeen years have passed and today he continues with the business to forge a future for his children. In turn, they help him during the harvest and he also hires farm hands especially because this work requires a great deal of effort and expediency to harvest the entire product to sell to the distributing companies. They pay him very well for each kilogram of product that he sells. He considers the most difficult part is having to transport his products from the fields to the city of San Francisco. That is where they give him better prices for his products. For the moment the priority is to purchase more cocoa seeds as he has enough room to plant them. This is his 12th loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he is committed to making his payments on time, as he wishes to access future loans. In this communal bank, he is a very involved member. With the loan that he requests he will hire farm hands to help him combat the plagues that harm his plantations.

loans.use: to hire farm hands to help him combat the plagues that damage his plantations.

loans.name: Turquesa Group

texts.es:
En la comunidad de Matanaranjo en el estado de veracruz existe un grupo solidario llamado Turquesa sus intragntes lo llamaron asi porque es un color que las anima a trabajar con fuerza para salir adelande con sus familias, este grupo lo entegran: Sandra P. D. que vende zapatos por catalogo,Maria D. que vende carnes frias( jamon, salchichas, queso y chorizo) y pollo destazado,  Maria del Carmen R. que vende tamales, mayte L. y felipa C. que venden por catalago cosmeticos y  la señora elena H. que se dedica a la venta de pollos.
la representante de este grupo es la señora Elena que tiene la edad de 34 años, estudio hasta el sexto grado de primaria, esta casada con el señor Ruben Vazquez Peña con el cual tiene 2 hijos de los cuales unos es un niño de 11 años de edad que estudia la primaria en su comunidad y una niña de 13 años que asiste a la secundaria.ella nos platica que hace mas de tres años inicio a vender pollo destazado con sus amigos y vecinos con el paso del tiempo su negocio ha hido cresiendo y ahora tiene su propio criadero de pollo, ademas vende pollo en una comunidad cercana que se llama la granja y se encuentra en la orrila de la carretera federal tierra blanca - ciudad aleman, ella poco a poco con sus ganancia ha hecho que su negocio cresca, ella nos platica que su negocio es familiar ya que todos la ayudan a cuidar los pollos, alimentarlos y algunas veces a vender.
Ella necesita este credito para invertiorlo en la compra de pollitos para criar y alimentos. Doña Elena nos dice que ella espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere y cresca mas cada dia ya que desea que sus hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida y estudien una profesion en un futuro. ella envia un saludo a la fundacion y agradece la confianza que le ha brindado
texts.en:
In Matanaranjo community, in the State of Veracruz, there is a community bank called Turquesa (Turquoise).  The members gave it this name because it is a color that encourages them to work hard in order to get ahead in life with their families.   The members of this group are: Sandra P. D., who sells shoes from a catalog; Maria D., who sells cold cuts (ham, sausages, cheese and chorizo) and chicken pieces; Maria del Carmen R., who sells tamales; Mayte L. and Felipa C. who sell cosmetics through a catalog, and Elena H. who sells chickens.

The group's representative is Elena who is 34 years old, studied up to the sixth grade of elementary school, and is married to Ruben Vazquez Peña, with whom she has two children: an 11 year-old boy who is attending elementary school in their community and a 13 year-old girl who is in high school.

Elena tells us that she started selling chicken pieces to her friends and neighbors over three years ago.  Over time, her business has grown and now she has her own poultry farm.  She also sells chicken in a nearby community called La Granja which is located near the Tierra Blanca - Ciudad Alemán federal highway.

Elena has gradually used her profits to make her business grow.  She tells us that hers is a family business since everybody helps her to look after the chickens, feed them and sometimes sell them.  Elena needs this loan to invest in buying chicks to raise and also feed for them.  She tells us that she hopes that this investment in her business will be successful and that her business will keep growing because she would like her children to enjoy a better quality of life and to study for a profession in the future.  She sends greetings to Fundación Realidad and thanks them for the trust they have placed in her.

loans.use: to sell chicken, cosmetics, perfumes, tamales, cold cuts and shoes

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba Y. is married to a farmer. With 10 children, they have a rather large family to support. Aba makes a living selling kenkey, a Ghanaian staple made from fermented maize dough. It is usually served with pepper sauce and fish. The income Aba makes helps pay for their children’s school fees and some of the household expenses. 

As their family grows, so does the need to make ends meet. Aba wants to grow her kenkey business and needs a loan to purchase more maize so that she can prepare more kenkey. Additional profits she makes will be used to provide for her family and also reinvested back into her business for further growth. 

Aba is showing the soaked maize yet to be processed into corn dough to be used to prepare the kenkey.

loans.use: to buy more maize to make kenkey

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba N. sells banku in Eguafo Village, near the fishing town Elmina. Banku is a favourite Ghanaian staple made from fermented maize dough and cassava dough. It is usually served with fish stew, soup or pepper sauce. She also sells clothes to make some extra income. Aba has been in this trade for 15 years. 

Aba’s husband is a security guard and they have six children. Her income goes a long way in paying for their children’s school fees and some household expenses. 

Aba plans to use the loan to purchase more maize, fish, tomatoes and other food ingredients to grow her food business. She also intends to purchase more clothes for sale. Focused on long-term growth, her additional profits will be reinvested back into her business.

In this picture Aba is showing the corn dough she uses for the banku.

loans.use: to buy maize, fish, tomatoes and other food ingredients

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth I. is from Eguafo Village, which is situated close to the fishing town Elmina. Her husband is a farmer and they have four children. For the past 8 years, Elizabeth has made a living selling kenkey, a favourite Ghanaian staple made from fermented maize dough and usually served with fish and pepper sauce.  Her income helps pay for her children’s school fees and utility bills. 

Elizabeth needs a loan from Kiva to grow her business. It will be used to purchase more maize and more firewood to produce larger quantities of kenkey.

Elizabeth plans to save any additional earnings for her children’s future university education.

loans.use: to buy more maize and firewood

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es: Un grupo con creatividad para los negocios y empeño por salir adelante, así se caracteriza la alcancía comunal Sol Naciente integrada por 8 miembros hace más de 6 años. Un grupo con mucho en común como el deseo de superación y con una historia en particular de cada integrante, tal es así el caso de la señora Vilma M. de 45 años de edad casada y con tres hijos. Ella se dedica diariamente a la venta de productos de Belleza, trabajo que viene desempeñando desde hace mas de dos años, con el esfuerzo de su trabajo  ha logrado mejorar su calidad de vida, ya que ahora tiene mayores ingresos  económicos, el cual gracias  a eso  está a punto de lograr una de sus grandes metas que es concluir la construcción de su vivienda para asegurarle a sus hijos un lugar donde puedan vivir y desarrollarse como excelentes ciudadanos. Vilma M. no solo es una próspera trabajadora, sino que también es una excelente cocinera, es por eso que eventualmente se dedica a preparar deliciosos platillos los fines de semana, para a si lograr algunos ingresos extras. Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá para compras de productos de belleza tales como perfumes y cremas para la piel. En el futuro le gustaría ampliar su negocio para a si obtener mayores ingresos para ella y su familia.
texts.en: A group that is creative in business and hard work to get ahead- that is how the Sol Naciente [Emerging Sun] community bank is described. It has had 8 members for more than 6 years. This group has a lot in common, such as wanting to get ahead. Each member has her own particular story. Such is the case with Vilma M., who is 45 years old and has three children. She works every day selling beauty products, work she has been doing for more than two years. With her hard work she has managed to improve her quality of life, since she now has more income. She is now about to achieve one of her biggest goals, which is finishing construction on her home, to ensure that her children have a place to live and grow as excellent citizens.Vilma M. is not just a prosperous worker, but an excellent cook as well. That is why she eventualy began to prepare delicious dishes on weekends to make some extra income. With the recent loan, she will invest in buying beauty products such as perfume and skin creams. In the future, she would like to grow her business to have more income for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama B. sells pastries at Eguafo near Elmina. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer.  She has been in this trade for just 2 years and therefore needs a loan to expand it. The loan, when received, will be added to her initial capital to buy flour, oil and other ingredients that will enable her to bake more for sale. She assists her husband in providing the basic needs for the family. She plans to plough her additional profit back into the business.

loans.use: will be added to her initial capital to buy flour, oil and other ingredients that will enable her to bake more for sale.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena T. is married and has four children. Her husband is a security guard. To help with the household expenses and the children’s school fees, Abena makes and sells fante kenkey, a trade she has been in for five years.   Kenkey is a popular Ghanaian staple made from fermented corn dough. It is often served with pepper sauce and fried fish. 

To grow her business and increase her sales volume, Abena needs a loan to purchase more corn and oil.  The additional profits she makes will be reinvested back into her business for further growth. 

In the photo, Abena is showing a fante kenkey she had taken from her cooking pot.

loans.use: buy more corn and oil

loans.name: Alba Nubia

texts.es: Alba Nubia tiene 3 hijos menores de edad, por lo que siempre esa pendiente de lo que necesitan. Ella necesita sufragar los gastos del hogar, por lo que es la primera vez que recurre a los financiamientos, ya que ha sido de gran beneficio para su negocio. Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, pues todos los días se levanta para vender sus productos, día a día trabaja arduamente en llevar el pan de cada día. Este financiamiento es para comprar perfumes, body, pinturas de uñas, pintura de labios, brillos, cremas entre otros. En un futuro le gustaría establecer una pulpería en su vivienda, pero hasta los momentos quisiera tener un gran inventario.
texts.en: Alba Nubia has 3 dependent children and is always alert to their needs.  She needs to cover her household expenses and this is the first time that she has taken out a loan.  It has been of great benefit to her business.  Alba sells cosmetics.  Every day she gets up to sell her products.  Every day she works hard to provide for her family.  She will use this loan to buy perfumes, body lotions, nail polish, lipsticks, gloss, creams, etc.  In the future, she would like to set up a grocery store in her home but for now she would like to have a good inventory of products.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, body lotion, nail polish, lipsticks, gloss, creams, etc.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor tiene 51 años de edad, convive con su  pareja y tienen cuatro hijos. Juntos residen en la comunidad de Villa Quintiarina, caserío  del distrito de Kimbiri. Víctor desde muy joven quería tener su propio terreno para cultivar, para así dejar el trabajo de jornalero y trabajar en tierras ajenas. Pero con sus ahorros que acumuló durante años, pudo al fin concretar su sueño, y ahora posee 05 hectáreas en donde cultiva cacao y plátano, productos que tiene mucha demanda, ya que las empresas acopiadoras son quienes más compran sus productos, en especial la de cacao, es así como recibe buen pago por sus sacos de grano cosechado. En temporada de cosecha y limpieza de sus plantaciones, tiene contratar jornaleros, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos. Su plan a futuro es demoler su casa de material rustico y construir una nueva casa a base de material noble, para que de esa manera se sientan cómoda toda su familia. Este es su 12avo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además se siente muy a gusto trabajar con su banco comunal. Con el dinero del crédito comprará herramientas para su trabajo como tijeras de poda, serruchos y machetes que le serán de gran utilidad para mejorar su campo de cultivo.
texts.en:
Victor is 51 years old. He lives with his partner and they have four children. Together they live in the community of Villa Quintiarina, Kimbiri village district. 

From a young age Victor wanted to own land to farm, so as to be able to leave his job as laborer working in land owned by others. Thanks to the savings he accumulated over the years he was finally able to fulfill his dream, and he now owns 5 hectares where he grows cocoa and banana. Both products have a high demand and the middlemen are his main buyers, particularly cocoa. That's how he gets a good price for his sacks of harvested grain. 

During  the harvest and when it's time to clean his plantations he has to hire laborers, although occasionally his children help him. His future plan is to demolish his house, built in basic materials, and build a new house in  finer materials so as to make his family more comfortable. 

This is his 12th loan with MFP and he is committed to continuing to fulfill the payment schedule. He also feels very comfortable working with his community bank. With the loan money he will buy tools for his job, such as pruning shears, saws and machetes, that will be of great use to improve his farm.

loans.use: to buy tools such as pruning shears, saws and machetes.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba M. is a soft drinks seller from Eguafo Village, near the fishing town of Elmina. Having run this business for seven years, she wants to expand it further by purchasing more drinks, both in quantity and variety. She hopes that this will help her attract more customers and also meet the needs of her existing ones. Focused on long term growth, Aba plans to reinvest the additional earnings back into her business. 

Aba is married to a farmer and her income helps pay for many household expenses. Ultimately, she wants to save up enough to purchase a piece of land to build a home.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Jesus Lola

texts.es:
Jesús es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Intocables” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene tres  hijos, la señora estudió educación superior. 
Jesús se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres años, con su primer préstamo solicitado fue por la suma de  S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.
La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/ 2500.00 nuevos soles dinero que utilizará para comprar dos fardos de frazadas, mantones, sombreros, todo lo compra de Juliaca y Desaguadero para venderlos en el mercado de la ciudad.  La señora trabaja sola ya que su esposo trabaja en el magisterio.
Su sueño es crecer y mejorar el negocio pera tener mayores ingresos.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y el compañerismo entre las socias.
texts.en:
Jesús is a member s a community bank called “Las Intocables” [The Untouchables], located in the district of Puno, province and departament of Puno. She is 39 years old, in a common law marriage and has three children. She is a high school graduate.  
 
Jesús sells clothing. She has worked in the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years. The first loan she took out was for the amount of  S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, which she invested in her business. 

She will ask for a new loan in the amount of S/ 2500.00 nuevos soles, money she will use to buy two bundles of blankets, shawls, and hats. She buys them all from Juliaca y Desaguadero to sell in the city markets. She works alone sonce her husband works as a teacher. 

Her dream is to grow and improve in business to have more income. What she likes about the community bank is the companionship among the members.

loans.use: to buy two bundles of blankets, shawls, hats.

loans.name: Lupercia Geltrudis

texts.es:
Lupercia de 51 años, es una mujer muy emprendedora en su trabajo ya que hace 12 años empezo con su tienda vendiendo legumbre y poco a poco lo fue incrementando su capital de trabajo. 

Ha tenido muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso ella labora desde las 6H00am a 10H00pm atendiendo la tienda en ocasiones tambien cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos. Con el prestamo quiere comprar legumbres, arroz, azucar a por mayor para surtir su negocio e incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Lupercia is 51 years old.  She is a very enterprising woman in her work.  Twelve years ago she set up a store selling vegetables and she has gradually increased her working capital.

Lupercia has a lot of aspirations for her business and, for that reason, she serves in her store from 6.00am to 10.00pm.  Sometimes she also has the support of her children.  Lupercia would like to use this loan to buy vegetables, rice and sugar wholesale to stock her business and increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy rice, vegetables and sugar

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
Maxima es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Intocables” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos  hijos, la señora estudió educación superior. 
Con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos trabaja desde hace tres años, su primer préstamo solicitado por S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo invirtió en su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta al por mayor de fibras textiles - hilos y lanas.
Maxima  solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/ 1300.00 nuevos soles dinero que utilizará para comprar 200 libras de fibra de alpaca.  En su negocio a veces le ayudan su hermana y su mamá.  Su esposo trabaja en servicio urbano (transportista).
Su sueño es ser mayorista en el negocio.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es ahorrar y la ganancia.
texts.en:
Maxima is a member of “Las Intocables” (The Untouchables) community bank which is located in Puno district, in Puno province and department.  She is 39 years old, married, and has two children.  She completed her high school education.

Maxima has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she invested that money in her business.  Maxima sells textile fibers (threads and yarns) wholesale.

Maxima is requesting a new loan for 1,300 soles to buy 200 pounds of alpaca fiber.  Her sister and her mom sometimes help her in her business.  Her husband provides urban transport services.

Maxima's dream is to become a wholesaler in her business.

What Maxima likes about her community bank is saving and the profit.

loans.use: to buy 200 pounds of alpaca fiber

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es: Maria Lourdes tiene 45 años, es madre soltera con un hijo a su cargo. Desde hace mas de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que sus inicios son con esfuerzos propios, pues desde muy joven su Mama le enseño a ganarse la vida con la venta y elaboración de rosquillas, ya que ha sido un negocio de familia, pues le tenía que ayudar a su Mama a vender estos productos es por eso que lucha todos los días para darle esa oportunidad a sus hijos, a pesar de las difíciles situaciones que ha enfrentado sigue con esta actividad. Ella invertirá el financiamiento en leña, maíz, queso, cuajada, huevo, canela, mantequilla, leche entre otros productos indispensables. Sueña con mejorar su vivienda, pues todavía no tiene ciertos servicios básicos.
texts.en: Maria Lourdes is 45 years old. She is a single mother raising one son. For more than 5 years, she has worked at this business, which she started on her own. When she was very young, her mother taught her how to make a living making and selling rosquillas [doughnut shaped pastries]. This has been the family business and she had to help her mother sell these products. That is why she struggles every day to give her children that opportunity, despite the difficult situations she has faced with this activity. She will invest the loan in firewood, corn, cheese, egg, cinnamon, butter, milk and other indispensable products. She dreams of improving her home, since it doesn't have the basic utilities yet.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn, cheese, curd, eggs, cinnamon, butter and milk, among other indispensable products.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Intocables” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 25 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene un hijo.  La señora estudió educación superior. 
Se dedica a la venta de celulares, cámaras digitales y rollos, trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace seis años, su préstamo inicial fue de  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió  en su negocio.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 3000.00 nuevos soles comprará veinte unidades de celulares y cámaras, la señora trabaja sola en su negocio, su esposo trabaja elaborando joyas en Platería.
Su sueño es tener solvencia económica y satisfacer las necesidades de su familia.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y la responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Jessica is a member of the "Las Intocables" ("The Untouchables") community bank, located in the Puno district, province and department of Puno. She is 25 years old, married with a son. She has a higher education. 

She sells mobile phones, digital cameras and film. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for six years. Her first loan was for 3,000 soles, which she invested in her business. With this new loan of 3,000 soles she will buy twenty mobile phones and cameras. 

She works on her own in her business. Her husband makes silver jewellery. Her dream is to have enough money and meet the needs of her family. What she likes about the community bank is the punctuality and responsibility.

loans.use: to buy twenty mobile phones and cameras.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa S. is married and has four children. In order to supplement the income of her husband, who works with Zoomlion, a waste management company,Yaa prepares and sells kenkey, a popular Ghanaian dish made from fermented corn dough. Kenkey is usually served with pepper sauce and fried fish. Yaa would like to grow her business, and a loan from Kiva will allow her to purchase more corn and oil to increase her food production. She wants to save up enough to pay for her children’s tertiary education.

In the photo, Yaa is showing the soaked maize she uses for corn dough to prepare the kenkey.

loans.use: to purchase more corn and oil to increase her food production.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. runs a provisions stall in Eguafo Village, near the fishing town of Elmina. Educated up to junior high school, Mary has been running her stall for five years. She sells mostly food items such as tinned tomatoes and salt. To attract a larger customer base, she would like to add more variety to her stall. A loan will allow her to buy different food items, which she hopes will increase her sales. Additional profits will be pumped back into her business for further growth. 

Mary is married to a factory worker and they have one child. Her income helps pay for their kid’s school fees and the household utility bills.

loans.use: to buy different food items, which she hopes will increase her sales.

loans.name: Lizet

texts.es: Lizet tiene 31 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa en la comunidad de Villa Quintiarina junto  a su esposo  Carlos  de 35 años y sus 03 queridos hijos a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Lizet es una mujer muy laboriosa, y siempre trata de sobresalir ante las adversidades del destino. Ella es comerciante tiene un puesto de abarrotes situado en el mercado del distrito de Quimbiri, es así que la  bodega que posee es la primera en abrirse, a partir de las 06 de la mañana recibe a sus primeros compradores, pues tiene variedad de productos de primera necesidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 03 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer de pie casi todo el día. Con el tiempo piensa invertir sus ganancias y ampliar su negocio ya que tiene mucha demanda por parte de sus clientes. Este es su 12avo crédito de Lizet con MFP, siente que el dinero del crédito le ayudará mucho con el progreso de su trabajo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy  responsable. Con el crédito solicitado comprará más víveres para su negocio y así abastecerse de mercadería para su tienda.
texts.en:
Lizet, 31, is a very cheerful and hard working woman. She lives in her own home in the community of Villa Quintiarina alongside her ​​husband Carlos, 35, and their beloved 3 children, to whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. 

Lizet is a very hard working woman and she always tries to get over any adversities brought by fate. She is a trader and has a general store in the market of the district of Quimbiri. Her store is the first one to open. She receives the first buyers at 6 in the morning, and she has a variety of staple products.  What she likes the most about her job is talking to her customers. She has been in this line of business for 3 years and thinks that the hardest part is standing most of the day. Over time she plans to invest her profits and expand her business, because there's a great demand by her customers. 

This is Lizet's 12th loan with MFP and she believes the money of the loan will help her with her business. She is a very responsible partner in her communal bank. With the loan requested she will buy more supplies for her business to stock up merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to buy products to stock up her store.

loans.name: Favia Francisca

texts.es:
Favia es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Intocables” ubicado en el distrito D. Puno, provincia y departamento D. Puno, tiene 53 años D. edad, está casada y tiene tres  hijos.  La señora estudió educación superior técnico. 
Su primer préstamo solicitado del Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue por la suma D.  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo invirtió en su negocio D. venta D. artículos artesanales.
Actualmente se dedica a la venta D. buffet (comidas).  Paralelamente brinda servicio D. taxi (transporte).
Con éste nuevo préstamo D. S/ 2,300.00 nuevos soles comprará juegos D. vajillas y otros insumos para su negocio venta D. buffet.  Favia trabaja sola, su esposo trabaja en el magisterio y sus hijos trabajan en servicio D. taxi.
Su sueño es ser una gran empresaria en el rubro D. buffets.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo, la ganancia del ahorro y la amistad con las socias.
texts.en:
Favia is a member of the “Las Intocables” [The Untouchables] community bank, located in the district of Puno, province and departament of Puno. She is 53 years old, married and has three children. She has an education from a technical high school. She took out her first loan from the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the amount of S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, which she invested in selling artisanal crafts. 

At present, she sells catering food. She also runs a taxi service (transportation). With this new loan S/ 2,300.00 nuevos soles, she will buy sets of dishes and other materials for her catering business. Favia works alone and her husband works as a teacher. Her children also work in the taxi service.  

Her dream is to be a great businesswoman in the catering business. What she likes about the community bank is the ease in taking out loans, the interest on savings, and the friendship among the members.

loans.use: to buy sets of dishes and materials.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa B. is divorced and has five children. As the sole provider, she earns her money by making and selling kenkey. Kenkey is a favourite Ghanaian staple, made from fermented corn dough and usually served with pepper sauce and fried fish. She would like to expand her business by producing more kenkey for sale. A Kiva loan will allow her to purchase more corn and oil to make a larger quantity of kenkey. She plans to reinvest into her business and, ultimately, her long-term goal is to provide her children with a university education and also to purchase a piece of land, so that she can build a home of her own.

loans.use: to purchase more corn and oil to make a larger quantity of kenkey.

loans.name: Unidos Para Avanzar 1 & 2 Group

texts.en: Lidia lives in Santo Domingo, in one of the poorest communities surrounding the main city of the Dominican Republic. Lidia and her group of 10 members are taking loans for their businesses. This group is named Unidos para Avanzar 1 & 2 ("Unite to Win"). Lidia requires a loan to buy hot dog sausages, bread, mayonnaise, mustard, catsup and bottles of water. She runs a small business where she sells big bottles of water to her neighbors. Also, at night she sells hot dogs. She has been doing the water business for around 6 years. This is Lidia's second loan with Esperanza International. She is a single mother of three children. Her most difficult challenges are to help her children become professionals and to improve her business. She says that her favorite thing is to eat. Lidia and her group are thankful for your support!

loans.use: to buy water bottles, sausages, hot dog bread, mayonnaise, catsup, etc.

loans.name: Aunty

texts.en: Aunty S. is married with five children. Her husband is a security guard. For the past 10 years, Aunty S. has been making and selling kenkey, which is a popular Ghanaian staple made from fermented corn dough. Alongside her kenkey business, she also runs a provisions stall, where she sells food items such as salt and condensed milk, as shown in the photograph. Her income helps supplement her husband’s earnings, and she contributes to the payment of household expenses. She would like to increase her provisions business and so will use the loan to purchase more provisions to sell. She plans to build a provisions shop from her increased capital.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Joselin

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada Arroyo de pita la cual se caracteriza por ser la unica comunidad en varios kilometros  que cuanta con un bachillerato, en esta comunidad vive la señora Joselin L. que tiene la edad de 32 años, ella es profesora y es ta casada tiene dos hijos que asisten al preescolar de la comunidad.

Ella nos platica que hace un poco mas de un año inicio con su propio negocio de venta de zapatos por catalago, ella vende sus zapatos con sus compañeros de trabajo, amigos y vecinos de la comunidad.ella lleva sus catalagos con sus clientes, levanta un pedido, lo encarga con sus provedores y cuando llega el paquete  entrega sus productos y recibe su pago. ella decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio ya que la situacion economica cada dia esta mas dificil y el dinero no alcanza, tambien porque quiere iniciar a horrar para en un futuro poder pagarles una profesion a sus hijos.

Doña joselin necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de zapatos y catalagos para poder realizar su venta.
ella nos dice que espera que con esta invercion su negocio cresca y tanga mas clientes para que su venta y negocio cresca ya que en un futuro le gustaria poner una pequeña zapateria en la comunidad, ella tiene la esperanza de que cuando la ponga vender mucho yaque aun no existe este tipo de tiendas en su comunidad.
ella esta muy agradecida con la fundacion por el prestamo otorgado ya que no solo le ayudar en su negocio sino tambien podra darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
In the State of Oaxaca there is a community called Arroyo de Pita.  It is noted for the fact that it is the only community for several kilometers that has a senior high school.  32 year-old Joselin L. is a teacher.  She is married and has two children who are in pre-school in the community.

Joselin tells us that a little over a year ago she started her own business selling shoes through a catalog.  She sells shoes to her work colleagues, friends and neighbors in her community.  She takes the catalogs to her customers, fills in their orders, orders the products from her suppliers and, when the package arrives, she delivers her products and receives payment for them.  She decided to start working in her own business because the financial situation is becoming more and more difficult every day and money doesn't reach far enough.  She also wants to save for the future so that she can pay for her children to study towards a profession.

Joselin needs this loan to invest in buying shoes and catalogs so that she can make her sales.  She tells us that she hopes this investment will help her business to grow and that she will gain more customers so that her sales and business grow.  In the future, she would like to set up a small shoe store in her community.  She hopes that she will be able to sell a lot because there is no other store of this kind in her community.

Joselin is very grateful to Fundación Realidad for granting her this loan since it will help her not only in her business but also in providing her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy footwear to sell

loans.name: Rosa Rafael

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Intocables” ubicado en el distrito D. Puno, provincia y departamento D. Puno, tiene 57 años D. edad, es viuda y tiene tres hijos independientes, la señora estudió educación secundaria. 
Rosa se dedica a la venta D. artículos artesanales, trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace siete años, su primer  préstamo  solicitado que fue D.  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo invirtió  en su negocio.
Con éste nuevo préstamo D. S/ 2500.00 nuevos soles, comprará tres cajas D. etiquetas D. plástico, papel, cartón, costales, cincuenta amuletos y cincuenta dólares, todo estos en miniatura, para luego venderlos en diferentes departamentos del país.  La señora trabaja sola.
Su sueño es tener bien implementado su negocio y poder ofrecer otros productos más.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la ganancia del ahorro y la amistad D. las socias.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of “Las Intocables” (The Untouchables) community bank which is located in Puno district, in Puno province and department.  She is 57 years old, widowed, and has three children who live independently.  She completed her high school education.

Rosa sells handicrafts.  She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for seven years.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she invested that money in her business.

Rosa will use this new loan for 2,500 soles to buy three boxes of plastic tags, paper, card, bags, fifty charms and fifty dollars (miniature model ones) so that she can then sell them in different departments.  Rosa works alone.

Rosa's dream is to have a well-stocked business and to be able to offer more products for sale.

What Rosa likes about her community bank is the money she makes on her savings and the friendships she has with her fellow members.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making handicrafts such as paper, card, bags, charms, etc.

loans.name: Siempre Adelante Group

texts.es:
Clelia tiene 41 años de edad, casada, con 5 hijos. Pertenece como socia a la alcancìa comunal:"Siempre Adelante".
Clelia trabaja preparando desayunos al paso; vende maca, agua de manzana, leche de soya; y los acompaña con "sanguches", como por ejemplo: pan con queso, aceitunas, paltas, etc.
Clelia trabaja en esta actividad hace 12 años, y tiene su puesto al frente de la Universidad del Centro; tiene gran cantidad de clientes, por ofrecer desayunos econòmicos al alcance de los alumnos.
El prèstamo solicitado es para acondicionar la carretilla donde vende los desayunos.
(En la fotografìa Clelia esta en una de las fotos pequeñas y es la segunda de la izquierda, viste de polo color rosa y chompa color azul; no se encontraba presente al momento de la reuniòn porque llevo a su hijo al hospital)
La socia de la foto pequeña del extremo izquierdo, es Magdalena U. C., no estuvo presente por motivos de trabajo/ no tenìa con quièn dejar su tienda.
La socia de la foto pequeña del extremo derecho, Maria R. B., no estuvo presente por tener trabajos pendientes por entregar/ hace tipeos.
texts.en:
Clelia is 41 years old, married, and has five children.  She is a member of the 'Siempre Adelante' (Always Moving Forwards) community bank.

Cielia works preparing and selling breakfasts to go.  She sells a drink containing maca (a native plant), sweetened apple water and soy milk, and combines these drinks with sandwiches such as bread with cheese, olives, avocado, etc.

Cielia has been in this business for 12 years and her sales location is outside the Universidad del Centro.  She has a large number of customers as she offers cheap breakfasts that are affordable to the students.

Cielia is requesting a loan to equip her small cart from which she sells her breakfasts.

In the photograph, Cielia is in one of the small photos.  She is the second one from the left, wearing a pink top and a blue sweater.  She wasn't present when the meeting took place because she had to take her son to the hospital.

The member in the small photo on the far right is Magdalena U. C. who couldn't attend for work reasons (she didn't have anybody to mind her store).

The member in the small photo on the far left is Maria R. B. who couldn't attend because she had work which she needed to deliver (she types documents for people).

loans.use: to equip her small cart from which she sells breakfasts

loans.name: Abrewa

texts.en: Abrewa K. sells smoked fish in Eguafo near Elmina. She is married to a farmer. Abrewa has been selling smoked fish for seven years. She helps her husband with the payment of household expenditures. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale. She hopes to save the new profit towards the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
La señora Flor De María, es socia del banco comunal Las Dalilas del Distrito yarinacocha, departamento de Ucayali, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos que todavía están a su cargo.
Lleva 5 años dedicada a la venta de bebidas, el mismo tiempo que lleva trabajando con Manuela Ramos, su negocio esta ayudándole a conseguir cosas que antes eran imposibles como poder comprar algunas comodidades para su hogar.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,500.00 comprará:  15 cajas de cerveza, 10 cajas de gaseosa, 3 paquetes de agua  sin gas, 3 paquetes de agua con gas.
Su esposo le ayuda con la atención por las noches, porque durante el dio trabaja manejando moto car, dinero que también es bienvenido a su hogar.
Los dos trabajando han podido ir comprando algunas cosas que les faltaba y que eran bien necesarios en su hogar.
texts.en:
Flor De María is a member of the 'Las Dalilas' community bank which is located in Yarinacocha district, in Ucayali department.  She is 33 years old, married, and has two children still in her care.

Flor has been selling drinks for five years.  She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the same amount of time.  Her business is helping her to achieve things that were impossible in the past such as being able to buy some comforts for her home.

Flor will use her new loan for 2,500 Peruvian soles to buy 15 crates of beer, 10 crates of soda, 3 packets of still water and 3 packets of fizzy water.

Flor's husband helps her to serve in her business in the evenings because during the day he works driving a car, making money which is also welcome in their household.

Through their work, Flor and her husband have been able to buy some things that they were lacking before and which were really necessary for their home.

loans.use: to buy soda, beer and water

loans.name: Maame Aba

texts.en: Maame Aba A. runs a stall selling kenkey and other food items. Kenkey is a popular Ghanaian staple made from fermented corn dough. (It is displayed in the pink basin that Maame is holding in the photograph). It is usually served with pepper sauce and fried fish. Maame has been in this business for five years and is now looking to expand it. She intends to use her Kiva loan to purchase more food items to sell. Any additional profits she earns will be reinvested back into her business. Maame is married to a farmer and they have five children. Her income helps pay for the children's school fees and household utility bills.

loans.use: to purchase more food items to sell.

loans.name: Aldea Nimasac Group

texts.en:
Doña Isabel O. is the President of the Aldea Nimasac Group. Nimasac is the name of the home-town of the eleven group members. Isabel is 45 years old, married, and has 8 children. Her husband helps support the family by making and selling traditional clothing, while Isabel works raising and selling pigs and hens. Isabel has 15 years of experience with her business and hopes that this second loan with ASDIR and Kiva will help her to acheive her dream of running an even larger and more profitable operation. 

Doña Isabel notes that she started her business with help from her husband and their family savings. This loan will help her to purchase materials for the animal pens and also to purchase a few pigs and chickens. 

The Aldea Nimasac Group consists of 11 women who are engaged in different business activities including raising animals, making candles, manufacturing traditional clothing, firewood collection and sales, and daily consumer goods sales. This is the group´s second loan through ASDIR and Kiva. The first loan was paid back ahead of schedule with no problems.

loans.use: to purchase hens and pigs for animal raising business.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
La señora Gladis es socia del banco comunal La Dalilas, del Distrito Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 68 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos.
Son 3 años que viene trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, tiene una bodega en su casa, la cual atiende con la ayuda de su hija y su esposo.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 10 kilos de pescado seco, 3 kilos de fariña, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 saco de arroz, 2 bolsas de detergente, 1 caja de leche chica, 1 bolsa de fideos, 1 caja de aceite chico y 1 bolsa de lejía, 1 caja de mayonesa.
Todos estos años se ha dedicado a mantener a flote su negocio, con mucha dedicación, quiere tener una vejez tranquila sin depender de ninguno de sus hijos, no quieren ser una carga para ellos.
texts.en:
Gladis is a member of 'Las Dalilas' community bank which is located in Yarinacocha district, in Ucayali department.  She is 68 years old, married, and has four children.  She has been working with Manuela Ramos loans for three years.  She has a small grocery store in her home and she serves in her store with the help of her daughter and husband.

Gladis will use her new loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles to buy 10 kilos of dried fish, 3 kilos of flour, 1 sack of sugar, 2 bags of detergent, 1 box of milk, 1 bag of noodles, 1 box of oil, 1 bag of bleach and 1 box of mayonnaise. 

Over the years, Gladis has worked hard to keep her business afloat.  She has worked with a lot of commitment.  She would like to enjoy a relaxed old age without being dependent on any of her children.  She does not want to be a burden to them.

loans.use: to buy milk, flour, rice, etc.

loans.name: Las Azucenas Group

texts.es: La Sra. Alicia  es conviviente, tiene 4 hijos, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Las Azucenas” grupo  conformado por 10  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades D. comercio. Alicia  trabaja desD. hace  10 años en la venta D. Locería es decir platos D. material D. loza, tasas, también venD. tinas  D.  plástico, este negocio surge con la necesidad D. obtener mejores ingresos ya que ella deseaba darle una mejor calidad D. vida a sus hijos y sobretodo una buena educación, y que sus hijos tengan lo que ella nunca pudo tener, pero gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mejores ingresos económicos , sus hijos van a colegios privado,  ha construido su casa hasta el segundo piso, se ha comprado muebles, escritorio, y sobre todo su familia tiene una mejor calidad D. vida. Alicia  nos cuenta que en el futuro le gustaría tener una tienda propia y no pagar alquiler. Sabemos que Alicia cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en: Alicia has a live-in partner and 4 children. She is currently a member of the communal bank “Las Azucenas” ["The Lilies"], which consists of 10 members who dedicate themselves to various business activities. Alicia has worked for 10 years selling chinaware, that is, ceramic plates and cups. She also sells plastic basins. This business arose from the need to obtain a better income, since she wanted to proviD. a better quality of life for her children, and above all, a good education. She also wanted her children to have what she was never able to have. Thanks to her efforts and dedication, she has achieved a better income level, and her children go to private schools. She has built her house up to the second floor, and she has bought furniture and a desk. Above all, her family has a better quality of life. Alicia reports that in the future she would like to have her own store and not pay rent. It seems clear that Alicia will achieve her goals with hard work and effort, and that the loans from Edaprospo will help her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: Una alcancía con nuevos objetivos y nuevas metas, así se caracteriza la alcancía comunal La Nueva Esperanza integrada por 8 miembros hace más de un año. Cada integrante se identifica por la fortaleza y el entusiasmo por salir siempre adelante tal es así el caso de la señora Enma Natividad de 50 años de edad casada y con dos hijos. Ella se dedica diariamente a la venta de Ropa para niños desde hace 20 años y con el esfuerzo de tantos años de trabajo ha logrado obtener una casa propia y también puede compartir ahora los gastos del hogar con su esposo. Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá para compra de  ropa de mujer por la campaña del Día de la Madre. En el futuro  le gustaría comprarse un auto para ponerlo a trabajar como taxi y a si mejorar su condición económica trayendo mejores ingresos a su hogar.
texts.en: A communal bank with new objectives and new goals -- that description characterizes the "Nueva Esperanza" ["New Hope"] communal bank, made up of 8 members and existing for more than a year. Each member can be identified by her strength and enthusiasm for continuous progress. This is the case with Enma Natividad, age 50, who is married with two children. She works every day selling children's clothing. She has done this work for 20 years, and with the efforts of so many years of work, she has been able to acquire her own home and also she can share the household expenses with her husband. She will use this loan to invest in buying women's clothing for the Mother's Day sales campaign. In the future, she would like to buy a car and use it to provide taxi services, thus bringing a higher income to her household and improving her economic condition.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing to sell.

loans.name: Barrio Lindo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BARRIO LINDO” iniciará su primer ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Paula. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de monederos de cuero, trenzado de mantas, transporte, venta de comida, costura en general, pensión familiar, venta de comida, venta de leche.

La señora Paula,  indica que es la primera vez que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de Marina, promotora que vino a la zona de Barrio Lindo. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de costura de ropa de mujer que trabaja desde que migro a Brasil hace 20 años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de telas (que servirá para incrementar su capital), las que adquirirá de la calle Mariscal santa Cruz, Max Paredes, galería La Paz; posteriormente elaborados sus productos los venderá por mayor, con la ayuda de su esposo y sus costureros. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la facilidad de préstamo de dinero para aumentar ingresos.
texts.en:
The “BARRIO LINDO” (Beautiful Neighborhood) community bank is just starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Cascada regional office.  The group has eight members and is run by an executive committee which is led by Paula.  The businesses that the bank members are engaged in are varied and include: selling leather change purses, braiding blankets, transport, selling food, sewing, running a small family restaurant, selling food and selling milk. 

Paula tells us that this is the first time she has joined a Pro Mujer community bank.  She joined via an invitation from Marina, a promotor who came to Barrio Lindo.  Paula has a dressmaking workshop where she makes women's clothes.  She has been working there since she migrated from Brazil 20 years ago.

Paula will use the loan that she has requested to buy fabrics (which will help her to increase her capital).  She will buy her fabrics in Mariscal Santa Cruz Street, Max Paredes, La Paz.  She will then sell the products that she makes wholesale, with the help of her husband and her seamstresses.  This work allows Paula to make money to support her family.  She is married and has three children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the ease of the loans which give you money with which to increase your income.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Los Palmares 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
This group is named Los Palmares 4 & 5 (The palms) and it is located in Santo Domingo, in a community north of Main city. Melania and the 9 other members are taking loans for their businesses.

Melania requires a loan to buy fabrics and costume items to make blankets, bedding sets and t-shirts. This is Melania´s first loan with Esperanza International. She will take a step toward improving her business by investing this loan to increase her services and sales. 

She has had her business for 1 year. She lives in a simple home with her 2 children and her long-term partner. Her most difficult challenges were to raise her children after she became single (got divorced from her children's father) and didn't have a husband to help her with the needs in her house, so she had to start working for income and to take care of her children.

She says that her favorite thing is to take care of her children and to spend time with them at their home. Melania and her group are thankful for your support!

loans.use: to buy fabric and other costume items for blankets and bedding sets.

loans.name: Llerle

texts.es:
La señora Llerle es socia del banco comunal Madres Coraje del Distrito de Yarinacocha, departamento de Ucayali, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos.
Lleva 2 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica a la de repostería, prepara tortas y lo hace de forma constante, todos los fines de semana.
Con éste préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles comprará:una máquina amasadora de 5 kilos.
La máquina le es muy necesaria porque hay días que tiene que amasar 5 kilos de harina y con una batidora tiene que hacerlo en 2 tiempos, también da trabajo a una persona para que le ayude en los batidos mientras esta ocupada haciendo la masa para el forrado de las tortas.
Su negocio es rentable pero tiene que invertir mucho de su tiempo capacitándose en los talleres que ofrecen las profesoras que vienen de la ciudad de lima.
Está muy contenta con su trabajo y con las cosas que puede tener a base de su esfuerzo y dedicación
texts.en:
Llerle is a member of the "Madres Coraje" (Mothers Courage) community bank which is located in Yarinacocha district, in Ucayali department.  She is 40 years old, married, and has three children.  She has been working with Manuela Ramos loans for two years.  Llerle makes pastries and desserts.  She makes pies, and does so constantly, every weekend.

Llerle will use this loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy a 5 kilo kneading machine.  She really needs the machine because there are days when she has to knead 5 kilos of flour and with a mixer she has to do it in two stages.  Llerle provides work to one person who helps her with her mixing while she is busy making the dough for the lining of the pies.

Llerle's business is profitable but she has to invest a lot of time receiving training in the workshops offered by teachers who come from the city of Lima.

Llerle is very happy with her work and with the things that she is able to have as a result of her effort and commitment.

loans.use: to buy a kneading machine

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
Gloria tiene la edad de 48 años, casada con una bella familia de tres hijos. De oficio modista, profesión con ocho años de experiencia, ha tenido que trabajar mucho para lograr hacer su vivienda con el cual ha venido mejorando poco a poco con ahorros de su trabajo anterior como supervisora de limpieza, y con el apoyo de su esposo el cual labora de conductor.
Su negocio lo inicio con el fin de poder tener mejore ingresos, cuidar mejor su casa, como su familia.
Hoy desea hacer un bajarte, ya que el que tiene le cubre en frente de la casa pero en el invierno se le mete el agua ya que no es cerrado y desea mejorar esta situación cerrando por completo. Lo que recurre al financiamiento para poder hacer esta mejora en el cual comprara: diez laminas de zinc, diez perlines y cemento para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Gloria is 48 years old, married and has a lovely family with three children.  Gloria is a dressmaker by trade, a profession in which she has eight years of experience.  She has had to work a lot to create her home.  She has been improving it little by little with earnings from her previous work as a cleaning supervisor, and with the support of her husband who works as a driver.  

She started her business for better income and to be able to take better care of her home, as well as her family.  Now Gloria would like to build a porch.  The one she has covers the front of the house but in the winter, water gets in since it's not fully closed.  She wants to improve this situation by closing it completely.  

This loan will be used to buy ten zinc sheets, ten purlins and cement to begin the work.

loans.use: purchase purlins and zinc sheets to make a porch and live in better conditions.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La señora Celia es  socia del banco comunal Las Dalilas del Distrito de Yarinacocha,  de Ucayali, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos que todavía están a su cargo.
Hace muy poco que viene trabajando con los  préstamos  de Manuela Ramos, pero que muy bien ha sabido aprovechar porque en el corto tiempo que está ya tiene bien surtido su negocio de confección y refacción de de zapatos.
Con éste préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles, comprará: 6 metros de bio cuero de diferentes colores, 6 docenas adornos de diferentes formas, 1 docenas de plantas de zapatos de diferentes tallas.
Sus zapatos son vendidos  muy rápidos,  porque los ofrece a precios cómodos y son muy durables.
Parte de las ganancias la invierte en materiales y otra parte lo guarda para alguna emergencia, separando de antemano la cuota a Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Celia is a member of 'Las Dalilas' community bank which is located in Yarinacocha district, in Ucayali.  She is 45 years old, married, and has two children who are still in her care.

Celia has not been working with Manuela Ramos loans for very long but she has known how to make the most of them because in that short space of time she has managed to stock her business well.  Her business is making and mending shoes.

Celia will use this loan for 1,200 Peruvian soles to buy 6 meters of bio leather in different colors, six dozen decorative pieces in different shapes, and one dozen soles in different sizes.

Celia's shoes sell out very quickly because they are very hard-wearing and she offers them for sale at affordable prices.

Celia invests part of her profits in buying materials and she keeps the rest to one side in case of emergency, after first having put aside her repayment to Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: to buy bio leather

loans.name: Katia Dolores

texts.es:
La señora Katia es socia del banco comunal Madres Coraje del Distrito de Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada tiene 4 hijos pero solo 2 de ellos siguen a su cargo.
Se dedica a la venta de verduras de la región en un mercado de la zona, trabaja desde las primeras horas de la mañana hasta las 11:00 am., hora en la que regresa a su casa para poder atender a sus hijos y a su esposo.

Lleva 4 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos que le han servido para seguir trabajando y de esa forma contribuir con los gastos de su hogar, su esposo trabaja haciendo taxi en su motocar (transportista).
Con éste préstamo de S/. 1,200 nuevos soles comprará: 1 ciento de limones pequeños, 1 ciento de ají dulce, 20 atados de culantro de la región, 5 atados de sacha culantro, 5 kilos de ají charapita .
Con el negocio que tiene puede dar a sus hijos un poco mas de comodidad y todas las facilidades para que vayan a estudiar sin que les pudiera faltar nada.
texts.en:
Katia is a member of the 'Madres Coraje' (Mothers Courage) community bank which is located in Yarinacocha district, in Ucayali department.  She is 39 years old, married, and has four children (only two of whom are still in her care).  Katia sells regional vegetables in a local market.  She works from the very first hours of the day until 11.00am when she returns home to look after her children and her husband.

Katia has been working with Manuela Ramos loans for four years.  They have helped her to keep working and contributing to her household expenses.  Her husband offers a taxi service in his car.

Katia will use this loan for 1,200 Peruvian soles to buy 100 small lemons, 100 sweet peppers, 20 bunches of local culantro (a herb), 5 bunches of sacha culantro and 5 kilos of chili peppers.

Thanks to her business, Katia is able to provide her children with a little more comfort and the opportunity to go to school without lacking anything.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and citrus fruit

loans.name: Claveles Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CLAVELES” iniciará su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Tejada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Maria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de tarjetas, venta de chompas, venta de comida, venta de café, venta de artículos de limpieza, venta de repuestos de autos, confección de prendas de vestir, confección de chamarras, confección de mantas.

La señora María, indica que hace diez años que trabaja con Pro Mujer. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida que aprendió de sus padres y de la escuela evangélica desde hace quince años, ganado muchos clientes. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para incremento de mercadería (para la elaboración de comida), las que comprará en El Alto, en la 12 de octubre y lo venderá en su puesto fijo de lunes a viernes. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro y el préstamo rápido.
texts.en:
The “CLAVELES” (Carnations) community bank is about to start its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Tejada regional office.  The group has eight members and is managed by an executive committee which is led by María.  The businesses that the members are engaged in are varied and include: selling cards, selling sweaters, selling food, selling coffee, selling cleaning products, selling car parts, making clothes, making jackets and making blankets.

María tells us that she has been working with Pro Mujer for ten years.  She currently has a business selling food.  This is a business that she learned from her parents and her evangelical school.  She has been in this business for fifteen years and has a lot of customers.

María will use her loan to increase her merchandise (to prepare her food).  She will buy her merchandise in El Alto, in the 12 de Octubre neighborhood and will make her sales from her fixed sales location, from Monday to Friday.  This work allows María to make money to support her family.  She is married and has four children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the savings and the speed with which you can get a loan.

loans.use: to invest in merchandise

loans.name: El Futuro 1 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Gladis is the coordinator of her group El Futuro (The Future)1 & 2. Her group is located in the areas surrounding La Romana, an area economically dominated by the sugarcane harvest. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband.

Gladis is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. She runs a Colmado (a food store selling daily meals). The loan will allow her to buy rice, beans, canned food, sugar, vegetables, cooking oil, etc. She will use the profits to save and reinvest in her business. 

She said that her most difficult challenge has been to establish her business and improved it. Her dream is to have a supermarket and to like safe and tranquil at her home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, canned food, sugar, vegetables, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Mirian Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mirian de 29 años, es una mujer emprendedora en su actividad ya que por medio de unos amigos empezó en la venta de productos naturales ya que la gente si los consumen.

Ella labora desde muy temprano haciendo promoción de sus productos a amigos vecinos y parientes que si conozcan. Ella hace pedidos de sus productos de omnilife para sus clientes por cajas y los vende por unidad. Con el préstamo quiere comprar mas productos omnilife para aumentar sus ingresos. En un futuro quiere poner su negocio juntos con su esposo una vitrinas de sus productos ya que el tiene un cyber en el local.
texts.en:
Mirian is 29 years old.  She is an entrepreneurial woman.  Through some friends, she started selling natural products since people do use them.

She works from very early in the day promoting her products to her friends, neighbors and relatives.  She makes orders for her Omnilife products for her customers.  She buys them by the box and sells them as individual units.  She would like to use her loan to buy more Omnilife products to increase her income.  In the future, she would like to install a display case of her products in her husband's business since he owns an Internet café.

loans.use: to buy natural products (Omniplus and Bicacro)

loans.name: Santos Eustacio

texts.es:
El señor Santos Eustacio E. tiene 60 años de edad, esta casado y en estos momentos no tiene hijos que dependen de el. 
Santos tiene mas de 50 años de vivir en ese lugar y se a dedicado durante mucho tiempo a la agricultura siembra de maiz, sandias, frijoles, ayote.
Santos hace poco empezo con el negocio de fabricacion de ladrillos y tejas, tiene dos operarios que le fabrican el material, despues lo moldean y luego es quemado para ser vendido.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de leña, tierra y barro que son la materia prima para la elaboracion de los ladrillos y tejas, este material se escasea en el invierno y quiere estar preparado para no tener problemas con su produccion.
Don santos es una persona callada pero es muy responsable con sus compromisos.
texts.en:
Mr. Santos Eustacio E. is 60 years old, married, and he doesn't have any children who are still dependent.

Santos has lived in this place for 50 years and for a very long time he has dedicated himself to agriculture, planting corn, watermelons, beans, and squash. 

Santos recently started producing bricks and shingles. He has two operators that produce the material, form the products, and fire them for later resale.

The loan will be used to purchase wood, earth, and clay, as these are the basic materials to make bricks and shingles. These materials are in short supply in the winter and he wants to be ready so as to avoid problems with production.

Santos is a quiet person but he is very responsible with his commitments.

loans.use: to purchase earth, clay, and firewood.

loans.name: Florencia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Florencia de 64 años, es una mujer trabajadora que empezó su trabajo por medio de un dinero que tenia reunido y así abrió su negocio.

Ella labora en su tienda de 9H00am A 19H00 pm con el apoyo de su esposo y cada dos semanas compra la mercadería para su negocio. Con el préstamo quiere comprar mas mercadería como cuadernos, hojas y libros por docenas. Ella anhela tener su papelería bien surtidos para sus cliente.
texts.en:
Florencia is 64 years old. She is a hardworking woman that started her business with some money she had saved and this is how she opened her business.

Her store is open for business from 9am to 7pm and she has her husband's support. Every two weeks she purchases merchandise for her business. With the loan she wants to purchase more merchandise such as notebooks, loose leaf paper, and books by the dozens. She strives to have a well-stocked supply store for her clients.

loans.use: to purchase notebooks, loose leaf paper, books, and office supplies.
